lines.value: this was vetoed by prime minister john curtin and the appointment unexpectedly went to acting air commodore george jones
lines.name: English

lines.value: a mooted inspector generalship of the air force which would have seen williams reporting directly to the minister for air also failed to materialise

lines.value: following his completion of duty in the air force williams was appointed australia's director general of civil aviation serving in the position for almost 10 years

lines.value: the music video for la la directed by joseph kahn and edited by david blackburn was filmed over two days november 11 12 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: it debuted on aol's first view on november 22 and on mtv's making the video on november 23 the making of the video was also featured in episode three of the second season of the ashlee simpson show which aired in february 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the video's premiere la la debuted at number ten on the trl countdown on december 1 2004 it subsequently reached number six its peak on its third day on the countdown
lines.name: English

lines.value: it remained on the countdown for nine days
lines.name: English

lines.value: the video takes place in a suburban setting and was filmed in huntington beach california
lines.name: English

lines.value: simpson is seen singing the song dancing on top of a car in front of a donut shop and laying on a couch playing tony hawk's pro skater 3 and tony hawk's pro skater 4 on xbox all during daylight
lines.name: English

lines.value: the video continues with a raucous late night party around a swimming pool which gets broken up by the police and then simpson and the crowd head to a laundromat where the wild partying continues
lines.name: English

lines.value: simpson's two best friends lauren and stephanie appear alongside her in the video
lines.name: English

lines.value: simpson compared the video to the 1982 movie fast times at ridgemont high
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the ashlee simpson show during the filming of the video there is a scene in which simpson licks a couch cushion while rolling around on it for sexual imagery but as she explains it was taken out of the video because it was a little much
lines.name: English

lines.value: simpson promoted the song with a number of television performances in december 2004 and january 2005 see list below with several uk performances in january
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of her us performances at the orange bowl football game halftime show in early january her first time performing in a stadium was memorable for the harsh reception the song received from the audience with a discernible chorus of boos after she finished singing according to the associated press
lines.name: English

lines.value: simpson was the last of three performances during the halftime show and she later said that there were technical problems and that she couldn't hear herself properly making the performance more difficult for her
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cause of the booing she received has been variously attributed to a backlash against her because of her snl incident the previous october to the poor quality of her singing and to the fact that the crowd was generally not in the same age bracket as her usual fans
lines.name: English

lines.value: simpson herself said maybe they were booing at me maybe they were booing at the halftime show cause the whole thing sucked and also said that it may have been because of the team she was supporting i can't make everybody happy she said
lines.name: English

lines.value: simpson also had to change the lyrics to la la because of concern that they were too sexual for the show for instance a reference to lemonade replaced french maid
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 2005 new zealand's children tv show what now held a weekly music video poll with the song la la being one of the three candidates
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song was competing against 1 2 step by ciara and missy elliott and let me love you by mario
lines.name: English

lines.value: la la won the poll narrowly beating mario who was second by a few votes
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1 2 step came third
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 1 2005 when simpson was a guest on muchmusic's muchondemand in canada la la received the most votes from viewers out of three of simpson's videos and was played
lines.name: English

lines.value: simpson correctly guessed that la la would win
lines.name: English

lines.value: * aol music video of simpson performing la la
lines.name: English

lines.value: chrysopogon zizanioides commonly known as vetiver derived from the tamil வெட்டிவேர் veṭṭiver is a perennial bunchgrass of the poaceae family native to india
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver is most closely related to sorghum but shares many morphological characteristics with other fragrant grasses such as lemongrass cymbopogon citratus citronella cymbopogon nardus c
lines.name: English

lines.value: winterianus and palmarosa cymbopogon martinii
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver grows to high and form clumps as wide
lines.name: English

lines.value: under favorable conditions the erect culms can reach 3m in height
lines.name: English

lines.value: the stems are tall and the leaves are long thin and rather rigid
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flowers are brownish purple
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike most grasses which form horizontally spreading mat like root systems vetiver's roots grow downward to in depth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vetiver bunch grass has a gregarious habit and grows in tufts
lines.name: English

lines.value: shoots growing from the underground crown make the plant frost and wildfire resistant and allow it to survive heavy grazing pressure
lines.name: English

lines.value: the leaves can become up to long and wide
lines.name: English

lines.value: the panicles are to long and have whorled to long branches
lines.name: English

lines.value: the spikelets are in pairs and there are three stamens
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plant stems are erect and stiff
lines.name: English

lines.value: they can survive deep water flow
lines.name: English

lines.value: under clear water the plant can survive up to two months
lines.name: English

lines.value: the root system of vetiver is finely structured and very strong
lines.name: English

lines.value: it can grow to deep within the first year
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver has neither stolons nor rhizomes
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of all these characteristics the vetiver plant is highly drought tolerant and can help to protect soil against sheet erosion
lines.name: English

lines.value: in case of sediment deposition new roots can grow out of buried nodes
lines.name: English

lines.value: though it originates in india c
lines.name: English

lines.value: zizanioides is widely cultivated in tropical regions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the major vetiver producers include haiti india indonesia and reunion
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most commonly used commercial genotypes of vetiver are sterile do not produce fertile seeds and because vetiver propagates itself by small offsets instead of underground stolons these genotypes are noninvasive and can easily be controlled by cultivation of the soil at the boundary of the hedge
lines.name: English

lines.value: however care must be taken because fertile genotypes of vetiver have become invasive
lines.name: English

lines.value: almost all vetiver grown worldwide is vegetatively propagated bioengineering has shown them as essentially the same nonfertile cultigen by dna profiling
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the united states the cultivar is named sunshine after the town of sunshine louisiana
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver grass is grown for many purposes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plant helps to stabilise soil and protects it against erosion but it can also protect fields against pests and weeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver has favourable qualities for animal feed
lines.name: English

lines.value: from the roots oil is extracted and used for cosmetics aromatherapy herbal skincare and ayurvedic soap
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to its fibrous properties the plant can also be used for handicrafts ropes and more
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver has been used to produce perfumes creams and soaps
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is used for its antiseptic properties to treat acne and sores
lines.name: English

lines.value: several aspects of vetiver make it an excellent erosion control plant in warmer climates
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver's roots grow almost exclusively downward to which is deeper than some tree roots
lines.name: English

lines.value: this makes vetiver an excellent stabilizing hedge for stream banks terraces and rice paddies and protects soil from sheet erosion
lines.name: English

lines.value: the roots bind to the soil therefore it can not dislodge
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver has been used to stabilize railway cuttings embankments in geologically challenging situations in an attempt to prevent mudslides and rockfalls such as the konkan railway in western india
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plant also penetrates and loosens compacted soils
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vetiver system a technology of soil conservation and water quality management is based on the use of the vetiver plant
lines.name: English

lines.value: the close growing culms help to block surface water runoff
lines.name: English

lines.value: it slows the water flow and increases the amount absorbed by the soil infiltration
lines.name: English

lines.value: it can withstand water velocity up to 5 m s
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver mulch increases water infiltration and reduces evaporation thus protects soil moisture under hot and dry conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mulch also protects against splash erosion
lines.name: English

lines.value: in west african regions such as mali and senegal vetiver roots were traditionally used to reduce bacteria proliferation in water jugs and jars
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver can be used for crop protection
lines.name: English

lines.value: it attracts the stem borer chilo partellus which lay their eggs preferentially on vetiver
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to the hairy architecture of vetiver the larvae can not move on the leaves fall to the ground and die
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver's essential oil has anti fungal properties against rhizoctonia solani
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a mulch vetiver is used for weed control in coffee cocoa and tea plantations
lines.name: English

lines.value: it builds a barrier in the form of a thick mat
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the mulch breaks down soil organic matter is built up and additional crop nutrients become available
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver extracts can repel termites
lines.name: English

lines.value: however vetiver grass alone unlike its extracts cannot be used to repel termites
lines.name: English

lines.value: unless the roots are damaged the anti termite chemicals such as nootkatone are not released
lines.name: English

lines.value: the leaves of vetiver are a useful byproduct to feed cattle goats sheep and horses
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nutritional content depends on season growth stage and soil fertility
lines.name: English

lines.value: under most climates nutritional values and yields are best if vetiver is cut every 1 3 months
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver khus is also used as a flavoring agent usually as khus syrup
lines.name: English

lines.value: khus syrup is made by adding khus essence to sugar water and citric acid syrup
lines.name: English

lines.value: khus essence is a dark green thick syrup made from the roots
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a woody taste and a scent characteristic of khus
lines.name: English

lines.value: the syrup is used to flavor milkshakes and yogurt drinks like lassi but can be used in ice creams mixed beverages such as shirley temples and as a dessert topping
lines.name: English

lines.value: khus syrup does not need to be refrigerated although khus flavored products may need to be
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver is mainly cultivated for the fragrant essential oil distilled from its roots
lines.name: English

lines.value: in perfumery the older french spelling vetyver is often used
lines.name: English

lines.value: worldwide production is estimated at about 250 tons per annum
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to its excellent fixative properties vetiver is used widely in perfumes
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is contained in 90% of all western perfumes
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver is a more common ingredient in fragrances for men some notable examples include dior's eau sauvage guerlain vetiver m vetiver by une nuit a bali zizan by ormonde jayne and vetiver by l'occitane en provence
lines.name: English

lines.value: indonesia china and haiti are major producers
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver processing was introduced to haiti in the 1940s by frenchman lucien ganot
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1958 franck leger established a plant on the grounds of his father demetrius leger's alcohol distillery
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plant was taken over in 1984 by franck's son pierre leger who expanded the size of the plant to 44 atmospheric stills each built to handle one metric ton of vetiver roots
lines.name: English

lines.value: total production increased in ten years from 20 to 60 tonnes annually making it the largest producer in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plant extracts vetiver oil by steam distillation
lines.name: English

lines.value: another major operation in the field is the one owned by the boucard family
lines.name: English

lines.value: reunion is considered to produce the highest quality vetiver oil called bourbon vetiver with the next favorable being haiti and then java
lines.name: English

lines.value: the united states europe india and japan are the main consumers
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver oil or khus oil is a complex oil containing over 100 identified components typically the oil is amber brown and viscous
lines.name: English

lines.value: its odor is described as deep sweet woody smoky earthy amber and balsam
lines.name: English

lines.value: the best quality oil is obtained from 18 to 24-month-old roots
lines.name: English

lines.value: the roots are dug up cleaned and then dried
lines.name: English

lines.value: before distillation the roots are chopped and soaked in water
lines.name: English

lines.value: the distillation process can take up to 24 hours
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the distillate separates into the essential oil and hydrosol the oil is skimmed off and allowed to age for a few months to allow some undesirable notes forming during distillation to dissipate
lines.name: English

lines.value: like patchouli and sandalwood essential oils vetiver's odor develops and improves with aging
lines.name: English

lines.value: the oil's characteristics can vary significantly depending on where the grass is grown and the climate and soil conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the oil distilled in haiti and reunion has a more floral quality and is considered of higher quality than the smokier oil from java
lines.name: English

lines.value: in north india oil is distilled from wild growing vetiver
lines.name: English

lines.value: this oil is known as khus or khas and in india is considered superior to the oil obtained from the cultivated variety
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is rarely found in commerce outside of india as most of it is consumed within the country
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver has been used in traditional medicine in south asia india pakistan sri lanka southeast asia malaysia indonesia thailand and west africa
lines.name: English

lines.value: old tamil literature mentions the use of vetiver for medical purposes
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the indian subcontinent khus vetiver roots is often used to replace the straw or wood shaving pads in evaporative coolers
lines.name: English

lines.value: when cool water runs for months over wood shavings in evaporative cooler padding they tend to accumulate algae bacteria and other microorganisms
lines.name: English

lines.value: this causes the cooler to emit a fishy or seaweed smell
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver root padding counteracts this odor
lines.name: English

lines.value: a cheaper alternative is to add vetiver cooler perfume or even pure khus attar to the tank
lines.name: English

lines.value: another advantage is that vetiver padding does not catch fire as easily as dry wood shavings
lines.name: English

lines.value: mats made by weaving vetiver roots and binding them with ropes or cords are used in india to cool rooms in a house during summer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mats are typically hung in a doorway and kept moist by spraying with water periodically they cool the passing air as well as emitting a fresh aroma
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the hot summer months in india sometimes a muslin sachet of vetiver roots is tossed into the earthen pot that keeps a household's drinking water cool
lines.name: English

lines.value: like a bouquet garni the bundle lends distinctive flavor and aroma to the water
lines.name: English

lines.value: khus scented syrups are also sold
lines.name: English

lines.value: a recent study found the plant is capable of growing in fuel contaminated soil
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition the study discovered the plant is also able to clean the soil so in the end it is almost fuel free
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver grass is used as roof thatch it lasts longer than other materials mud brick making for housing construction such bricks have lower thermal conductivity strings and ropes and ornamentals for the light purple flowers
lines.name: English

lines.value: garlands made of vetiver grass are used to adorn the murti of lord nataraja shiva in hindu temples
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a favourite offering to ganesha
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver oil has been used in an effort to track where mosquitoes live during dry seasons in sub saharan africa
lines.name: English

lines.value: mosquitoes were tagged with strings soaked in vetiver oil then released
lines.name: English

lines.value: dogs trained to track the scent not native to africa found the marked mosquitoes in such places as holes in trees and in old termite mounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: vetiver is planted in long straight rows across the slope for easy mechanical harvesting
lines.name: English

lines.value: the soil should be wet
lines.name: English

lines.value: trenches are to deep
lines.name: English

lines.value: a modified seedling planter or mechanical transplanter can plant large numbers of vetiver slips in the nursery
lines.name: English

lines.value: flowering and nonflowering varieties are used for cultivation
lines.name: English

lines.value: sandy loam nursery beds ensure easy harvest and minimal damage to plant crowns and roots
lines.name: English

lines.value: open space is recommended because shading slows growth
lines.name: English

lines.value: overhead irrigation is recommended for the first few months after planting
lines.name: English

lines.value: more mature plants prefer flood irrigation
lines.name: English

lines.value: weed control may be needed during establishment phase by using atrazine after planting
lines.name: English

lines.value: to control termites that attack dead material hexachlorobenzene also known as benzene hexachloride bch can be applied to the vetiver hedge
lines.name: English

lines.value: brown spot seems to have no effect on vetiver growth
lines.name: English

lines.value: black rust in india is vetiver specific and does not cross infect other plants
lines.name: English

lines.value: in china stemborers chilo spp have been recognised but they seem to die once they get into the stems
lines.name: English

lines.value: further vetiver is affected by didymella andropogonis on leaves didymosphaeria andropogonis on dead culms lulworthia medusa on culms and ophiosphaerella herpotricha
lines.name: English

lines.value: only in malaysia whiteflies seem to be a problem
lines.name: English

lines.value: pest management is done by using insecticides and by appropriate cultural management hedges are cut to 3 cm above ground at the end of the growing season
lines.name: English

lines.value: in general vetiver is tolerant to herbicides and pesticides
lines.name: English

lines.value: harvest of mature plants is performed mechanically or manually
lines.name: English

lines.value: a machine uproots the mature stock to below ground
lines.name: English

lines.value: to avoid damaging the plant crown a single blade mouldboard plough or a disc plough with special adjustment is used
lines.name: English

lines.value: the coras iompair eireann 501 class locomotives were built in 1955 by walker brothers limited of wigan lancashire for use on the narrow gauge () lines on the west clare section of cie
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were small diesel mechanical locomotives of 0-4-0+0-4-0 wheel arrangement
lines.name: English

lines.value: controlled from a central cab the locomotives had two gardner engines of one under each end casing driving through a fluid coupling and wilson gear box the inner axle of the opposite bogie through a spiral bevel reverse and reduction gear box
lines.name: English

lines.value: unusually the locomotives were driven from a seat mounted sideways to the direction of travel giving a clear field of vision both ways by a mere turn of the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: the locomotives were fitted with vacuum brakes emergency braking coming from a deadman's pedal one at the driving position and two others one mounted on each side of the cab
lines.name: English

lines.value: when used on freight services their maximum speed was but with an overdrive fitted released by a key this was raised to for passenger trains
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were originally numbered c31-c33 in the west clare steam locomotive series but were subsequently renumbered into the diesel locomotive series as f501-f503
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were withdrawn in 1961 when the west clare lines were closed and stored at inchicore works for seven years
lines.name: English

lines.value: the isle of man railway made an offer for the locomotives which was rejected by cie who subsequently made less money by selling them for scrap in 1968
lines.name: English

lines.value: the walker 501 class has been made as a 00 gauge brass kit by worsley works models
lines.name: English

lines.value: * http://www.worsleyworks.co.uk official website
lines.name: English

lines.value: sir robert robin mcdowall gray born 2 july 1931 is a former new zealand politician
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was an mp from 1978 to 1996 and served as speaker of the house of representatives between 1990 and 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: gray was born in borgue scotland
lines.name: English

lines.value: after serving in the british army he moved to new zealand to take up farming in 1952 eventually settling in mosgiel
lines.name: English

lines.value: he joined the national party in 1956 and held a number of positions in its internal hierarchy
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1978 elections he was elected to replace peter gordon as mp for clutha
lines.name: English

lines.value: gray became the national party's junior whip in 1985 and the senior whip in 1987
lines.name: English

lines.value: when national won office in the 1990 elections gray was made speaker of the house of representatives
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the 1993 elections however the national party held a majority of only a single seat - as the speaker could not vote reappointing gray to the speakership would leave parliament deadlocked
lines.name: English

lines.value: national therefore offered the speakership to peter tapsell of the labour party
lines.name: English

lines.value: gray was appointed to the sinecure of minister of state and also became associate minister of foreign affairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1994 new year honours gray was made a knight bachelor
lines.name: English

lines.value: he retired from politics at the 1996 elections
lines.name: English

lines.value: as speaker of the house of representatives gray was entitled to the title of the honourable and became the hon sir robert robin mcdowall gray which is a title he was granted for the rest of his life after leaving parliament
lines.name: English

lines.value: gray effectively retired following his stepping down as an mp but still makes occasional appearances and commentary at various conferences around new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has undertaken mild criticism aimed at the national party for failing to promote members interests at conferences to which he achieved a degree of success in ensuring delegate's had more opportunity for engagement at the formal meetings
lines.name: English

lines.value: gray also sits as the founding president on the board of trustees for the new zealand business and parliament trust
lines.name: English

lines.value: in physics terahertz time domain spectroscopy thz-tds is a spectroscopic technique in which the properties of matter are probed with short pulses of terahertz radiation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the generation and detection scheme is sensitive to the sample's effect on both the amplitude and the phase of the terahertz radiation
lines.name: English

lines.value: by measuring in the time domain the technique can provide more information than conventional fourier transform spectroscopy which is only sensitive to the amplitude
lines.name: English

lines.value: typically an ultrashort pulsed laser is used in the terahertz pulse generation process
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the use of low temperature grown gaas as an antenna the ultrashort pulse creates charge carriers which are accelerated to create the terahertz pulse
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the use of non linear crystals as a source a high intensity ultrashort pulse is used to produce thz radiation from the crystal
lines.name: English

lines.value: a single terahertz pulse can contain frequency components covering much of the terahertz range often from 0.05 to 4 thz though the use of an air plasma can contain frequency components up to 40 thz
lines.name: English

lines.value: after thz pulse generation the pulse is directed by optical techniques and can be focused through a sample and then measured
lines.name: English

lines.value: the time domain aspect of tdts is typically achieved by using a beamsplitter to split one ultrafast pulse into two pulses
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of these pulses travels a path with a path length adjustment due to an optical delay stage
lines.name: English

lines.value: by adjusting the path length of one pulse relative to the other different portions of the thz pulse can be measured at the detector thus mapping out the thz pulse in the time domain technically a convolution between the thz pulse and response of the detector is measured but this convolution becomes unimportant when taking the ratio of such signals measured in the time domain
lines.name: English

lines.value: the measurement process requires that the amplitude of the thz pulse be measured at each position time of the delay stage
lines.name: English

lines.value: in constructing a thz tds experiment using low temperature grown gaas lt-gaas antennas a laser that can output photons greater than the band gap in this material is required
lines.name: English

lines.value: ti:sapphire accomplishes this task and puts out a pulse with duration shorter than the thz pulse it helps generate
lines.name: English

lines.value: ti:sapphire lasers are commonly used in tdts for many reasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: silver mirrors are commonly used as steering mirrors for infrared pulses as they have a nearly constant index of refraction over the bandwidth of an infrared pulse and high reflectivity above 97.5% is typical
lines.name: English

lines.value: silver mirrors tend to have 1-2% higher reflectivity than gold over the frequency range of an infrared pulse with central frequency wavelength of 800 nm
lines.name: English

lines.value: a beamsplitter is typically used to break a single ultrashort pulse into two pulses that travel in different directions
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the purposes of thz tds a 50/50 beamsplitter divides one pulse into two equal pulses is typically sufficient since both the emitter and detector require the same amount of power when using lt gaas antennas
lines.name: English

lines.value: a delay stage is utilized to lengthen one of the two beam paths
lines.name: English

lines.value: a delay stage is typically equipped with a retroreflector
lines.name: English

lines.value: a retroreflector is a mirror set that sends an outgoing beam parallel to the incoming beam
lines.name: English

lines.value: two standard adjustable mirrors can be used as can special retroreflectors made for this purpose for example a corner cube reflector
lines.name: English

lines.value: a step of the delay stage in space corresponds to a step in time since we sweep through our pulse in time by coinciding new parts of it with the gating pulse at the detector
lines.name: English

lines.value: a purge box is typically used so that absorption of thz radiation by gaseous water molecules does not occur
lines.name: English

lines.value: water is known to have many discrete absorptions in the thz region which are rotational modes of the water molecules
lines.name: English

lines.value: nitrogen as a diatomic molecule has no electric dipole moment and does not for the purposes of typical thz tds absorb thz radiation
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus a purge box can be filled with nitrogen so that unintended discrete absorptions in the thz frequency range do not occur
lines.name: English

lines.value: off axis parabolic mirrors are commonly used to collimate and focus thz light
lines.name: English

lines.value: light emitting from an effective point source such as from an lt gaas antenna active region ~5 um incident on an off axis parabolic mirror becomes collimated and collimated light incident on a parabolic mirror becomes focused
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sequential use of parabolic mirrors can focus light emitted from a point source
lines.name: English

lines.value: samples for spectroscopy are commonly placed at such a focal point where the spatial frequency distribution is nearly uniform
lines.name: English

lines.value: thz radiation has several distinct advantages over other wavelengths of light used in spectroscopy many materials are transparent to thz thz radiation is safe for biological tissues because it is non ionizing unlike for example x rays and images formed with terahertz radiation can have relatively good resolution less than 1 mm
lines.name: English

lines.value: also many interesting materials have unique spectral fingerprints in the terahertz range which means that terahertz radiation can be used to identify them
lines.name: English

lines.value: examples which have been demonstrated include several different types of explosives polymorphic forms of many compounds used as active pharmaceutical ingredients api in commercial medications as well as several illegal narcotic substances
lines.name: English

lines.value: since many materials are transparent to thz radiation these items of interest can be observed through visually opaque intervening layers such as packaging and clothing
lines.name: English

lines.value: though not strictly a spectroscopic technique the ultrashort width of the thz radiation pulses allows for measurements e.g thickness density defect location on difficult to probe materials e.g foam
lines.name: English

lines.value: the measurement capability shares many similarities to that observed with pulsed ultrasonic systems
lines.name: English

lines.value: reflections from buried interfaces and defects can be found and precisely imaged
lines.name: English

lines.value: thz measurements are non contact however
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are three widely used techniques for generating terahertz pulses all based on ultrashort pulses from titanium sapphire lasers or mode locked fiber lasers
lines.name: English

lines.value: when an ultra short 100 femtoseconds or shorter optical pulse illuminates a semiconductor and its wavelength energy is above the energy band gap of the material it photogenerates mobile carriers
lines.name: English

lines.value: given that absorption of the pulse is an exponential process most of the carriers are generated near the surface typically within 1 micrometre
lines.name: English

lines.value: this has two main effects
lines.name: English

lines.value: firstly it generates a band bending which has the effect of accelerating carriers of different signs in opposite directions normal to the surface creating a dipole this effect is known as surface field emission
lines.name: English

lines.value: secondly the presence of the surface itself creates a break of symmetry which results in carriers being able to move in average only into the bulk of the semiconductor
lines.name: English

lines.value: this phenomenon combined with the difference of mobilities of electrons and holes also produces a dipole this is known as the photo dember effect and it is particularly strong in high mobility semiconductors such as indium arsenide
lines.name: English

lines.value: when generating thz radiation via a photoconductive emitter an ultrafast pulse typically 100 femtoseconds or shorter creates charge carriers electron-hole pairs in a semiconductor material
lines.name: English

lines.value: this incident laser pulse abruptly changes the antenna from an insulating state into a conducting state
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to an electric bias applied across the antenna a sudden electric current transmits across the antenna
lines.name: English

lines.value: this changing current lasts for about a picosecond and thus emits terahertz radiation since the fourier transform of a picosecond length signal will contain thz components
lines.name: English

lines.value: typically the two antenna electrodes are patterned on a low temperature gallium arsenide lt-gaas semi insulating gallium arsenide si-gaas or other semiconductor such as inp substrate
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a commonly used scheme the electrodes are formed into the shape of a simple dipole antenna with a gap of a few micrometers and have a bias voltage up to 40 v between them
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ultrafast laser pulse must have a wavelength that is short enough to excite electrons across the bandgap of the semiconductor substrate
lines.name: English

lines.value: this scheme is suitable for illumination with a ti:sapphire oscillator laser with photon energies of 1.55 ev and pulse energies of about 10 nj
lines.name: English

lines.value: for use with amplified ti:sapphire lasers with pulse energies of about 1 mj the electrode gap can be increased to several centimeters with a bias voltage of up to 200 kv.more recent advances towards cost efficient and compact thz tds systems are based on mode locked fiber lasers sources emitting at a center wavelength of 1550 nm
lines.name: English

lines.value: therefore the photoconductive emitters have to be based on semiconductor materials with smaller band gaps of approximately 0.74 ev such as fe doped indium gallium arsenide or indium gallium arsenide indium aluminum arsenide heterostructures the short duration of thz pulses generated typically ~2 ps are primarily due to the rapid rise of the photo induced current in the semiconductor and the short carrier lifetime semiconductor materials e.g lt gaas
lines.name: English

lines.value: this current may persist for only a few hundred femtoseconds up to several nanoseconds depending on the material of which the substrate is composed
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is not the only means of generation but is currently () the most common
lines.name: English

lines.value: pulses produced by this method have average power levels on the order of several tens of microwatts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the peak power during the pulses can be many orders of magnitude higher due to the low duty cycle of mostly >1% which is dependent on the repetition rate of the laser source
lines.name: English

lines.value: the maximum bandwidth of the resulting thz pulse is primarily limited by the duration of the laser pulse while the frequency position of the maximum of the fourier spectrum is determined by the carrier lifetime of the semiconductor
lines.name: English

lines.value: in optical rectification a high intensity ultrashort laser pulse passes through a transparent crystal material that emits a terahertz pulse without any applied voltages
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a nonlinear optical process where an appropriate crystal material is quickly electrically polarized at high optical intensities
lines.name: English

lines.value: this changing electrical polarization emits terahertz radiation
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of the high laser intensities that are necessary this technique is mostly used with amplified ti:sapphire lasers
lines.name: English

lines.value: typical crystal materials are zinc telluride gallium phosphide and gallium selenide
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bandwidth of pulses generated by optical rectification is limited by the laser pulse duration terahertz absorption in the crystal material the thickness of the crystal and a mismatch between the propagation speed of the laser pulse and the terahertz pulse inside the crystal
lines.name: English

lines.value: typically a thicker crystal will generate higher intensities but lower thz frequencies
lines.name: English

lines.value: with this technique it is possible to boost the generated frequencies to 40 thz 7.5 um or higher although 2 thz 150 um is more commonly used since it requires less complex optical setups
lines.name: English

lines.value: the electrical field of the terahertz pulses is measured in a detector that is simultaneously illuminated with an ultrashort laser pulse
lines.name: English

lines.value: two common detection schemes are used in thz tds photoconductive sampling and electro optical sampling
lines.name: English

lines.value: the power of thz pulses can be detected by bolometers heat detectors cooled to liquid helium temperatures but since bolometers can only measure the total energy of a terahertz pulse rather than its electric field over time they are unsuitable for thz tds
lines.name: English

lines.value: because the measurement technique is coherent it naturally rejects incoherent radiation
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally because the time slice of the measurement is extremely narrow the noise contribution to the measurement is extremely low
lines.name: English

lines.value: the signal to noise ratio s/n of the resulting time domain waveform obviously depends on experimental conditions e.g averaging time however due to the coherent sampling techniques described high s/n values >70 db are routinely seen with 1 minute averaging times
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original problem responsible for the thz gap the colloquial term for the lack of techniques in the thz frequency range was that electronics routinely have limited operation at frequencies at and above 10^12 hz
lines.name: English

lines.value: two experimental parameters make such measurement possible in thz tds with lt gaas antennas the femtosecond gating pulses and the < 1 ps lifetimes of the charge carriers in the antenna effectively determining the antenna's on time
lines.name: English

lines.value: when all optical path lengths have fixed length an effective dc current results at the detection electronics due to their low time resolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: picosecond time resolution does not come from fast electronic or optical techniques but from the ability to adjust optical path lengths on the micron scale
lines.name: English

lines.value: to measure a particular segment of a thz pulse the optical path lengths are fixed and the effective dc current at the detector due to the a particular segment of electric field of the thz pulse
lines.name: English

lines.value: thz tds measurements are typically not single shot measurements
lines.name: English

lines.value: photoconductive detection is similar to photoconductive generation
lines.name: English

lines.value: here the voltage bias across the antenna leads is generated by the electric field of the thz pulse focused onto the antenna rather than some external generation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the thz electric field drives current across the antenna leads which is usually amplified with a low bandwidth amplifier
lines.name: English

lines.value: this amplified current is the measured parameter which corresponds to the thz field strength
lines.name: English

lines.value: again the carriers in the semiconductor substrate have an extremely short lifetime
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus the thz electric field strength is only sampled for an extremely narrow slice femtoseconds of the entire electric field waveform
lines.name: English

lines.value: the materials used for generation of terahertz radiation by optical rectification can also be used for its detection by using the pockels effect where particular crystalline materials become birefringent in the presence of an electric field
lines.name: English

lines.value: the birefringence caused by the electric field of a terahertz pulse leads to a change in the optical polarization of the detection pulse proportional to the terahertz electric field strength
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the help of polarizers and photodiodes this polarization change is measured
lines.name: English

lines.value: as with the generation the bandwidth of the detection is dependent on the laser pulse duration material properties and crystal thickness
lines.name: English

lines.value: thz tds measures the electric field of a pulse and not just the power
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus thz tds measures both the amplitude and phase information of the frequency components it contains
lines.name: English

lines.value: in contrast measuring only the power at each frequency is essentially a photon counting technique information regarding the phase of the light is not obtained
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus the waveform is not uniquely determined by such a power measurement
lines.name: English

lines.value: even when measuring only the power reflected from a sample the complex optical response constant of the material can be obtained
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is so because the complex nature of an optical constant is not arbitrary the real and imaginary parts of an optical constant are related by relations known as the kramers kronig relations knowing one determines the other
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a difficulty in applying the kramers kronig relations as written because information about the sample reflected power for example must be obtained at all frequencies
lines.name: English

lines.value: in practice far separated frequency regions do not have significant influence on each other and reasonable limiting conditions can be applied at high and low frequency outside of the measured range
lines.name: English

lines.value: thz tds in contrast does not require the use of kramers kronig relations
lines.name: English

lines.value: by measuring the electric field of a thz pulse in the time domain the amplitude and phase of each frequency component of the thz pulse are known in contrast to the single piece of information known by a power measurement
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus the real and imaginary parts of an optical constant can be known at every frequency within the usable bandwidth of a thz pulse without need to frequencies outside the usable bandwidth or kramers kronig relations
lines.name: English

lines.value: otoplasty greek ous ear + plassein to shape denotes the surgical and non surgical procedures for correcting the deformities and defects of the pinna external ear and for reconstructing a defective or deformed or absent external ear consequent to congenital conditions e.g microtia anotia etc and trauma blunt penetrating or blast
lines.name: English

lines.value: the otoplastic surgeon corrects the defect or deformity by creating an external ear that is of natural proportions contour and appearance usually achieved by the reshaping the moving and the augmenting of the cartilaginous support framework of the pinna
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover the occurrence of congenital ear deformities occasionally overlaps with other medical conditions e.g treacher collins syndrome and hemifacial microsomia
lines.name: English

lines.value: otoplasty surgery of the ear was developed in ancient india in the 5th century bc by the ayurvedic physician sushruta ca 800 bc which he described in the medical compendium the sushruta samhita sushruta's compendium ca ad 500
lines.name: English

lines.value: in his time the physician sushruta and his medical students developed otoplastic and other plastic surgical techniques and procedures for correcting repairing and reconstructing ears noses lips and genitalia that were amputated as criminal religious and military punishments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ancient indian medical knowledge and plastic surgery techniques of the sushruta samhita were practiced throughout asia until the late 18th century the october 1794 issue of the contemporary british gentleman's magazine reported the practice of rhinoplasty as described in the 5th-century medical book the sushruta samhita
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover two centuries later contemporary otoplastic praxis slightly modified derives from the techniques and procedures developed and established in antiquity by the indian ayurvedic physician sushruta
lines.name: English

lines.value: in die operative chirurgie operational surgery 1845 johann friedrich dieffenbach 1794-1847 reported the first surgical approach for the correction of prominent ears - a combination otoplasty procedure that featured the simple excision cutting of the problematic excess cartilage from the posterior sulcus back groove of the ear and the subsequent affixing with sutures of the corrected pinna to the mastoid periosteum the membrane covering the mastoid process at the underside of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone at the back of the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1920 harold d gillies 1882-1960 first reproduced the pinna by burying an external ear support framework made of autologous rib cartilage under the skin of the mastoid region of the head which reconstructed pinna he then separated from the skin of the mastoid area by means of a cervical flap
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1937 dr gillies also attempted a like pediatric ear reconstruction with a pinna support framework fabricated with maternal cartilage
lines.name: English

lines.value: that otoplasty correction technique proved inadequate because of the problems inherent to the biochemical breakdown and elimination resorption of the cartilage tissue by the patient's body
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1964 radford c tanzer 1921-2004 reemphasized the use of autologous cartilage as the most advantageously reliable organic material for resolving microtia abnormally small ears because of its great histologic viability resistance to shrinkage and resistance to softening and lower incidence of resorption
lines.name: English

lines.value: the development of plastic surgery procedures such as the refinement of jf dieffenbach's ear surgery techniques has established more than 170 otoplasty procedures for correcting prominent ears and for correcting the defects and deformities of the pinna as such otoplasty corrections are in three surgical technique groups group i techniques that leave intact the cartilage support framework of the ear and reconfigure the distance and the angle of projection of the pinna from the head solely by means of sutures as in the permanent suture insertion of the mustarde technique the merck stitch method and the incisionless fritsch otoplasty for creating an anti helical fold a mustarde technique an open invasive method whereby the retroauricular cartilage is extensively exposed a part of the skin is excised and mattress sutures are inserted
lines.name: English

lines.value: b merck stitch method a minimally invasive method by which the ear is no longer cut open and the cartilage is left completely intact
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mattress sutures are inserted in the ear through 2 to 3 small stab incisions on the back of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: c incisionless fritsch otoplasty it is a combination of the minimally invasive technique and the stenstrom technique whereby the cartilage on the front of the ear is scored with superficial incisions
lines.name: English

lines.value: group ii - techniques that resect cut and remove the pertinent excess cartilage from the support framework of the pinna which then render it pliable to being remolded reconfigured and affixed to the head at the projection distance and angle characteristic of a normal ear the relevant procedures are the cartilage incision converse technique and the chongchet stenstrom technique for the anterior correction of prominent ears
lines.name: English

lines.value: group iii - techniques that combine the excision of cartilage portions from the support framework of the pinna in order to reduce the degree of projection and the distance of the external ear from the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pinna the external ear pinna is a surgically challenging anatomy composed of a delicate and complex framework of shaped cartilage that is covered on its visible surface with thin tightly adherent hairless skin
lines.name: English

lines.value: although of small area the surface anatomy of the external ear is complex consisting of the pinna the auricle and the external auditory meatus auditory canal
lines.name: English

lines.value: the outer framework of the pinna is composed of the rim of the helix which arises from the front and from below anteriorly and inferiorly from a crus shank that extends horizontally above the auditory canal
lines.name: English

lines.value: the helix merges downwards inferiorly into the cauda helices tail of the helix and connects to the lobule earlobe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region located between the crura shanks of the antihelix is the triangular fossa depression while the scapha elongated depression lies between the helix and antihelix
lines.name: English

lines.value: the antihelix borders in the middle medially to the rim of the concha shell and the concha proper which is composed of the conchal cymba above superiorly and the conchal cavum below inferiorly which are separated by the helical crus and meet the antihelix at the antihelical rim
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tragus auditory canal lobule and the antitragus counterpart lobule are separated by the intertragal notch the auditory canal lobule does not contain cartilage and displays varied morphologic shapes and attachments to the adjacent cheek and scalp
lines.name: English

lines.value: blood supply and innervation the superficial temporal and posterior auricular arteries preserve the arterial blood supply of the external ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sensory innervation involves the front and back anterior and posterior branches of the greater auricular nerve and is reinforced by the auricular temporal and lesser occipital nerves
lines.name: English

lines.value: the auricular branch of the vagus nerves supplies a portion of the posterior wall of the external auditory canal
lines.name: English

lines.value: otoplastic praxis the support framework of the reconstructed pinna must be more rigid than the natural cartilage framework of a normal ear in order for it to remain of natural size proportion and contour
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the reconstructed pinna framework were as structurally delicate as the cartilage framework of a natural pinna its anatomic verisimilitude as an ear would gradually be eroded by a combination of the pressure of the tight skin envelope in the temporal region of the head and of the pressure of the progressive contracture of the surgical scar(s
lines.name: English

lines.value: prominent ears in the practice of otoplasty the term prominent ears describes external ears pinnae that regardless of their size protrude from the sides of the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: the abnormal appearance exceeds the normal head to ear measures wherein the external ear is less than 2.0 cm and at an angle of less than 25 degrees from the side of the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: ear configurations of distance and angle that exceed the normal measures appear prominent when the man or the woman is viewed from either the front or the back perspective
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the occurrence of prominent ears the common causes of anatomic defect deformity and abnormality can occur individually or in combination they are i underdeveloped antihelical fold this anatomic deformity occurs consequent to the inadequate folding of the antihelix which causes the protrusion of the scapha and the helical rim
lines.name: English

lines.value: the defect is manifested by the prominence of the scapha the elongated depression separating the helix and the antihelix and the upper third of the ear and occasionally of the middle third of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: ii prominent concha this deformity is caused either by an excessively deep concha or by an excessively wide concha mastoid angle <25 degrees
lines.name: English

lines.value: these two anatomic abnormalities can occur in combination and produce a prominent concha the largest deepest concavity of the pinna which then causes the prominence of the middle third of the external ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: iii protruding earlobe this defect of the earlobe causes the prominence of the lower third of the pinna
lines.name: English

lines.value: although most prominent ears are anatomically normal morphologic defects defromities and abnormalities do occur such as the
lines.name: English

lines.value: the degrees of angle between the head and the ear and the degrees of angle between the scapha and the concha determine the concept of prominent ears
lines.name: English

lines.value: the study comparing cephaloauricular and scaphaconchal angles in prominent ear patients and control subjects 2008 reported that the comparisons of the head to ear angles and the scapaha to concha angles of a 15-patient cohort with prominent ears with the analogous ear angles of a 15-person control group established that the average head to ear angle was 47.7 degrees for the study group and 31.1 degrees for the control group and that the average scapha to concha angle was 132.6 degrees for the study cohort and 106.7 degrees for the control group
lines.name: English

lines.value: the antihelix normally forms a symmetric y shaped structure in which the gently rolled folded crest of the root of the antihelix continues upwards as the superior crus and the inferior crus branches forwards from the root as a folded ridge
lines.name: English

lines.value: the root of the inferior crus of the antihelix sharply defines the rim of the concha
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover the inferior crus also forms the wall that separates the concha from the triangular fossa
lines.name: English

lines.value: the root and superior crus of the antihelix form the anterior wall of the scaphoid fossa and the helix forms the posterior wall
lines.name: English

lines.value: the triangular fossa dips within the y arms of the superior and inferior crura
lines.name: English

lines.value: the corrugated contours of these auricular crests and valleys provide a pillar effect support that stabilizes the pinna
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vertical walls of the conchal cup translate to a semi horizontal plane as the concha merges with the folded crest of the antihelix
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scapha helix is nearly parallel to the plane of the temporal surface of the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the roll of the antihelix and its crest are effaced and flat rather than rolled or folded the steep pitch of the conchal wall continues into the unformed antihelix and scapha and ends at the helix with little interruption
lines.name: English

lines.value: said planar orientation places the scapha helix complex nearly perpendicular to the temporal plane of the head - because of which the ear appears prominent thus such an ear also lacks the stability provided by the pillar effect and so allows the superior auricular pole to protrude
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the literature effacement deficiency of the antihelical fold is the foremost subject of most discussions of the prominent ear because it is an aurical deformity manifested as a spectrum of defects and deformities - ranging from an indistinguishable antihelix with a confluent concavity from antihelix to scapha and the helical rim projected outwards and forwards to loss of definition solely of the superior antihelix with prominence of the upper pole of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: the concha of the ear is an irregular hemispheric bowl with a defined rim
lines.name: English

lines.value: the normal scapha helix surrounds the posterior part of the bowl much as the brim of an inverted hat surrounds the crown
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pitch at which the scapha helix projects from the conchal cup is determined i by the acuteness of the fold of the crest of the antihelix ii by the height of the posterior wall of the conchal bowl and iii by the completeness of the hemisphere formed by the concha
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the posterior wall of the concha is excessively high and the concha is excessively spherical then there is an excessive angle and distance between the plane of the scapha helix and the plane of the temporal surface of the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: such protrusion usually is evenly distributed around the posterior conchal wall however the cephalad part of the concha can protrude disproportionately another cause for a protruding upper pole
lines.name: English

lines.value: similarly the caudal part of the concha can project disproportionately and cause a protruding lower auricular pole therefore these deformational features require special attention in the operating room
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover regarding the shape and projection of the ear the importance of the concha must be considered in relation to the three tiered configuration of the auricular cartilage framework because the more delicate antihelix and helical complex are mounted upon the sturdier concha therefore changes in conchal size and shape greatly influence the overlying tiers hence it is rare to see prominence of the ear that does not have a conchal element
lines.name: English

lines.value: the concha affects the prominence of the ear three fold ways i the overall enlargement of the concha projects the ear away from the mastoid surface ii an extension of the helical crus across the concha creates a firm cartilage bar that pushes the ear outwards iii the effect of the angulation of the cartilage at the junction between the cavum concha and the sweep of cartilage up to the antitragal prominence affects the position and prominence of the lobule earlobe and lower third of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: understanding the first deformational element is well recognized and despite limited attention to the second element once seen it is easily understood
lines.name: English

lines.value: therefore understanding the third element leads to understanding the surgical technical approach to correcting the isolated lower pole and lobule prominence
lines.name: English

lines.value: the latter feature of conchal shape while not the sole cause of lobular prominence appears to play a key role
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the cartilage angle between the concha cavum and the antitragus becomes more acute i.e as the antitragus tips closer towards the concha this supporting structure outwardly projects the lobule and the lower third of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: this feature has a greater influence upon the lobule position than does the commonly described helical tail
lines.name: English

lines.value: the combined effects of an effaced antihelix and a deep concha also contribute to severe auricular protrusion that is a very prominent ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: the occurrence of a prominent mastoid process tends to push the concha forward which extends the pinna external ear away from the side of the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: the external ear is mounted upon the bony base of the underlying temporal bone therefore anomalies and asymmetries of the skeletal shape can cause either pinna or both pinnae to become prominent
lines.name: English

lines.value: in relation to the protruding mastoid process the most recognizable skeletal anomaly is the change in the position and in the projection of the pinna as associated with non synostotic plagiocephaly the positional flattening of the side of the head not caused by the inappropriate union of two bones
lines.name: English

lines.value: hence in the occurrence of a flattening of the skull parallelogram deformation of the cranial vault the side of the head afflicted with occipital plagiocephaly presents a prominent ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: in subtle cases the prominent ear might be more readily evident in an elder patient whose ears are asymmetrically positioned reason for which the residual occipital flattening occipital plagiocephay and mild facial asymmetry are unapparent at first view
lines.name: English

lines.value: this effect of the shape of the patient's head upon the outward and extended position of the ear is notably indicated in the 19th-century illustrations that describe the ely otoplasty technique 1881
lines.name: English

lines.value: the undersized development of one side of a person's face demonstrates the influence of skeletal development upon the position of the external ear on the head as caused by the deficient morphologic development of the temporal bone and by the medial positioning of the temporomandibular joint the synovial joint between the temporal bone and the mandible upper jaw
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover in severe cases of hemifacial microsomia without the occurrence of microtia small ears the normal external ear might appear to have been sheared off the head because the upper half of the pinna is projecting outwards and at the middle point the lower half of the pinna is canted inwards towards the hypoplastic underdeveloped side of the face of the patient
lines.name: English

lines.value: a similar type of asymmetric development of the head and face features a relatively broad head a narrow face and a narrow mandible when observed from the front perspective the head and face of the person present a triangular configuration
lines.name: English

lines.value: such wide to narrow skeletal sloping from the head to the face might create the bone promontory upon which rests and from which projects the upper anatomy of the pinna which otherwise is an external ear of normal proportions size and contour
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cauda helicis tail of the helix is bound to the fibrofatty tissues of the earlobe by a network of connective tissue
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tail of the helix cauda helicis which projects outwards from the concha carries the earlobe with it causing it to protrude which physical condition contributes to prominence of the lower pole of the pinna the external ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: given the morphological diversity of the earlobes found among men women and children some earlobes are large some earlobes are pendulous and some earlobes are large and pendulous but some are prominent because of the structure and form of the dense interlacing connective tissue fibers that shape the earlobe anatomy independent of the tail of the helix cauda helicis
lines.name: English

lines.value: functionally the external ear is served by three 3 ear muscles the auricularis posterior muscle rear ear muscle the auricularis superior muscle upper ear muscle and the auricularis anterior muscle front ear muscle the most notable of which is the auricularis posterior muscle which functions to pull the ear backwards because it is superficially attached to the ponticulus bridge of the conchal cartilage and to the posterior auricular ligament rear ligament of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: the posterior muscle of the ear is composed of 2 3 fascicles skeletal-muscle fibers contained in perimysium connective tissue originates from the mastoid process of the temporal bone and is inserted to the lower part of the cranial surface of the concha where it is surrounded by fibroareolar tissue deep within the temporal fascia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the posterior auricular artery irrigates the ear tissues with small branch artery blood vessels rami
lines.name: English

lines.value: likewise the rear muscle of the ear is innervated with fine rami of the posterior auricular nerve which is a branch of the facial nerve
lines.name: English

lines.value: deep within these muscle and ligament structures lie the mastoid fascia and the tendinous origin of the sternomastoid muscle
lines.name: English

lines.value: the corrective goal of otoplasty is to set back the ears so that they appear naturally proportionate and contoured because they are harmoniously set back without evidence or indication of surgical correction
lines.name: English

lines.value: therefore when the corrected ears are viewed they should appear normal from the i front perspective
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the ear pinna is viewed from the front the helical rim should be visible but not set back so far flattened that it is hidden behind the antihelical fold
lines.name: English

lines.value: ii rear perspective
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the pinna is viewed from behind the helical rim is straight not bent as if a letter-c the middle third to flat or crooked as if a hockey stick the earlobe is insufficiently flat
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the helical rim is straight the setback is harmonious that is the upper- middle- and lower thirds of the pinna will be proportionately setback in relation to each other
lines.name: English

lines.value: iii side perspective
lines.name: English

lines.value: the contours of the ear should be soft and natural not sharp and artificial
lines.name: English

lines.value: timing otoplastic correction the ear deformity to be corrected determines the advantageous timing of an otoplasty for example in children with extremely prominent ears 4-years old is a reasonable age
lines.name: English

lines.value: in cases of macrotia associated with prominent ears the child's age might be 2-years nonetheless it is advantageous to restrict the further growth of the deformed ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover regardless of the patient's age the otoplasty procedure requires that the patient be under general anaesthesia
lines.name: English

lines.value: ear reconstruction
lines.name: English

lines.value: generally for reconstructing an entire ear or a portion of the rim cartilage the surgeon first harvests a costal cartilage graft from the patient's rib cage which then is sculpted into an auricular framework that is emplaced under the temporal skin of the patient's head so that the skin envelope encompass the cartilage framework the ear prosthesis
lines.name: English

lines.value: once emplaced and anchored with sutures the surgeon then creates a pinna outer ear of natural proportions contour and appearance
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the next months in follow up surgeries the surgeon then creates an earlobe and also separates the reconstructed pinna from the side of the head ca 15 18 mm in order to create a tragus the small rounded projection located before the external entrance to the ear canal
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the case of the patient encumbered with several congenital defects of the ear or who has insufficient autologous cartilage to harvest it might be infeasible to effect the corrections with grafts of rib cartilage
lines.name: English

lines.value: in such a case the reconstructive antia buch helical advancement technique might apply it moves tissues from behind the ear rim and then around and forward to repair the defective front of the ear rim
lines.name: English

lines.value: to perform the antia buch helical advancement with ink the surgeon first designs the incision inside the helical rim and around the crus shank of the helix
lines.name: English

lines.value: then cuts the skin and the cartilage - but does not pierce the posterior skin of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: the helical rim then is advanced to allow the suturing closure and a dog ear shaped graft of skin is removed from the back of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: the closure of the sutures advances the crus of the helix into the helical rim
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ear defect or deformity to be corrected determines the otoplasty techniques and procedures to be applied thus a torn earlobe can be repaired solely with sutures a slight damage to the rim of the pinna outer ear might be repaired with an autologous skin graft harvested from the scalp yet conversely a proper ear reconstruction might require several surgeries
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the correction of infantile ear defects and deformities the otoplasty usually is performed when he or she is about six years old because at that age the healthy ear is almost adult sized and thus can serve the plastic surgeon as a corrective template for the auricular reconstruction
lines.name: English

lines.value: the otoplastic technique(s applied to correct reconstruct or replace a deformed defective or a missing ear is determined by the indications that the patient presents some are
lines.name: English

lines.value: otoplastic surgery can be performed upon a patient under anesthesia - local anesthesia local anesthesia with sedation or general anesthesia usual for children
lines.name: English

lines.value: in order to correct a lop ear with a small helix the cartilage supported outer rim of the pinna an incision to one side of a flat cartilage piece leaves unopposed elastic forces on the opposite side which permits the evolution of the ear contour thus a small incision on one side of the lop ear cartilage along the new anti helical fold can be a technical element of the corrective ear surgery
lines.name: English

lines.value: yet when done without an incision the procedure is deemed an incisionless otoplasty wherein the surgeon places a needle through the skin to model the cartilage and to emplace the retention sutures that will affix the antihelix and conchal bowl areas
lines.name: English

lines.value: surgical otoplasty techniques depending upon the auricular pinna defect deformity or reconstruction required the surgeon applies these three otoplastic techniques either individually or in combination to achieve an outcome that produces an ear of natural proportions contour and appearance i antihelical fold manipulation a suturing of the cartilage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the surgeon emplaces mattress sutures on the back of the ears which are tied with sufficient tension to increase the definition of the antihelical fold thereby setting back the helical rim
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cartilage is not treated
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is the technique of mustarde and merck
lines.name: English

lines.value: but there are differences between both methods
lines.name: English

lines.value: whereas the mustarde method is an open invasive method by which the cartilage on the back of the ears is extensively exposed and an area of skin is excised the merck method is a closed minimally invasive procedure by which the cartilage is not exposed anywhere and skin is also not removed
lines.name: English

lines.value: b stenstrom technique of anterior abrasion
lines.name: English

lines.value: the abrasion roughening or scoring of the anterior front surface of the anti helical fold cartilage causes the cartilage to bend away from the abraded side per the gibson principle towards the side of intact perichondrium the membrane of fibrous connective tissue
lines.name: English

lines.value: c full thickness incisions
lines.name: English

lines.value: one full thickness incision along the desired curvature of the antihelix permits folding it with slight force thereby creating an antihelical fold as in the luckett procedure
lines.name: English

lines.value: yet because such a fold is sharp and unnatural in appearance the technique was modified as the converse wood smith technique wherein two incisions are made running parallel to the desired antihelical fold and tubing sutures are emplaced to create a more defined fold of natural contour and appearance
lines.name: English

lines.value: ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: conchal alteration a suturing
lines.name: English

lines.value: the surgeon decreases the angle -25 degrees between the concha and the mastoid process of the head with sutures emplaced between the concha and the mastoid fascia b conchal excision
lines.name: English

lines.value: from either an anterior or a posterior approach the surgeon removes a full thickness crescent of cartilage from the posterior wall of the concha ascertaining to neither violate nor deform the antihelical fold to thereby reduce the height of the concha
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover to avoid producing a noticeable surgical scar in the concha the surgeon meticulously closes the conchal defect with sutures
lines.name: English

lines.value: the design of the cartilage crescent excision means to produce a closing incision will lay at the junction of the conchal floor and the posterior conchal wall - where it is least noticeable and causes minimal distortion of the normal contours of the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: b combination of suturing and conchal excision
lines.name: English

lines.value: the surgeon applies a corrective technique that combines the pertinent technical aspects of the furnas suture technique and of the conchal excision techniques
lines.name: English

lines.value: d medialisation of the conchal part of the antihelix
lines.name: English

lines.value: with this method the antihelix is moved in the direction of the ear canal entrance with the fingers and fixed in this position by mattress sutures
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus a big cavum conchae is reduced without any excision of cartilage and the ear moves towards the head to the desired degree
lines.name: English

lines.value: iii
lines.name: English

lines.value: correction of earlobe prominence repositioning the earlobe is the most difficult part of the otoplasty because when a pinna external ear that has been repositioned in its upper two thirds and that yet retains a prominent lobule earlobe will appear disproportionate to and malpositioned upon the head - as it did in the original uncorrected deformity
lines.name: English

lines.value: the otoplastic technique most effective for lobular repositioning is the gosain technique or a variant wherein the surgeon cuts the skin on the medial surface of the earlobe and in suturing it closed takes a bite of the conchal undersurface to pull the earlobe towards the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: another prominent earlobe correction technique is suturing the helical cartilage tail to the concha yet because the tail of the helix does not extend much into the lobule setting it back does not reliably correct the set back of the earlobe proper other techniques involve skin excision and sutures between the fibrofatty tissue of the lobule and the tissues of the neck
lines.name: English

lines.value: iv
lines.name: English

lines.value: alteration of the position of the auricular upper pole depending upon the pre surgical degree of prominence of the upper third of the pinna the surgical creation of the antihelical fold might be inadequate to fully correct the position of the helical rim near the root of the helix
lines.name: English

lines.value: types of otoplastic correction the internal sutures usually are permanent non-absorbable but the surgical wound or wounds can be sutured with either absorbable sutures or with non absorbable sutures that the plastic surgeon removes when the surgical wound has healed
lines.name: English

lines.value: depending upon the deformity to be corrected the otoplasty can be performed either as an outpatient surgery or at hospital while the operating room or time varies between 1.5 and 5.0 hours
lines.name: English

lines.value: for several days after the surgery the otoplasty patient wears a voluminous non compressive dressing upon the corrected ear(s during which convalescent period he or she must avoid excessive bandage pressure upon the ear lest it cause pain and increase swelling which might lead to the abrasion rubbing or even to the necrosis of the ear's skin
lines.name: English

lines.value: after removing the dressing the patient then wears a loose headband whilst sleeping for a 3 6 week period it should be snug not tight because its purpose is preventing the corrected ear(s from being pulled forward when the sleeping patient moves whilst asleep
lines.name: English

lines.value: hence a tight headband can abrade and erode the side surface of the ear possibly creating an open wound
lines.name: English

lines.value: dressing does not have to be worn if one was operated with the stitch method
lines.name: English

lines.value: complications
lines.name: English

lines.value: incidence of ear deformity approximately 20 30 per cent of newborn children are born with deformities of the external ear pinna that can occur either in utero congenitally or in the birth canal acquired
lines.name: English
