lines.value: the possible defects and deformities include protuberant ears bat ears pointed ears elfin ears helical rim deformity wherein the superior portion of the ear lacks curvature cauliflower ear which appears as if crushed lop ear wherein the upper portion of the pinna is folded onto itself and others
lines.name: English

lines.value: such deformities usually are self correcting but if at 1-week of age the child's external ear deformity has not self corrected then either surgical correction otoplasty ca 5 6 years of age or non surgical correction tissue molding is required to achieve an ear of normal proportions contour and appearance
lines.name: English

lines.value: i taping ii physician designed splints iii earwell iv ear buddies and v earfold in the early weeks of infancy the cartilage of the infantile pinna is unusually malleable because of the remaining maternal estrogens circulating in the organism of the child
lines.name: English

lines.value: during that biochemically privileged period prominent ears and related deformities can be permanently corrected by molding the pinnae ears to the correct shape either by the traditional method of taping with tape and soft dental compound e.g gutta percha latex or solely with tape or with non surgical tissue molding appliances such as custom made defect specific splints designed by the physician and the earwell and the ear buddies devices which are technical variants of the splint and tape method of mechanical ear defect correction each method requires fastening to the infant's head with adhesive tape
lines.name: English

lines.value: therapeutically the splint and adhesive tape treatment regimen is months long and continues until achieving the desired outcome or until there is no further improvement in the contour of the pinna likewise with the custom and commercial tissue molding devices
lines.name: English

lines.value: at or above the age of 7 a child or adult could treat their prominent ears with a minimally invasive technique using earfold implants to remold the cartilage in their ears in a simple procedure which can be performed under local anaesthesia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the traditional non surgical correction of protuberant ears is taping them to the head of the child in order to flatten them into the normal configuration
lines.name: English

lines.value: the physician effects this immediate correction to take advantage of the maternal estrogen induced malleability of the infantile ear cartilages during the first 6 weeks of his or her life
lines.name: English

lines.value: the taping approach can involve either adhesive tape and a splinting material or only adhesive tape the specific deformity determines the correction method
lines.name: English

lines.value: this non surgical correction period is limited because the extant maternal estrogens in the child's organism diminish within 6 8 weeks afterwards the ear cartilages stiffen thus taping the ears is effective only for correcting bat ears prominent ears and not the serious deformities that require surgical remolding of the pinna external ear to produce an ear of normal size contour and proportions
lines.name: English

lines.value: furthermore ear correction by splints and tape requires the regular replacement of the splints and the tape and especial attention to the child's head for any type of skin erosion because of the cumulative effects of the mechanical pressures of the splints proper and the adhesive of the fastener tape
lines.name: English

lines.value: congenital ear deformities are defined as either malformations microtia cryptotia or deformations wherein the term ear deformation implies a normal chondrocutaneous component with an abnormal auricular architecture
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conditions are categorized as constricted ears stahl's ear deformity and prominent ears which derive from varied causes such as the abnormal development and functioning of the intrinsic and extrinsic ear muscles which might generate forces that deform the auricle pinna and external forces consequent to malpositioning of the head during the prenatal and neonatal periods of the child's life
lines.name: English

lines.value: the study postpartum splinting of ear deformities 2005 reported the efficacy of splinting the ears pf a child during the early neonatal period as a safe and effective non surgical treatment for correcting congenital ear deformities
lines.name: English

lines.value: the splint applied was a wire core segment in a 6-french silastic tube that was affixed with adhesive skin closure strips the device was applied 3 4 weeks without anaesthesia three 3 cases demonstrated the efficacy of non surgical correction by means of splinting for the reshaping of deformed infantile ears
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mechanical molding correction of infantile ear deformity made possible by the estrogen induced malleability of the cartilages of the pinna ear permits the application of the earwell device to reform the infant's deformed ear into an ear of normal proportions contour and appearance
lines.name: English

lines.value: among the deformities that can be non surgically corrected with the earwell device are prominent ears bat ears stahl's ear deformity elfin ears lop ear with a small helix outer cartilage rim lidding of the upper portion of the auricle helix helical compression conchal crus cryptotia characterized by an ear the top of which is hidden in the skin of the scalp and the less severe tanzer ii constricted ear malformations
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earwell infant ear correction system is a tissue molding device in four parts i the posterior shell cradle which is emplaced over and around the ear to be corrected it adheres to the skin of the head ii a retractor for shaping the rim of the pinna iii a conchal former for molding the concha the central hollow of the ear and iv an anterior shell that fits atop affixes the interior parts and locks onto the cradle to cover and protect the ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: after initiating treatment with the device the physician monitors the progress of the correction at 2-weeks post emplacement to effect adjustments to the device and to observe the defect correction progress the usual treatment regimen is 6 8 weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the treatment is initiated in the first week of the infant's life tissue molding correction can yield a non surgical otoplasty outcome comparable to that of surgical otoplasty
lines.name: English

lines.value: the study ear molding in newborn infants with auricular deformities 2010 reported the efficacy of the earwell device in correcting deformities of the antihelix the triangular fossa the helical rim and an over prominent conchal mastoid angle in 831 ear deformities in 488 newborn infants who featured i prominent ear cup ear 373 ears 45% ii lop ear 224 ears 27% mixed type ear deformities 83 ears 10% all with associated conchal crus stahl's ear 66 ears 8.0% helical rim deformity 58 ears 7.0% conchal crus 25 ears 3.0% and cryptotia 2 ears 0.2%
lines.name: English

lines.value: bilateral deformities both ears occurred in 340 patients 70% unilateral deformities occurred in 148 patients 30% and 58 infant ears 34 patients were corrected with the earwell system with a 90 per cent rate of successful correction
lines.name: English

lines.value: application of the tissue molding device at 1-week after the child's birth proved most efficacious in achieving a successful correction because when the correction was initiated at 3-weeks from birth the lessened malleability of the cartilage and tissues of the ear reduced the successful deformity correction rate to 50 per cent
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ear buddies splints are fitted to the gully of the ear and affixed with narrow strips of adhesive tape thereby forming a tissue molding device that corrects re-forms the deformity
lines.name: English

lines.value: the splint's pressure upon the ear cartilage counters the ear's tendency to protrude whilst maintaining the proper contours of the entire ear
lines.name: English

lines.value: the splints are curved and pliable and can be molded specifically to the proportions of the patient's ear as required by the particular defect or deformity to be managed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the device is effective only when applied as such when both elements splint and fastener tape are jointly applied to the deformed ear therefore only taping the ears to the head without the splints is therapeutically ineffective and might risk either flattening or notching the helical rim
lines.name: English

lines.value: the corrective splint is emplaced by inserting it to the rim of the gully of the deformed ear then rolling over the ear edge onto the splint and fastening it with adhesive tape
lines.name: English

lines.value: afterwards the splinted ear is affixed to the side of the head with adhesive tape
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the case of ears without a gully helix rim or antihelix common prominent ear characteristics the splint is emplaced slightly away from the ear edge which then is rolled onto the splint in order to be shaped into a proper helix ear rim and also to facilitate the reformation of the antihelix
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the case of stahl's ear deformity characterized either by a bulging or a kinked gully the splint is firmly emplaced upon the defect or deformity fastened in place and affixed to the side of the head
lines.name: English

lines.value: therefore to achieve a successful non surgical ear correction outcome the infant wears the ear buddies for 24 hours daily during the recommended splintage period which is determined thus if he or she is splinted at
lines.name: English

lines.value: the burger king kingdom is a fantasy world associated with burger king
lines.name: English

lines.value: introduced in 1976 the burger king kingdom was the name of burger king's answer to mcdonaldland during the mid 1970s
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1989 the burger king kingdom characters were phased out in favor of the bk kids club gang
lines.name: English

lines.value: starting in 2003 the burger king began to be reused in burger king ads albeit as a man in a mask and king costume rather than a full live action portrayal
lines.name: English

lines.value: georgi kinkladze (, ; born 6 july 1973 also spelled georgiou or giorgi or shortened to gio is a georgian former footballer who played as a playmaking midfielder
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in the georgian capital tbilisi his first professional club was mretebi tbilisi
lines.name: English

lines.value: in georgia he won three league titles and two cups with dinamo tbilisi and was named national player of the year twice
lines.name: English

lines.value: he first came to international prominence with his performances for the georgian national team against wales in 1994 and 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinladze transferred from dinamo tbilisi to english premier league club manchester city in 1995 where his dribbling ability and spectacular goals made him a cult hero winning the club's player of the year award in two consecutive seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze stayed with manchester city despite relegation to the football league first division in 1996 but the club continued to decline and after a second relegation in 1998 he joined dutch champions ajax
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze was unable to settle in the netherlands and returned to england with derby county a little over a year later
lines.name: English

lines.value: he spent four years at derby making nearly 100 appearances
lines.name: English

lines.value: after leaving derby in 2003 he became a journeyman footballer having unsuccessful trials at several clubs before joining cypriot club anorthosis in 2004 where he won a league championship medal
lines.name: English

lines.value: he finished his playing career with russian club rubin kazan in 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: georgi kinkladze was born on 6 july 1973 in tbilisi georgia which was then part of the soviet union
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a child he lived in the didube district of the city with his father robinzon an engineer his mother khatuna a teacher and his elder sister
lines.name: English

lines.value: robinzon was keen to see his son succeed as a footballer sometimes making him walk around the family home on his knees to strengthen his legs and enrolled him for dinamo tbilisi's junior side when he was six years old
lines.name: English

lines.value: khatuna disapproved of some of her husband's methods instead taking georgi to lessons in mtiuluri a traditional georgian ballet
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the next few years kinkladze played in dinamo tbilisi's youth teams progressing as far as the reserve team where he played alongside shota arveladze who would later become his teammate at both senior and international level
lines.name: English

lines.value: when georgian football formed leagues independent of soviet competition in 1989 a family friend arranged for kinkladze to move to mretebi tbilisi the first openly professional club in the soviet union
lines.name: English

lines.value: mretebi tbilisi were a smaller club playing at a lower level but the move gave kinkladze the opportunity to play first team football instead of playing for dinamo's second team
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze made his professional debut aged 16 and immediately became a first team regular
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1991 kinkladze's mretebi won the pirveli liga and won promotion to the highest division following a play off
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a season in the top flight with mretebi kinkladze was signed by dinamo tbilisi the team he represented as a youth for one million roubles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 1992 shortly after signing for dinamo kinkladze made his senior international debut aged 19
lines.name: English

lines.value: the match against azerbaijan was the georgian national side's fourth since breaking from the soviet union in 1991
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze's youth level teammate shota arveladze also played in the match and kinkladze provided an assist for a goal by arveladze
lines.name: English

lines.value: in kinkladze's first season at the club dinamo won a league and cup double
lines.name: English

lines.value: however due to the ongoing georgian civil war during 1993 the dinamo tbilisi management sought to put their players in a more stable environment
lines.name: English

lines.value: as part of this kinkladze was sent on loan to 1
lines.name: English

lines.value: fc saarbrucken in germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze made his saarbrucken debut in a 2
lines.name: English

lines.value: bundesliga match against tennis borussia berlin a 2 2 draw on 4 march 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was unable to settle into the side at saarbrucken rarely playing a full 90 minutes and was sent off in a 1 3 defeat to hertha berlin
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of the season kinkladze returned to tbilisi to resume his career in georgia where he was named the national player of the year for 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: dinamo president merab jordania was still uncomfortable with kinkladze playing in georgia amid political instability and offered the player to atletico madrid for approximately £200000 they gave him a trial but no contract
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then trained with real madrid's reserves where he caught the eye of boca juniors scouts who took him to argentina for a month's loan
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze met his childhood hero diego maradona but did not gain a permanent contract as manager silvio marzolini regarded him as too similar to boca's argentine international playmaker alberto marcico
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 1994 kinkladze was part of the georgian team that played moldova in tbilisi
lines.name: English

lines.value: italian clubs became interested in kinkladze after seeing footage of his performance and the italian press nicknamed kinkladze the rivera of the black sea but no concrete attempts to sign him took place
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was not until manchester city chairman francis lee saw the recording that negotiations for a permanent move abroad occurred
lines.name: English

lines.value: enthused by kinkladze's display lee contacted jordania securing an agreement that manchester city would have first refusal should dinamo wish to sell the player
lines.name: English

lines.value: two months later kinkladze scored his first international goal as georgia defeated wales 5 0
lines.name: English

lines.value: wales goalkeeper neville southall later said of the game they murdered us [kinkladze] was different class and the best player on the pitch by a mile when the teams met again at cardiff arms park scouts from several clubs saw kinkladze score the only goal of the game with a 20-yard 18 m chip over southall
lines.name: English

lines.value: in his last season with dinamo the team once again won the double
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze had scored 14 goals in 21 appearances and clubs from several countries expressed interest in signing him
lines.name: English

lines.value: jordania kept true to his agreement with lee and on 15 july 1995 kinkladze signed for manchester city
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fee was generally reported as £2 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: after initial difficulties obtaining a work permit kinkladze made his debut for manchester city against tottenham hotspur in a 1 1 draw on 19 august 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: manchester city's form was poor during the 1995 96 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team failed to win a single league game in the first three months of the season but kinkladze quickly became a popular figure
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze's first goal for the club occurred in a 1 0 win against aston villa following a one two with niall quinn
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze was initially homesick as he was living in a hotel and spoke little english
lines.name: English

lines.value: in an effort to resolve his homesickness his mother moved to manchester to provide him with familiar food
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the time manchester city travelled to middlesbrough on 9 december 1995 press and supporters regarded kinkladze as the star player of the manchester city side
lines.name: English

lines.value: the match against middlesbrough was billed as a contest between kinkladze and the brazilian playmaker juninho
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze scored the opening goal with a solo effort but the match ended 4 1 to middlesbrough
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the middlesbrough fans subsequently voted kinkladze the best opposing player of the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 16 march 1996 kinkladze scored a particularly spectacular goal in a 2 1 win against southampton
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze beat five players before the ball over southampton goalkeeper dave beasant
lines.name: English

lines.value: the goal won bbc programme match of the day's goal of the month and placed second in the programme's goal of the season competition
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the final day of the season manchester city were relegated to the first division prompting transfer speculation linking kinkladze to a number of clubs including barcelona internazionale liverpool and celtic
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he opted to stay at manchester city where he had been named player of the year for 1995 96
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1996 97 season proved a turbulent one for manchester city and over the course of the season kinkladze played for five different managers
lines.name: English

lines.value: with keith curle no longer at the club kinkladze became the main penalty taker and also scored a number of goals from free kicks including a 35-yard 32 m effort against swindon town described by english newspaper manchester evening news as like a missile
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the first division kinkladze frequently had two or even three opposing players assigned to man mark him
lines.name: English

lines.value: several teams chose to combat kinkladze's playmaking skill with robust tackles in one such match on 11 january 1997 against crystal palace kinkladze had to be stretchered off following a challenge by david hopkin
lines.name: English

lines.value: manchester city finished the season well below the promotion places and again there was speculation that kinkladze would leave the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the final match of the season on 3 may 1997 a 3 2 win against reading manchester city supporters campaigned to keep kinkladze at the club even though he was not playing in the match due to injury
lines.name: English

lines.value: the campaign even extended to the half time advertisements on the scoreboard the adverts being messages from supporter groups who had paid to display them
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze was named player of the year for the second consecutive season and one month after the season ended he announced his intention to stay at the club by signing a new three year contract
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze used the proceeds from his new contract to buy a ferrari though the car caused consternation among club officials
lines.name: English

lines.value: their fears were realised on 29 october 1997 when kinkladze lost control of his vehicle and crashed into a motorway bridge in hale
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze received back injuries requiring 30 stitches and missed two matches as a result
lines.name: English

lines.value: manchester city's downward trajectory toward the second division continued in the 1997 98 season and on 17 february 1998 manager frank clark was sacked
lines.name: English

lines.value: his replacement joe royle was appointed city manager on 18 february 1998
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had a reputation for playing defensive midfielders which led to his everton team being nicknamed the dogs of war
lines.name: English

lines.value: royle viewed kinkladze as an unaffordable luxury in a relegation battle and in his first board meeting as manchester city manager he opened proceedings with the words we have to sell kinkladze
lines.name: English

lines.value: after playing the first two games under royle a 1 2 loss on 18 february against ipswich town and a 3 1 win against swindon town on 23 february kinkladze sustained an ankle injury which sidelined him for a month
lines.name: English

lines.value: he made his return at port vale on 14 march despite having taken little part in training in the preceding week
lines.name: English

lines.value: port vale were a team with a physically robust approach and used the muddy conditions to their advantage
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze was played out of position on the right wing much to his displeasure and gave a performance that the manchester evening news summarised as barely noticeable
lines.name: English

lines.value: vale defeated city 2 1 and royle severely criticised kinkladze for a lack of effort dropping him for the next six games
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2005 royle explained his view of kinkladze in his autobiography to the supporters he was the only positive in all that time
lines.name: English

lines.value: to me he was a big negative
lines.name: English

lines.value: i am not saying that city's ills were all down to kinkladze but there was too much about the whole kinkladze cult phenomenon that wasn't right too often since his arrival the team had underperformed
lines.name: English

lines.value: i couldn't help deducing that contrary to popular opinion he would be my weak link not my strong one with two games remaining manchester city were in the relegation places and kinkladze was restored to the starting lineup for the home match against queens park rangers qpr
lines.name: English

lines.value: the qpr team contained vinnie jones who had a violent reputation and played using the axiom if their top geezer gets sorted out early doors you win
lines.name: English

lines.value: jones tried to apply his philosophy to kinkladze even targeting him in the tunnel before the start of the match
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze opened the scoring with a free kick but city could not maintain their lead
lines.name: English

lines.value: defending described by the observer's reporter as a calamity culminated in an unusual own goal from jamie pollock and meant the match ended in a 2 2 draw
lines.name: English

lines.value: city were relegated for the second time in three seasons despite a final day 5 2 win against stoke city
lines.name: English

lines.value: in total kinkladze made 119 appearances for manchester city scoring 22 goals
lines.name: English

lines.value: he played regular international football during this period of his career including in a 0 0 draw with three time world cup winners italy
lines.name: English

lines.value: following transfer negotiations which had been ongoing in the final months of the season kinkladze left manchester city for dutch club ajax for £5 million
lines.name: English

lines.value: the move brought a reunion with shota arveladze with whom he shared a house in amsterdam
lines.name: English

lines.value: however kinkladze's spell at ajax proved unsuccessful
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was originally signed as a replacement for jari litmanen but litmanen stayed at ajax as his proposed move to barcelona fell through
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result kinkladze played in an unfamiliar left wing position
lines.name: English

lines.value: his league debut for ajax came in a 2 0 win against willem ii on 23 august 1998 but he made few starts
lines.name: English

lines.value: to compound matters manager morten olsen was sacked early in the season and a disagreement with replacement jan wouters resulted in kinkladze losing his place in the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: i could have been maradona and he wouldn't have changed the system to accommodate me kinkladze recalled later
lines.name: English

lines.value: i wasn't playing football and that made my life hell he immediately started to look elsewhere
lines.name: English

lines.value: several english top flight clubs showed interest in signing him but were discouraged by work permit issues
lines.name: English

lines.value: his lack of regular playing time also resulted in him losing his place in the georgian national team
lines.name: English

lines.value: having failed to established himself in the first team and struggling with a succession of injuries he made just 12 appearances for ajax in his first season
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze was not issued a squad number for his second season and was made to train with the reserve team
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 1999 kinkladze held transfer talks with sheffield united but no move materialised
lines.name: English

lines.value: two months later a return to england was secured in the form of a loan move to derby county
lines.name: English

lines.value: as kinkladze was not playing regular international football when he signed for derby he was not automatically entitled to a work permit but a review panel gave him special dispensation due to his previous contribution to english football
lines.name: English

lines.value: he made his debut on 28 november 1999 coming on as a substitute for avi nimni in a 1 2 loss against arsenal the first of 14 loan appearances
lines.name: English

lines.value: he scored his first derby goal on 4 march 2000 in a 4 0 win against wimbledon
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of the season the loan move was made permanent
lines.name: English

lines.value: the transfer fee of £3 million set a club record that stood until 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze missed the start of the 2000 01 season due to a hernia operation to the disappointment of smith who expected him to become a leading figure at the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: he returned to the side as a substitute against middlesbrough on 6 september 2000
lines.name: English

lines.value: with derby 3 0 down kinkladze and malcolm christie were introduced in a double substitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pair then proved influential as derby came back to draw the match 3 3
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the next four months kinkladze was sometimes a starter and sometimes a substitute rotating with stefano eranio until a groin injury sustained in the return match with middlesbrough kept kinkladze out for two months
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the season kinkladze showed little of the brilliance he was bought in to deliver and was named derby's biggest disappointment of the season by the guardian
lines.name: English

lines.value: the match against leeds united on 23 september 2000 was a rare success for him
lines.name: English

lines.value: he came on as a substitute with 17 minutes remaining and levelled the game 1 1 with a solo goal two minutes later jinking between two defenders before curling a left foot shot beyond the goalkeeper
lines.name: English

lines.value: derby struggled for most of the season but avoided relegation
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze stayed at the club since his injuries and inability to prove himself led to a lack of serious offers
lines.name: English

lines.value: around this time he married louise tai a
lines.name: English

lines.value: louise then became a member of the orthodox church and was christened in tbilisi receiving a new name - mariam
lines.name: English

lines.value: their first child saba was born in october 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: for kinkladze the start of the 2001 02 season followed a similar pattern to the previous season comprising a mixture of starts and substitute appearances
lines.name: English

lines.value: jim smith resigned from his managerial position at derby on 7 october 2001 leaving kinkladze a smith favourite bitterly disappointed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the appointment of new manager colin todd signalled a change in the club's playing style
lines.name: English

lines.value: todd did not favour flair players and kinkladze made only a single substitute appearance in todd's first two months in charge
lines.name: English

lines.value: frustrated by a lack of opportunities kinkladze took the unusual step of using his lawyer to arrange a meeting with todd to discuss his exclusion from the first team
lines.name: English

lines.value: todd reacted by telling kinkladze he could leave the club if he was unhappy
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to kinkladze's agent manchester city as well as spanish clubs valencia mallorca and malaga were all interested in signing kinkladze
lines.name: English

lines.value: however todd was sacked on 14 january 2002 with derby second from bottom of the premier league and john gregory was appointed as manager on 30 january 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze stayed at the club playing regular first team football in the remainder of the season but derby continued to struggle and kinkladze endured relegation for the third time in his career
lines.name: English

lines.value: the club who were £35 million in debt started an end of season clear out to reduce their annual £17 million wage bill
lines.name: English

lines.value: derby's actions included off loading of some of the highest earners and the manager informed kinkladze that he had no future at the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: however kinkladze whose contract ended in summer 2003 was reluctant to leave the club and turned down a move to turkish champions galatasaray
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the club continued its attempts to terminate kinkladze's contract he trained with the reserve team up to 29 september 2002 missing derby's first five matches of the 2002 03 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was brought back to the first team following two defeats introduced as a substitute after an hour's stalemate against stoke city on 31 august
lines.name: English

lines.value: his introduction proved crucial in turning the game into a 2 0 win for derby as he took part in the build up of both goals
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then missed a number of matches through injuries featuring in around half of derby's games in the remainder of 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 2002 georgian national team manager aleksandr chivadze unexpectedly omitted kinkladze and captain georgi nemsadze from the team for their match against russia causing a stir in georgia
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze surprised and disappointed said when i was out of form he constantly phoned me asked me about my play and called me to the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: now i'm fit scoring goals but he didn't call me and even didn't phone both kinkladze and nemsadze returned to the starting line up for the next european championship qualifying match on against ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: by january because of the financial crisis at derby kinkladze had not been paid for more than three months
lines.name: English

lines.value: he intended to quit but although his agent admitted interest from german side hamburg and a second enquiry from galatasaray no move transpired and he remained at the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: he played for derby more often in the second half of the season and his form resulted in him being named the supporters player of the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: derby finished the season in the bottom half of the table and needed to reduce costs for the next season as their premier league parachute payments had ended
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result derby offered kinkladze a one year contract but on a wage one third of that of his previous contract
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze decided to turn down this contract extension proposal desiring a move to a more successful club with a chance of winning trophies
lines.name: English

lines.value: to this end he held talks with liverpool in may 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: as contract negotiations with derby did not reach a positive conclusion kinkladze left the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: without a club during pre season kinkladze trained with portsmouth where his former manager jim smith was on the managing staff
lines.name: English

lines.value: he played for portsmouth in one pre season friendly but portsmouth decided instead to sign another former manchester city playmaker eyal berkovic
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the next few months he was linked with moves to scottish clubs dundee and celtic and later leeds united but none resulted in a contract offer
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a consequence he had to train individually and lost his place in the national team again this time before the return match against russia
lines.name: English

lines.value: in december 2003 kinkladze went for a one week trial at panathinaikos following an invitation from giannis vardinogiannis the owner of the greek club
lines.name: English

lines.value: however at the end of the trial the club decided not to sign him
lines.name: English

lines.value: six months later he was linked with a move to russian club shinnik yaroslavl but again he was not offered a contract
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze's year and a half spell without a club came to an end in october 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze's former international teammate temuri ketsbaia was player manager at financially troubled cypriot team anorthosis
lines.name: English

lines.value: ketsbaia gave his old friend a chance to rebuild his career offering him a contract to play for anorthosis
lines.name: English

lines.value: he made his debut against title contenders apoel on 21 november and marked it with a fine goal
lines.name: English

lines.value: he scored once more in a 5 0 home victory against olympiakos nicosia and in february he was recalled to georgia's squad for the friendly against lithuania
lines.name: English

lines.value: his contract was initially only for one season but the club extended it for another year
lines.name: English

lines.value: anorthosis ended the season successfully by winning the cypriot championship and earned a place in the qualifying rounds of 2005 06 uefa champions league where thanks to the club's good run kinkladze played five times
lines.name: English

lines.value: he started both legs of a 2 1 first round aggregate win against dinamo minsk was twice a substitute in a 3 2 second round aggregate win against super lig runners up trabzonspor and played the full 90 minutes in a 1 2 third round home defeat against rangers
lines.name: English

lines.value: his display against rangers caught the attention of rubin kazan's manager gurban berdiyew who invited him to join the russian club
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 22 august 2005 kinkladze played his last game for anorthosis against omonia in the cypriot super cup and two days later on the day of the second leg of the tie against rangers he left to close a deal with rubin
lines.name: English

lines.value: ketsbaia said regarding the departure i don't want players who have no wish to play for anorthosis
lines.name: English

lines.value: as far as i'm concerned the kinkladze chapter is now closed
lines.name: English

lines.value: anorthosis and rubin reached an agreement on 26 august
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze signed a contract until the end of the season becoming the most decorated georgian footballer to play in the russian premier league
lines.name: English

lines.value: he made his debut for rubin the next day playing the full 90 minutes in a 1 2 defeat against fc rostov
lines.name: English

lines.value: on a personal level the debut was a successful one his corner kick was headed into the net by vitalijs astafjevs for rubin's goal
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had less remarkable performances in the next two games and was substituted both times
lines.name: English

lines.value: this did not affect berdyev's faith in him and at a post match press conference he defended kinkladze he needs time
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is an experienced player who i think will help the team the next game for rubin was a 5 1 away win against low ranked terek grozny and kinkladze made a considerable contribution to it scoring two goals and making two assists
lines.name: English

lines.value: against tom tomsk he was less successful
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze missed a late penalty denying rubin a vital victory
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the match berdyev claimed he made a mistake in his choice of penalty taker
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite his misgivings berdyev kept kinkladze in the team where he was used as one of three offensive midfielders in a 4 2 3 1 formation
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze with his technical style and inclination for improvisation brought more variety to the attacking play of the team in contrast to the restrained style of play that berdyev favoured
lines.name: English

lines.value: he provided an assist in four consecutive matches
lines.name: English

lines.value: the most important of these was against zenit st petersburg in a match that decided a place in the following year's uefa cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: subsequently he received a recall to the georgian national squad for friendlies against bulgaria and jordan
lines.name: English

lines.value: however a muscle strain meant he missed both national team games and rubin's final league match
lines.name: English

lines.value: he ended the 2005 season with seven assists and two goals in nine appearances for rubin
lines.name: English

lines.value: rubin delayed in offering kinkladze a contract extension leading anorthosis to make an attempt to resign him early in the pre season but kinkladze rejected the offer as he wished to stay at rubin
lines.name: English

lines.value: by late december rubin expressed a desire to retain him but contract talks were delayed due to family reasons and it took until mid january for a new one year contract to be agreed
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his successful 2005 season 32-year-old kinkladze said he hoped to play on well into his thirties
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2006 season however was his last
lines.name: English

lines.value: he sustained an injury in rubin's first competitive match a 1 0 cup match defeat against shinnik which proved to be the last time he played a full match
lines.name: English

lines.value: a recurrence of an old injury meant he was sidelined for longer than expected only making his return to full training in late may
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze continued to struggle to maintain fitness making five further appearances for rubin two of which were starts
lines.name: English

lines.value: a match against rostov on 20 august 2006 was the last of kinkladze's playing career
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september he was called to the georgia national team but did not play or appear on the substitutes bench
lines.name: English

lines.value: a short time later he had to undergo another course of medical treatment
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also passed a thorough medical examination the results of which were reported as the deciding factor for his future at the club
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october he was an unused substitute just once he and his compatriots were the subject of criticism from rubin's general director who announced to the press there are questions about the georgians in the team regarding their training and attitude to football
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november kinkladze again suffered an injury and missed the remainder of the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a disappointing year for kinkladze rubin decided not to renew his contract
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 2007 he held talks with his previous club anorthosis but the transfer never materialised
lines.name: English

lines.value: in an interview in august 2007 kinkladze's former international teammate malkhaz asatiani confirmed that kinkladze had finished his career and settled in moscow
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze later worked as a sports agent and in august 2011 returned to his former club anorthosis where he was employed as sports director until an amicable departure in june 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: kinkladze's position was as a playmaking midfielder typically playing further forward than the rest of the midfield
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main aim of the role is to create goalscoring chances suiting a creative player like kinkladze
lines.name: English

lines.value: dribbling ability was generally viewed as one of kinkladze's strongest attributes and his jinking runs with the ball resulted in some spectacular goals most notably his goal of the month against southampton
lines.name: English

lines.value: set piece ability was another of kinkladze's strengths he regularly took corners and free kicks
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also took penalties seven of his manchester city goals were scored from the spot though he stopped taking penalties for the club following two consecutive misses in the 1997 98 season
lines.name: English

lines.value: two of his nine goals for georgia were also penalties
lines.name: English

lines.value: weaker points of kinkladze's game were those related to defending
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was not noted for tackling which sometimes caused frustration for his managers colin todd remarked wistfully in 2001 that georgi has to understand that there is an art to tackling
lines.name: English

lines.value: unwillingness to tackle and accusations of a lack of effort were also the source of joe royle's omission of kinkladze from his manchester city side
lines.name: English

lines.value: on occasions kinkladze played as a second striker a role with less positional responsibility
lines.name: English

lines.value: periods when kinkladze was used in this way included frank clark's first months as manchester city manager and alongside fabrizio ravanelli at derby county
lines.name: English

lines.value: though a left footed player he did not perform well when played as a left winger and publicly expressed his distaste for playing in the position
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the course of his career he was georgian player of the year twice won the club player of the year three times at english clubs and has been described by a russian football history as the brightest georgian talent of the 1990s
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2005 he placed third in a bbc poll to find manchester city's all time cult hero
lines.name: English

lines.value: :'scores and results list georgia's goal tally first
lines.name: English

lines.value: brian mcguire 13 december 1945 in east melbourne &ndash 29 august 1977 at brands hatch uk was a racing driver and constructor from australia
lines.name: English

lines.value: mcguire travelled over to the uk from australia with another hopeful young driver alan jones but did not enjoy his countryman's success
lines.name: English

lines.value: mcguire entered two formula one british grands prix
lines.name: English

lines.value: with his privately run williams fw04 at the 1976 british grand prix he found himself as a reserve entry and was denied a chance to compete
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the 1977 race he modified his williams fw04 and renamed it the mcguire bm1 but failed to pre qualify
lines.name: English

lines.value: mcguire was killed practicing this car during a shellsport g8 championship race at brands hatch later that year
lines.name: English

lines.value: key note results shown in bold indicate pole position results in italics indicate fastest lap
lines.name: English

lines.value: key note results shown in bold indicate pole position results in italics indicate fastest lap
lines.name: English

lines.value: key races in bold indicate pole position races in italics indicate fastest lap
lines.name: English

lines.value: conduit current collection is a system of electric current collection used by electric tramways where the power supply was carried in a conduit under the roadway
lines.name: English

lines.value: the power rails are contained in a conduit midway between and below the two surface rails on which the cars operate in much the same fashion as the cable for cable cars
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conduit contains two t section steel power rails of opposite polarity facing each other about apart and about below the street surface
lines.name: English

lines.value: power reached the car by means of an attachment called a plough us plow that rode in the conduit beneath the car
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plough had two metal shoes attached to springs that pushed sideways against the power rails
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plough was normally connected to a platform that could slide laterally to conform with variations in the placement of the conduit for example in some areas there was a conduit for cable cars adjacent to the one for electric cars
lines.name: English

lines.value: the current was carried by a flexible cable from the plough through the platform to the car's controller and motor(s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the running rails are not part of the electrical circuit
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the united states the cars were sometimes popularly but incorrectly called trolleys but did not typically draw power through a trolley pole from an overhead wire as strictly defined trolley cars do
lines.name: English

lines.value: conduit current collection was one of the first ways of supplying power to trams but it proved to be much more expensive complicated and trouble prone than overhead wires
lines.name: English

lines.value: when electric street railways became ubiquitous it was only used in those cities that did not permit overhead wires including london paris berlin marseilles budapest and prague in europe and the new york city borough of manhattan and washington dc in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: in denver colorado the world's second electric street railway in 1885 pioneered conduit current collection
lines.name: English

lines.value: difficulties with the conduit and the streetcars led to the replacement of conduit cars and lines with cable cars by 1888
lines.name: English

lines.value: new york city had the largest installation of conduit cars due to the prohibition of overhead wires on manhattan island although a few bronx based trolley lines entered the northern reaches of manhattan using overhead wire
lines.name: English

lines.value: trolley lines from brooklyn and queens also entered manhattan under wire but did not use city streets
lines.name: English

lines.value: the primary reason for the initial adoption of conduit systems was for aesthetic reasons as an alternative to overhead wiring that was often objected to as being unsightly
lines.name: English

lines.value: the expense of creating conduit lines in new york was reduced where it was possible to convert the cable vaults from discontinued cable car lines
lines.name: English

lines.value: the huge cost of building new conduits gave new york the distinction of having one of the last horsecar lines the bleecker street line in the us not closing until 1917
lines.name: English

lines.value: pittsburgh ran the last us horsecar in 1923 in some old photographs two slots may be seen between the rails
lines.name: English

lines.value: in new york city sometimes one slot was used for a cable line and the other for electric cars
lines.name: English

lines.value: occasionally two competitive lines shared a common track and had independent slots for the ploughs of the respective cars
lines.name: English

lines.value: in new york city the queensboro bridge between manhattan and queens had tracks installed on the outer lanes with conduits for manhattan cars in addition to overhead wires
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conduit allowed them to run to queens plaza terminus without need for removing the plough and raising the poles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in later years the conduit was removed and only trolley wire remained
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the centre of brussels some tram lines were fitted with conduits the last ones being converted to overhead operation during world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: the system was tried in the seaside resort of blackpool uk but was soon abandoned as sand and saltwater entered the conduit and caused breakdowns and there was a problem with voltage drop
lines.name: English

lines.value: some sections of track still had the conduit slot visible until the tramway was refurbished in 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: washington dc had a large network of conduit lines to avoid wires
lines.name: English

lines.value: some lines used overhead wires when they approached rural or suburban areas
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last such line ran to cabin john maryland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the current collector plow was mounted underneath the car on a fitting just forward of the rear truck on pcc streetcars
lines.name: English

lines.value: it had two cables with female connectors on cables to attach to matching cables of the car's electrical system
lines.name: English

lines.value: a plowman was assigned at each changeover point from overhead trolley wire to conduit to remove the cable attachments to the car and stow the plow which did not remain with the car and was reattached in an incoming car running on overhead wire
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lower section of the plow board was drawn by the moving car within the cavity of the conduit
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of this usage many of washington's streetcars carried trolley poles which were lowered while operating in the central part of the city when the cars reached a point where they switched to overhead operation they stopped over a plow pit where the conduit plows were detached and the trolley poles raised the reverse operation taking place on inbound runs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the pit here has the meaning analogous to racing circuit pits rather than a depression in the road
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the uk london had a hybrid network of double deck trams overhead collection was used in the outer sections and conduit in the centre
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the changeover from conduit to overhead wire at a change pit the process was largely automatic
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conductor put the trolley pole onto the wire and as the tram moved forward the conduit channel veered sideways to outside the running track automatically ejecting the plough the tram was said to be shooting the plough
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the changeover from overhead wire to conduit the process was a little more complicated
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tram pulled up alongside a ploughman who engaged a two pronged plough fork over the plough in a short length of unelectrified conduit and into the plough channel underneath the centre of the tram
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the tram drew forward the conduit channel moved under the tram carrying the plough into position
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conductor pulled down the trolley pole and stowed it
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ploughman's job was a fairly skilled one because if he failed to locate the plough fork correctly it or the plough could jam in the plough channel and cause lengthy delays
lines.name: English

lines.value: some tram designs required an extra carrier to be located with the plough and these frequently caused problems for ploughmen not used to the design particularly if the tram had been diverted from its normal route
lines.name: English

lines.value: new conduit track was laid in 1951 for the festival of britain which commemorated the great exhibition of 1851
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last tram was withdrawn in june 1952 and virtually all the tracks had been removed by the 1970s although a short section can still be seen at the entrance to the former kingsway tramway subway
lines.name: English

lines.value: other european hybrid tramway networks included paris nice lyon lille and bordeaux in france berlin vienna and budapest
lines.name: English

lines.value: in paris the conduit sections were frequently very short requiring cars to change from overhead to conduit and back several times in one journey
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last conduit line in paris closed in 1936 while the last bordeaux conduit car ran in 1953
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conduit systems in berlin vienna and budapest were very short lived being replaced by overhead wires before world war i
lines.name: English

lines.value: robert blackwell docking october 9 1925october 8 1983 was the 38th governor of kansas from 1967 until 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in kansas city missouri docking attended public school in lawrence kansas before attending the university of kansas and served in the united states army air forces during world war ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the war docking moved to arkansas city kansas where he became a successful banker and was elected mayor
lines.name: English

lines.value: docking was elected governor in 1966 as a member of the democratic party over the incumbent republican william avery whom docking harangued for leaving the state when there was work to be done in kansas
lines.name: English

lines.value: docking served more terms than any other kansas governor but is tied for length of service because of a constitutional amendment approved during his final term which provided that kansas governors serve four year terms and are constitutionally prohibited from running for more than two terms
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was known for his commitment to farmers small business owners and the environment
lines.name: English

lines.value: the son of former gov george docking 1957–1961 he was married to meredith and they had two sons william and tom the latter of whom served as lieutenant governor and ran unsuccessfully for the governorship in 1988
lines.name: English

lines.value: after his service as governor docking resumed his former profession of banking in arkansas city

lines.value: he donated his papers to the university of kansas rather than give them to the kansas state historical society where the papers of his 34 predecessors are stored with the exception of his father who burned his gubernatorial papers

lines.value: he died of emphysema in 1983 in merriam kansas the day before his 58th birthday and is interred in highland park cemetery in kansas city kansas in a plot adjoining his parents

lines.value: a state office building across the street from the capital in topeka kansas bears his name and his bank in arkansas city union state bank which is still owned by the dockings is on the national register of historic places

lines.value: a chicago newspaper reporter ernie souchak belushi is investigating a corrupt city councilman
lines.name: English

lines.value: after doing an expose on some corrupt land dealings by the councilman he is assaulted by two crooked police officers sent by the councilman and ends up in the hospital
lines.name: English

lines.value: souchak's editor decides to send him out of town for his own safety
lines.name: English

lines.value: a city boy souchak reluctantly travels to the rockies to interview the reclusive dr nell porter brown who has been conducting research on bald eagles for several years
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two are at odds at first
lines.name: English

lines.value: after finding out he is a reporter she is reluctant to let him stay but realizes he is not able to survive in the mountains without his guide who is not scheduled to return for two weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is skeptical about her work but comes to admire porter for her strong character and dedication
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually they fall in love
lines.name: English

lines.value: at first she lets him stay as long as he doesn't write his story
lines.name: English

lines.value: as they learn to respect each other she agrees to let him write about her
lines.name: English

lines.value: in his adventures he sprains his back in an accident is mauled by a mountain lion and meets an all american football player who has left civilization and become a mountain man
lines.name: English

lines.value: souchak returns to chicago with her still very much on his mind
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he finds out that one of his sources has been accidentally killed he once again pursues the investigation until the day the councilman flees the country
lines.name: English

lines.value: the same day souchak finds out that porter is coming to chicago to do a presentation at a symposium
lines.name: English

lines.value: with some uncertainty souchak decides to attend the presentation
lines.name: English

lines.value: they rekindle their relationship
lines.name: English

lines.value: happy as they are together they cannot reconcile the different paths each has taken in life and so they reluctantly decide to part again
lines.name: English

lines.value: souchak seeing her off on the train ends up traveling with her all the way back to wyoming
lines.name: English

lines.value: after getting off at her stop they decide that they cannot do without each other and decide to marry
lines.name: English

lines.value: the movie ends with him catching the train back to chicago and the newlyweds promising to meet again very soon
lines.name: English

lines.value: singer helen reddy performed the ending theme never say goodbye

lines.value: battling siki september 16 1897 &ndash december 15 1925 aka louis mbarick fall was a french senegalese light heavyweight boxer born in senegal who fought from 1912 to 1925 and briefly reigned as the world light heavyweight champion after knocking out georges carpentier
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was born baye fall in the port city of saint louis senegal
lines.name: English

lines.value: while still a teenager siki changed his name and moved to metropolitan france where by the age of 15 he began his professional boxing career
lines.name: English

lines.value: siki's early years were inauspicious
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1912 to 1914 he compiled a record of just eight wins six losses and two draws
lines.name: English

lines.value: when world war i erupted siki joined the french army serving in the 8th colonial infantry regiment
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the war he was decorated for bravery in battle with the croix de guerre and the medaille militaire before being honorably discharged
lines.name: English

lines.value: after his discharge from the military siki resumed his boxing career
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october and november 1920 siki boxed two matches in the concertgebouw in amsterdam the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was romantically involved with a dutch woman lijntje van appelteer who became his common law wife
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 16 1921 she bore him a son louis junior
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this period he taught boxing at the amateur boxing club de jonge bokser the young boxer
lines.name: English

lines.value: from november 1 1919 until he faced georges carpentier for the world light heavyweight championship in 1922 siki compiled the impressive record of 43 wins in 46 bouts 21 kos suffering just one loss on a decision and two draws
lines.name: English

lines.value: carpentier the reigning world and european champion agreed to fight siki for the title and they met in paris france on september 24 1922
lines.name: English

lines.value: siki claimed that he had agreed to take a dive but when carpentier dropped siki the outraged african decided to get up and fight
lines.name: English

lines.value: although he had agreed to throw the fight he did not intend to get beat up doing so.in the sixth round siki hit carpentier with a powerful right uppercut that appeared to put carpentier down and out for the count
lines.name: English

lines.value: the referee however claimed siki had tripped carpentier and awarded the bout to the unconscious champion on a foul
lines.name: English

lines.value: fearing a riot from the aroused crowd the three ringside judges overruled the referee and siki was eventually declared the champion
lines.name: English

lines.value: siki then embarked on a well publicized rampage of partying and carousing
lines.name: English

lines.value: he would walk his pet lion down the champs-elysees while wearing his top hat and tuxedo
lines.name: English

lines.value: siki was known to fire his revolvers in the air in public as a means of prompting his two great danes to do tricks
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was constantly reported drinking champagne in night clubs and spent freely on flashy clothes and partying
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was fond of white women and both his wives were white
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this time offers poured in from the united states for the colorful siki to meet the leading heavyweight contender harry wills middleweight champion johnny wilson and the legendary harry greb
lines.name: English

lines.value: attempts were even made to match siki with the then reigning heavyweight champion jack dempsey
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead siki signed to defend his title against irish light heavyweight mike mctigue on saint patrick's day in dublin
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bout was controversial and siki lost his belt on decision and lost the title
lines.name: English

lines.value: this defeat was the first loss in a downward trend of dissipation and poor ring performances suffered by siki which culminated in his death a little over a month after his last fight
lines.name: English

lines.value: after losing his european title on a foul siki moved to the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: his record in the states was poor and he failed to defeat any top notch fighters
lines.name: English

lines.value: his failure to train properly was evident his record after winning the title was a dismal 11 wins 7 kos 17 losses 1 draw and 2 no contests
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was during this time period that he suffered the only two knockout defeats of his career
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 23 he married artist lillian werner of memphis tennessee who was seven years his senior in a civil marriage
lines.name: English

lines.value: werner was registered as white making theirs a rare mixed race marriage at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time of his wedding friends of siki from france alleged that he was still married to a dutch woman living in france who had born him a child two years earlier
lines.name: English

lines.value: even in the states siki continued to carouse and train on booze and street brawls
lines.name: English

lines.value: often he would get drunk in speakeasies refuse to pay the tab and fight his way out
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 15 1925 he was stopped by a policeman who saw him staggering drunk on 42nd street not far from his apartment in new york city
lines.name: English

lines.value: siki stated that he was on his way home and walked off
lines.name: English

lines.value: later he was found lying face down shot twice in the back at close range dead at the age of 28.the rev adam clayton powell the father of adam clayton powell jr presided over his funeral which was held in harlem new york
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was survived by his widow lillian werner phal whom he had married a year earlier
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was initially buried at flushing cemetery
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1993 his remains were repatriated to his home city of saint louis senegal
lines.name: English

lines.value: his record was 64-25-5 with 35 knockouts
lines.name: English

lines.value: prince daniil vasiliyevich shchenya ;
lines.name: English

lines.value: - no later than 1519 was a leading russian military leader during the reigns of ivan iii and vasili iii
lines.name: English

lines.value: schenya was a gediminid princeling whose great grandfather was a son of patrikas
lines.name: English

lines.value: he settled in moscow and married a sister of the grand duke
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1489 the prince and his army of 64000 men besieged and captured the city of kirov then known as khlynov the inhabitants of which had often pillaged northern grand duchy of moscow
lines.name: English

lines.value: all citizens of khlynov were taken to different muscovite towns the fittest of them were moved to moscow
lines.name: English

lines.value: shchenya took an active part in the muscovite lithuanian wars against the grand duchy of lithuania and border disputes and skirmishes which had preceded the war
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1493 shchenya and his relative prince vasili ivanovich patrikeyev also known as vassian kosoy captured the city of vyazma and transferred its princes to moscow
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the russo swedish war 1496-1499 his army devastated finland
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1499 under the leadership of prince daniil kholmsky shchenya defeated the grand hetman of lithuania konstanty ostrogski in the battle of vedrosha and took him prisoner
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1501 his army was crushed in the battle of the siritsa river by wolter von plettenberg master of the livonian order and ally of the lithuanian ruler alexander jagiellon
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the fall of ivan yuriyevich patrikeyev and his son in law semeon ivanovich ryapolovsky shchenya took the post of the second voyevoda of moscow
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1508 he and dmitriy shemyachich unsuccessfully sieged orsha
lines.name: English

lines.value: that same year shchenya became the first voyevoda of moscow after the fall of daniil kholmsky
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1514 shchenya crowned his military career by capturing smolensk from the lithuanians
lines.name: English

lines.value: grindstone island is the fourth largest of the thousand islands in the st lawrence river and the second largest of the american islands in the st lawrence
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island lies near lake ontario and is part of the united states of america
lines.name: English

lines.value: in particular the island is part of the town of clayton in jefferson county new york
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island contains potters beach a private vineyard owned by the purcell family summer gift shops four active beef farms historic but now abandoned farmlands and private non government conservation lands owned by the thousand island land trust tilt
lines.name: English

lines.value: new york state's last operating one room school was on the island and closed in 1989
lines.name: English

lines.value: the current number of year round households on the island is ten however the population climbs to 700 people during the summer months
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first known settlement occurred in 1804
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island was once considered to be part of canada but since 1823 has been recognized as part of the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: shortly afterwards a dispute over some harvested trees created a brief disturbance called the grindstone island war in which american militia attempted to prevent the removal of the logs
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1831 the entire island was purchased by eliza evertson the widow of nicholas evertson and the grandmother of edgar saltus for $15000
lines.name: English

lines.value: the evertson family owned the island for over 40 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early 1900s the island acquired enough of a population to have two school buildings built a lower school house which is now a private home by the cross island bridge and an upper school house which is now the grindstone island cultural center which gives out a scholarship once a year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island also has a methodist church founded in 1899 with services on sundays with a community center dodge hall across the street with dances on saturday nights in the summer and a no longer functioning creamery and cheese factory
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island also has one of the few natural beaches in the thousand island region open to the public potter's beach
lines.name: English

lines.value: lumber and granite quarries were important in the early economy
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island is a self sustaining environment that operates on an honor system however infrastructure such as electricity is provided by the town of clayton new york
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are no bridges onto grindstone save when the river freezes or formal ferry services onto grindstone island
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a community dock the town dock in aunt jane's bay provided for visitors on aunt jane's bay some inlanders who live inland on the island park their vehicles along the road
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a normal us postal service delivery route onto the island monday through saturday
lines.name: English

lines.value: the island also recently received street signs marking the island's few official unpaved roads
lines.name: English

lines.value: the people who live on this island are known to locals as islanders
lines.name: English

lines.value: the grindstone island upper schoolhouse was added to the national register of historic places in 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: hot foot powder is used in african american hoodoo folk magic to drive unwanted people away
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a mixture of herbs and minerals virtually always including chilli powder salt pepper and chilli flakes
lines.name: English

lines.value: other ingredients such as wasp's nests sulfur and graveyard dirt are sometimes added
lines.name: English

lines.value: it shares certain common uses with the mexican sal negra or black salt it also shows some overlapping uses with goofer dust which also is known to create restlessness and drive people away
lines.name: English

lines.value: harry m hyatt collected several recipes and spells for hot foot powder
lines.name: English

lines.value: some modes of deploying hot foot collected by him include secreting a small amount into the victim's shoes or clothing mixing it with a victim's foottrack or placing a paper with the victim's name into a bottle with hot foot powder and disposing of it in a river
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1930s song hell hound on my trail the famous blues musician robert johnson said you sprinkled hot foot powder [...] all around your daddy's door it keep me with rambling mind rider every old place i go in 2000 the british rock guitarist peter green released a cd called hot foot powder containing 13 covers of songs written by robert johnson

lines.value: lgbt culture is a culture shared by lesbian gay bisexual transgender questioning and intersex people and may include unmentioned lesser known orientations and identities such as pansexual or asexual individuals

lines.value: it is sometimes referred to as queer culture indicating people who are queer while the term gay culture may be used to mean lgbt culture or to refer specifically to homosexual male culture

lines.value: lgbt culture varies widely by geography and the identity of the participants

lines.value: such lgbt communities organize special events in addition to pride parades celebrating their culture such as the gay games and southern decadence

lines.value: according to herdt homosexuality was the main term used until the late 1950s and early 1960s after that a new gay culture emerged

lines.value: this new gay culture increasingly marks a full spectrum of social life not only same sex desires but gay selves gay neighbors and gay social practices that are distinctive of our affluent postindustrial society

lines.value: during the 19th and early 20th centuries gay culture was covert relying on secret symbols and codes woven into an overall straight context

lines.value: gay influence in early america was primarily limited to high culture

lines.value: the association of gay men with opera ballet couture fine cuisine musical theater the golden age of hollywood and interior design began with wealthy homosexual men using the straight themes of these media to send their own signals

lines.value: an australian study conducted by roffee and waling in 2016 discovered how some gay men felt like they were expected to be hyper sexual

lines.value: participants reported how other gay men would automatically assume that any interaction had sexual motivations

lines.value: furthermore if it was then clarified that this is not the case then these gay men would suddenly feel excluded and ignored by the other gay men with which they had been interacting with

lines.value: they felt that they could not obtain purely platonic friendships with other gay men

lines.value: one participant reported feeling alienated and disregarded as a person if they were not deemed by other gay men as sexually attractive

lines.value: criticism of lgbtqia culture comes from a variety of sources
