lines.value: the parallax view is a 1974 american political thriller film directed and produced by alan j pakula and starring warren beatty hume cronyn william daniels and paula prentiss
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was adapted by david giler lorenzo semple jr and an uncredited robert towne from a 1970 novel by loren singer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the story concerns a reporter's investigation into a secretive organization the parallax corporation whose primary focus is political assassination
lines.name: English

lines.value: the parallax view is the second installment of pakula's political paranoia trilogy along with klute 1971 and all the president's men 1976
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to being the only film in the trilogy not to be distributed by warner bros pictures the parallax view is also the only one of the three not to be nominated for an academy award
lines.name: English

lines.value: tv newswoman lee carter witnesses the assassination of presidential candidate charles carroll atop seattle's space needle
lines.name: English

lines.value: a waiter armed with a revolver is pursued and falls to his death while a second waiter also armed leaves the scene unnoticed
lines.name: English

lines.value: a congressional committee determines that the killing was the work of the dead waiter
lines.name: English

lines.value: three years later carter visits her former boyfriend and colleague newspaper reporter joe frady claiming that there is more to carroll's assassination than was reported at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: six of the witnesses to the killing have since died so she fears she will be next
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady does not take her seriously
lines.name: English

lines.value: carter is soon found dead in what is officially ruled as a drug overdose
lines.name: English

lines.value: investigating carter's leads frady goes to the small town of salmontail to probe into the most recent death that of judge arthur bridges
lines.name: English

lines.value: an apparently spontaneous bar fight with the salmontail sheriff's deputy draws the attention of the sheriff himself ld wicker who offers to take frady to the spot where bridges drowned
lines.name: English

lines.value: when they arrive at the dam however wicker pulls his gun on frady while the floodgates are opening expecting him to drown just like bridges did
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady narrowly escapes while wicker drowns
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady finds information in the sheriff's house about the parallax corporation learning that it recruits political assassins
lines.name: English

lines.value: as frady is interviewing carroll's former aide austin tucker a bomb explodes aboard tucker's boat
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady survives but is believed dead
lines.name: English

lines.value: he lets his generally skeptical editor bill rintels know that he is still alive and decides to apply to parallax under an assumed identity
lines.name: English

lines.value: he dons an aggressive persona when jack younger a parallax official pays him a visit once the application goes through
lines.name: English

lines.value: younger assures frady that he is the kind of man they are interested in
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady is accepted for training in los angeles where he watches a slide show that conflates positive images with negative actions
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady recognizes one of the parallax operatives from a photo tucker showed him as the second waiter from carroll's assassination
lines.name: English

lines.value: he watches the assassin retrieve a case from a car drive to an airport and check it as stowed baggage on a passenger jet
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady boards the plane notices a senator aboard but cannot find the assassin &ndash who is actually watching the jet's takeoff from the airport's roof
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady writes the warning on a napkin and slips it onto the drink service cart
lines.name: English

lines.value: the warning is found and the jet returns to los angeles
lines.name: English

lines.value: passengers are evacuated moments before the bomb explodes
lines.name: English

lines.value: rintels listens to a secretly recorded tape of a conversation between frady and younger placing it in an envelope with other such tapes
lines.name: English

lines.value: rintels is poisoned by a disguised parallax assassin and the tapes disappear
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady follows the parallax operatives to the dress rehearsal for a political rally for senator george hammond
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady hides in the auditorium's catwalks to observe the operatives who are posing as security personnel
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady realizes too late that he has been set up as a scapegoat
lines.name: English

lines.value: as hammond drives a golf cart across the auditorium floor an unseen sniper shoots him in the back killing him
lines.name: English

lines.value: frady then attempts to flee and is spotted in the catwalk by those below
lines.name: English

lines.value: the operatives move in but frady hides
lines.name: English

lines.value: as frady runs to the open exit door from the catwalk a parallax agent steps through killing frady with a shotgun
lines.name: English

lines.value: six months later the same committee that investigated carroll's death reports that frady acting alone killed hammond out of paranoia and misguided patriotism
lines.name: English

lines.value: they further express the hope that the verdict will end conspiracy theories about political assassinations
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of the images used in the assassin training montage were of anonymous figures or patriotic backgrounds with occasional historical individuals such as richard nixon adolf hitler pope john xxiii and lee harvey oswald in the picture taken moments after his shooting
lines.name: English

lines.value: the montage also uses a drawing by jack kirby of the marvel comics character thor
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was nearly unable to begin production at all because the screenplay was not ready when warren beatty had marked in the start of filming and with a writers guild of america strike looming paramount was leaning towards shuttering the project altogether
lines.name: English

lines.value: however beatty did single handed rewrites with the help of robert towne this would later become controversial because towne's many enemies in hollywood began spreading rumors that he had crossed the wga picket line and continued to work with his longtime friend and collaborator on the film and the movie did get underway and was able to start on time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the distinctive anamorphic photography with long lens unconventional framing and shallow focus was supervised by gordon willis
lines.name: English

lines.value: the river scene was filmed at the gorge dam on the skagit river ross lake national recreation area in washington state
lines.name: English

lines.value: 48 41 51 n 121 12 29 w)the space needle in seattle is seen extensively in the first assassination sequence
lines.name: English

lines.value: the airport scene was filmed at bob hope airport in burbank california
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time of its release the parallax view received mixed reactions from critics
lines.name: English

lines.value: roger ebert gave the film three out of four stars and wrote the parallax view will no doubt remind some reviewers of executive action 1973 another movie released at about the same time that advanced a conspiracy theory of assassination
lines.name: English

lines.value: it's a better use of similar material however because it tries to entertain instead of staying behind to argue in his review for the new york times vincent canby wrote neither mr pakula nor his screenwriters david giler and lorenzo semple jr display the wit that alfred hitchcock might have used to give the tale importance transcending immediate plausibility
lines.name: English

lines.value: the moviemakers have instead treated their central idea so soberly that they sabotage credulity time magazine's richard schickel wrote we would probably be better off rethinkingor better yet not thinking about the whole dismal business if only to put an end to ugly and dramatically unsatisfying products like the parallax view in 2006 entertainment weekly critic chris nashawaty wrote the parallax view is a mother of a thriller and beatty always an underrated actor thanks or no thanks to his off screen rep as a hollywood lothario gives a hell of a performance in a career that's been full of them the motion picture won the critics award at the avoriaz film festival france and was nominated for the edgar allan poe award for best picture
lines.name: English

lines.value: gordon willis won the best cinematography award from the national society of film critics usa
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film's reception has been more positive in recent years
lines.name: English

lines.value: it currently holds a 92% fresh score on rotten tomatoes based on 26 reviews
lines.name: English

lines.value: pedro ricardo sevcec born july 14 1954 is a uruguayan television personality and journalist best known as the former anchor of noticiero telemundo from 2000 to 2009
lines.name: English

lines.value: sevcec previously served as reporter for ocurrio asi before hosting his own talk show on the network
lines.name: English

lines.value: he currently hosts sevcec a fondo on americateve since 2011 and has his own afternoon drive radio show on wsua miami radio caracol 1260 am called la ventana con pedro sevcec
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon arriving to the united states sevcec started working as a correspondent for spanish international network
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1986 sevcec switched over to telemundo where he served as journalist and reporter for its network news
lines.name: English

lines.value: sevcec served as co anchor and reporter for ocurrio asi in 1993 alongside enrique gratas
lines.name: English

lines.value: he later hosted his own talk show sevcec which ran from 1994 to 1999 when it was replaced by laura en america
lines.name: English

lines.value: sevcec returned to ocurrio asi as host for a brief period in 1999 after its original host enrique gratas left telemundo that year
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2000 sevcec became the main anchor for noticiero telemundo where he remained for the next nine years
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this time he interviewed numerous presidents and world leaders including then president george w bush
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2001 he and brit hume of fox news channel were the only two journalists to attend president bush's first state dinner
lines.name: English

lines.value: on february 17 2004 a bomb exploded in an iraqi school where sevcec was filming a report about the opening of the school with no one being injured
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also survived a shooting between guerrillas and the military in el salvador years before
lines.name: English

lines.value: sevcec was involved in the los angeles may day melee that took part on may 1 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: in video footage of the incident sevcec is seen running away from oncoming police officers just as his evening live broadcast was taking place
lines.name: English

lines.value: in an interview he recounted how police were hitting women and children as they were running away
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 16 2009 telemundo announced that pedro sevcec was being replaced as anchor of the noticiero telemundo nightly newscast with jose diaz balart a veteran anchor and reporter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the miami herald reported that telemundo was replacing sevcec as part of a big new push at telemundo toward news integration not just between shows but between the network's broadcast cable and digital operations as well in 2011 sevcec joined americateve and began hosting sevcec a fondo where he remains to this day
lines.name: English

lines.value: in typography kerning is the process of adjusting the spacing between characters in a proportional font usually to achieve a visually pleasing result
lines.name: English

lines.value: kerning adjusts the space between individual letter forms while tracking letter-spacing adjusts spacing uniformly over a range of characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a well kerned font the two dimensional blank spaces between each pair of characters all have a visually similar area
lines.name: English

lines.value: the related term kern denotes a part of a type letter that overhangs the edge of the type block
lines.name: English

lines.value: the source of the word kern is from the french word carne meaning projecting angle quill of a pen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the french term originated from the latin cardo cardinis meaning hinge
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the days when all type was cast metal parts of a sort that needed to overlap adjacent letters simply hung off the edge of the sort slug
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bit of metal that hung over the edge was called a kern
lines.name: English

lines.value: at that time the word kerning only referred to manufacturing the sorts with kerns while adjusting space between letters during compositing was called inter spacing or letter spacing
lines.name: English

lines.value: because this method was not well suited to some pairs of letters ligatures were supplied for those glyph combinations such as the french l or the combinations ff fi and ffi
lines.name: English

lines.value: in metal typesetting kerning was labour intensive and expensive because the matrices had to be physically modified
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was therefore only employed on letter combinations which needed it the most such as va or av
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the arrival of digital fonts it became much easier to kern many glyph combinations
lines.name: English

lines.value: in digital typography kerning is usually applied to letter pairs as a number by which the default character spacing should be increased or decreased a positive value for an increase a negative value for a decrease
lines.name: English

lines.value: the number is expressed in font units one unit being a certain fraction of an em one em is the type size currently used
lines.name: English

lines.value: different fonts may use different units but common values are 1000 and 2048 units em
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus for 1000 units em a kerning value of 15 means an increase in character spacing by 0.015 of the current type size
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kerning units for a given font are the same as the units used to express the character widths in that font most kerning adjustments are negative and negative adjustments are generally larger than positive ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: adjustments for different pairs within a given font can range from a tiny 2 to over 100 when expressed as 1000 units em
lines.name: English

lines.value: the adjustments for a given pair vary greatly from one font to another
lines.name: English

lines.value: negative kerning is widely used to fit capital letters such as t v w and y closer to some other capital letters on either side especially a and to some lower case letters on the right side such as the combinations ta te and to
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also used to fit a period full stop or a comma closer to these and to f and p as well as to the lower case letters r v w and y some other combinations that use negative kerning are fa lt and ly and letters like a l and h followed by a quotation mark
lines.name: English

lines.value: positive kerning is used mainly in conjunction with special characters and punctuation for example the lower case letter f followed by right parenthesis or quotation mark
lines.name: English

lines.value: depending on the font some small positive kerning may also be required for accented letters and for pairs like bo dw and ty
lines.name: English

lines.value: the table below contains a few exemplifying kerning pairs and their values
lines.name: English

lines.value: these values are based on 1000 units em and the kerning pairs are ordered from the most negative to the most positive kerning value
lines.name: English

lines.value: the samples are taken from the kerning tables of the minion pro font
lines.name: English

lines.value: in other fonts the kerning may be very different
lines.name: English

lines.value: which letters need to be kerned depends on which languages the font is to be used with
lines.name: English

lines.value: since some combinations of letters are not used in normal words in any language kerning these is not necessary
lines.name: English

lines.value: non proportional monospaced fonts do not use kerning since their characters always have the same spacing
lines.name: English

lines.value: in older font formats such as microsoft's truetype the kerning values are specified in a simple kern table where each entry consists of a pair of characters and their kerning value
lines.name: English

lines.value: apple has however extended the kern table with more complex features including contextual and class based kerning that were later found in opentype albeit not in the same exact form truetype fonts typically have several hundred pairs but some have more than a thousand
lines.name: English

lines.value: since opentype is a superset of truetype kern tables are still supported for truetype fonts packed as opentype however postscript based cff opentype fonts do not have this option
lines.name: English

lines.value: opentype introduced a new uniform way of specifying among other things kerning via the glyph positioning table gpos
lines.name: English

lines.value: the more recent font releases by adobe no longer have kern tables at all but only specify kerning via gpos
lines.name: English

lines.value: since an opentype font may include thousands of glyphs and consequently a huge number of pairs of characters that need kerning opentype fonts may have an elaborate system of tables and subtables designed to minimize the overall storage space
lines.name: English

lines.value: kerning is treated as part of a broad range of new glyph positioning features which are stored in gpos
lines.name: English

lines.value: ) the system is based on the concept of glyph classes instead of a one dimensional table where each entry corresponds to a pair of characters there are two dimensional tables where each entry corresponds to a pair of classes of glyphs
lines.name: English

lines.value: a class includes several characters whose right hand outline and right side bearing is identical for kerning purposes or several characters whose left hand outline and left side bearing is identical
lines.name: English

lines.value: all pairs of characters where the first one is from the first class and the second one is from the second class will require the same kerning value so this value needs to be specified only once in the table
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rows in the two dimensional table correspond to first character classes and the columns correspond to second character classes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kerning value for a given pair of characters is found in the table at the intersection of the classes to which they belong
lines.name: English

lines.value: this system is very economical but is necessarily limited
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example many of the classes may be quite small
lines.name: English

lines.value: also a font with many types of glyphs may require several such tables
lines.name: English

lines.value: finally many pairs remain that cannot be represented through classes
lines.name: English

lines.value: for them simpler one dimensional tables are provided each table is for a particular character that is the first in many pairs and the entries contain the characters that are the second in these pairs together with the corresponding kerning values
lines.name: English

lines.value: here are a few examples of glyph classes in the minion pro font for the first character in a kerning pair d i l u h m n j q b o p v w y d o q h i v w and for the second character in a pair f i m n r h k l j p t u c d e o q v w y c g o q b d e f h i k l n p r).a type of letters that lend themselves well to class based kerning are those with diacritical marks
lines.name: English

lines.value: these letters can be added to the class of the base letter and can stay together whether they are the first or second character in a pair a a a a e e e e etc a letter cannot be included in the class if its kerning is different from the others in certain pairs for example y&aacute vs y&auml
lines.name: English

lines.value: most modern office and desktop publishing systems support opentype features and hence class based kerning
lines.name: English

lines.value: automatic kerning refers to the kerning applied automatically by a program as opposed to no kerning at all or the kerning applied manually by the user
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are two types of automatic kerning metric and optical
lines.name: English

lines.value: with metric kerning the program directly uses the values found in the kerning tables included in the font file
lines.name: English

lines.value: most systems with typographic features today provide this type of kerning
lines.name: English

lines.value: optical kerning on the other hand is available only in the more advanced systems
lines.name: English

lines.value: with optical kerning the program uses an algorithm to calculate from their outlines the optimal spacing for each pair of consecutive characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: with both types of automatic kerning the system usually permits the user to specify a minimum font size for applying kerning if the user feels that kerning is unnecessary for smaller font sizes
lines.name: English

lines.value: with metric kerning in a text that uses several fonts the program must decide which kerning table to use when two consecutive characters belong to different fonts - the table from the font of the first character or the second one - or to avoid kerning altogether
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this case optical kerning is preferable
lines.name: English

lines.value: a common situation occurs when italic text ends with a roman symbol right parenthesis or quotation mark question mark etc and the last letter's slant clashes with the symbol
lines.name: English

lines.value: manual kerning available in some systems permits the user to override the automatic kerning and to apply any kerning value directly to a pair of characters in a particular place in the text
lines.name: English

lines.value: when not available this feature can be simulated by using for those two characters the function that modifies the space between characters in a block of text usually called tracking
lines.name: English

lines.value: when employed by a skilled person manual kerning will usually give better results than optical kerning for example some characters that may appear to an algorithmic comparison to be spaced very closely together may appear to a human reader too far apart especially when the only element of a glyph that is too close is a diacritic mark
lines.name: English

lines.value: manual kerning may even be better than the metric kerning built into the kerning table by the font's designer since these tables often have errors or omissions or the difference may simply be a matter of personal preference
lines.name: English

lines.value: contextual kerning refers to positional adjustment that depends on more than two consecutive glyphs
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example the spacing of a certain glyph may depend not only on the preceding glyph as in ordinary kerning but also on the one following it
lines.name: English

lines.value: although rarely implemented in ordinary documents contextual kerning is a concern in quality typography
lines.name: English

lines.value: an example of a situation that demands contextual kerning in the minion pro font is the sequence of three characters f.&rdquo f period quotation mark as is often found at the end of a quotation
lines.name: English

lines.value: using the font's kerning tables the quotation mark is too close to the f although without the period between them their spacing is adequate
lines.name: English

lines.value: the period in other words reduces their spacing instead of increasing it
lines.name: English

lines.value: the explanation is this without the period their kerning is a positive 121 expressed as 1000 units em
lines.name: English

lines.value: the period's width is 228 but the kerning between f and the period is −5 and between the period and the quotation mark −138
lines.name: English

lines.value: the total is a positive 85 as opposed to the original 121 a net loss of 36 units which explains why the quotation mark is now closer to the f contextual kerning would recognize the sequence of three characters and would increase one or both inter character spaces
lines.name: English

lines.value: a similar problem exists with the letters f p t v w and y with comma rather than period or with single rather than double quotation mark
lines.name: English

lines.value: contextual kerning is supported by the opentype font format but few font designers implement it and probably no desktop publishing systems can currently use it
lines.name: English

lines.value: when important the solution for a user is to employ manual kerning instead
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the opentype math standard does not include support for kerning of subscript or superscripts microsoft's implementation adds extensions to support this feature as of office 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: font editors allow the user to modify the properties of a font including its kerning table if the font license permits it
lines.name: English

lines.value: they accomplish this by modifying the table found in the actual font file
lines.name: English

lines.value: the user can change the kerning value in existing pairs or add new pairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: a few desktop publishing systems allow the user to change or add kerning pairs without modifying the font file itself
lines.name: English

lines.value: the system merely applies to the user's document the new kerning values instead of the values found in the font file
lines.name: English

lines.value: whether modifying the font file with a font editor or overriding it in a particular system the user is limited to the existing kerning features
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus if one needs features like optical kerning or contextual kerning or kerning a pair of characters that belong to different fonts and if the system lacks these features other means must be employed
lines.name: English

lines.value: some desktop publishing systems permit developers to create plug ins extensions that perform a variety of functions that the system itself lacks and this capability has also been used for kerning
lines.name: English

lines.value: in general these plug ins permit the user to apply a kerning change automatically to a certain character pair throughout an entire document instead of applying it by searching manually for those pairs
lines.name: English

lines.value: so far only basic kerning features have been implemented through plug ins and it is unclear whether the more advanced features can be effectively implemented in this manner
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead of adding functionality to a desktop publishing system a different approach is to export the document and process it outside that system
lines.name: English

lines.value: any kerning features can then be applied to the document using tools ranging from ordinary text editors to programs specially developed for this task
lines.name: English

lines.value: the modified document is then imported back into the desktop publishing system
lines.name: English

lines.value: many systems permit this operation either by converting the document with import and export functions or by making their internal document format an open standard
lines.name: English

lines.value: the benefit of this approach is that some complex typesetting functions that may be hard to implement through plug ins kerning in particular may be relatively easy to implement through separate tools
lines.name: English

lines.value: the css property in both and in internet explorer starting at version 10
lines.name: English

lines.value: the css3 draft suggests that kerning should always be enabled for opentype fonts
lines.name: English

lines.value: the human perception of kerning can vary with the intraword and interword spacing during reading
lines.name: English

lines.value: a visually pleasing result even with no kerning control can be achieved with some control of the space between letters
lines.name: English

lines.value: for instance on webpages with css1 a standard dating back to 1996 the letter spacing property illustrated offers some control for lost or enhanced kerning perception &mdash kerning can be simulated with non uniform spacing between letters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the standard css3 scheduled for 2014 includes the font kerning property which allows a complete control of kerning
lines.name: English

lines.value: for rather more technical reasons some have proposed to replace at least some opentype style gpos kerning with spacer glyphs using opentype's glyph substitution table gsub
lines.name: English

lines.value: william michael billy bulger born february 2 1934 is a retired american democratic politician lawyer and educator from south boston massachusetts whose eighteen year tenure as president of the massachusetts senate is the longest in history and who was also president of the university of massachusetts
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was forced to resign from the latter post after he refused to testify in a 2003 congressional hearing about communications he had with his then fugitive brother james whitey bulger jr a boston crime boss
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger was born in dorchester massachusetts to james joseph bulger senior and jane veronica jean mccarthy who were of irish descent
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is the third of six children in the family and younger brother of former mob boss james whitey bulger
lines.name: English

lines.value: when bulger was four years old the family moved to south boston's old harbor village housing project soon after it opened in 1938
lines.name: English

lines.value: he grew up there and has maintained lifelong friendships with many of those who were his former neighbors including best friend korean war marine pow and purple heart recipient fred l toomey
lines.name: English

lines.value: the late congressman joe moakley 1927-2001 was also a close childhood neighbor
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the bulger family was poor william matriculated into boston college high school
lines.name: English

lines.value: he enrolled at boston college in 1952 but his undergraduate career was interrupted when he joined the united states army
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served from september 1953 to november 1955 then returned to boston college completing his undergraduate degree in english literature with the help of the gi bill
lines.name: English

lines.value: he attended boston college law school from which he received his doctor of jurisprudence degree in 1961
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is also the recipient of over 20 honorary degrees from a variety of academic institutions
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger became interested in politics in 1959 and was first elected to the massachusetts house of representatives as a democrat in 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: after serving five terms bulger was elected to the massachusetts state senate in 1970 representing the first suffolk district
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1973 he was named second assistant floor majority leader
lines.name: English

lines.value: after joseph dicarlo's conviction for extortion in 1977 bulger succeeded him as senate majority leader
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger was elected president of the massachusetts state senate in 1978 and was reelected every two years to 1996 making his time as state senate president the longest tenure in massachusetts history
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger joined other irish american neighborhood leaders in opposition to court ordered desegregated busing
lines.name: English

lines.value: like other massachusetts politicians who were elected leaders of their legislative chambers bulger was frequently pilloried in the media but remained very popular in his district
lines.name: English

lines.value: he won his district election every two years from 1961 to 1994 without ever facing a challenge more serious than he faced in the democratic primary in 1988 when stephen holt a neophyte liberal activist and bookstore owner from dorchester won 31 out of 60 precincts only to lose the district by a landslide due to the huge turnout of bulger supporters in south boston
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 1960s he led efforts to write the first child abuse reporting laws in the state
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was supportive of environmental protection legislation
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger was among the first advocates of charter schools and public school choice
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 1980s he advocated funding of public libraries the expansion of childhood nutrition services and fuel assistance programs
lines.name: English

lines.value: as senate president bulger led the debate on welfare reform in the early 1990s with the resulting legislation becoming the model for a national law
lines.name: English

lines.value: for many years bulger hosted the annual st patrick's day breakfast in south boston
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is a roast of politicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger was appointed president of the university of massachusetts by the board of trustees on november 28 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: his candidacy for the umass position was supported by governor william weld
lines.name: English

lines.value: the appointment was controversial in academic circles as bulger had no prior experience in higher education and lacked the academic doctoral degree usually required for the presidency of a major state university system
lines.name: English

lines.value: on august 6 2003 bulger announced that he would resign as president of the system effective september 1 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: his resignation came due to pressure from governor mitt romney after bulger had refused to cooperate with authorities who were searching for bulger's brother the notorious mobster james whitey bulger
lines.name: English

lines.value: jack wilson vice president for academic and student affairs who had come to umass from the post of j erik jonsson distinguished professor at rensselaer polytechnic institute to create umassonline was tapped to be the interim president
lines.name: English

lines.value: wilson was appointed as the president in march 2004 after the conclusion of a national search
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger's older brother james whitey bulger jr is a convicted murderer and the former boss of the winter hill gang
lines.name: English

lines.value: whitey was a fugitive from 1995 until his arrest in june 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1999 whitey's longtime aide kevin weeks pleaded guilty to a number of charges related to whitey's crime spree and became a cooperating witness
lines.name: English

lines.value: weeks revealed that in 1995 william talked to whitey during an arranged phone conversation just two weeks after whitey fled a pending racketeering indictment
lines.name: English

lines.value: william was called before a grand jury in april 2001 and admitted to talking with his brother
lines.name: English

lines.value: when asked why he didn't urge whitey to turn himself in william replied that he didn't feel it was in his brother's best interest to give himself up at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: after portions of bulger's testimony were published in the boston globe he testified to a congressional committee about the incident on june 19 2003 after being granted immunity from prosecution for obstruction of justice
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger revealed that he went to an arranged location in 1995 to take a call from his fugitive brother apparently to avoid electronic eavesdropping
lines.name: English

lines.value: he claimed that not notifying authorities about the call was in no way inconsistent with my devotion to my own responsibilities my public responsibilities as state senate president
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the hearing when asked what he thought james whitey did for a living william bulger said i had the feeling that he was in the business of gaming and whatever
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was vague to me but i didn't think for a long while he had some jobs but ultimately it was clear that he was not being you know he wasn't doing what i'd like him to do
lines.name: English

lines.value: he added that he loved his brother and hoped that the most brutal rumors concerning him will be proven false
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger came under harsh criticism for his apparent evasiveness and governor mitt romney among others demanded his resignation
lines.name: English

lines.value: under pressure from all quarters bulger resigned as president of the university of massachusetts in the fall of 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger also testified that the fbi never asked if he knew of whitey's location
lines.name: English

lines.value: those remarks were disputed by a former fbi agent who claimed bulger declined to submit to an interview with the bureau
lines.name: English

lines.value: months later the committee report found bulger's testimony inconsistent about whether the fbi had contacted him in its search for his fugitive brother
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon whitey's arrest in california in june 2011 william bulger issued a statement expressing his sympathies to the families hurt in the case and asking for privacy for his family
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 2015 film black mass which is based on the life of whitey william is portrayed by benedict cumberbatch
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger is a past president of the boston public library and past member of the board of trustees
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is also overseer emeritus of the boston symphony orchestra
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition he is a former member of the massachusetts general hospital board of trustees museum of fine arts board of trustees and mclean hospital board of trustees
lines.name: English

lines.value: he joined the faculties of boston college and suffolk university as a lecturer of political science in 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: bulger lives in south boston with mary his wife whom he married in 1960
lines.name: English

lines.value: they have nine children and 33 grandchildren
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to the massachusetts open checkbook list of state pensions bulger is currently receiving a pension from massachusetts at a rate of $200486 annually
lines.name: English

lines.value: william bruce cameron born 1960 in petoskey michigan is an american author columnist and humorist
lines.name: English

lines.value: cameron is most famous for his novel a dog's purpose which spent 52 weeks on the new york times bestseller list and is the first book in a two book series that concludes with a dog's journey
lines.name: English

lines.value: the book is the basis for the movie version starring dennis quaid britt robertson peggy lipton kj apa juliet rylance luke kirby john ortiz and pooch hall an amblin entertainment/reliance entertainment/walden media release in theaters january 27 2017
lines.name: English

lines.value: cameron is also the author of the best selling self improvement book 8 simple rules for dating my teenage daughter which was later adapted into the abc sitcom of the same name that aired between 2002 and 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: his book 8 simple rules for marrying my daughter was released in 2008 and already had a hollywood movie deal before its publication with 89 films and wendy finerman producer of the devil wears prada
lines.name: English

lines.value: cameron is also the author of how to remodel a man which was excerpted in the august 2005 issue of o the oprah magazine and was the subject of the november 1 2005 oprah show
lines.name: English

lines.value: his novel a dog's purpose was published july 2010 by tom doherty associates
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was 19 weeks on the new york times best seller list in its hardcover release
lines.name: English

lines.value: the softcover version was released may 24 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: in total a dog's purpose has spent a year on the new york times bestseller list hardcover and paperback combined
lines.name: English

lines.value: he wrote a weekly column for around 50 newspapers in the us and canada including hawaii's midweek 8 simple rules told his humorous cautionary tales and memories of his life and was named after his bestselling book
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2012 overwhelmed with other work cameron put it on hold after 689 editions
lines.name: English

lines.value: * cameron's official web site

lines.value: telecom eireann (, meaning telecommunications of ireland was an irish state owned telecommunications company from 1983 to 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to then a telephone and postal service was provided by the department of posts and telegraphs known as p and t as part of the civil service
lines.name: English

lines.value: telecom eireann was established by the postal and telecommunications services act 1983 its full formal title was bord telecom eireann or in the english language the irish telecommunications board
lines.name: English

lines.value: telecom eireann may be translated as telecom of ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1999 the company was privatised and renamed as eircom
lines.name: English

lines.value: telecom eireann rolled out digital telephone switching technology across the country along with an extensive fibre optic and digital microwave backbone
lines.name: English

lines.value: two digital switching systems were selected cit alcatel's e10 and ericsson's axe telephone exchange
lines.name: English

lines.value: digital technology quickly replaced analogue systems at national and major regional switching centres and new international gateway switches were installed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the oldest electromechanical step by step exchanges and manual operator manned local exchanges were the first to be converted to digital technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: more modern electromechanical crossbar exchanges using ericsson arf technology dating from the 1960s and 1970s were converted to digital bit by bit through the late 1980s and early 1990s
lines.name: English

lines.value: these crossbar switches were capable of providing voice service that was comparable to digital switching technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the early 1990s the irish network was amongst the most modern and most digitalised in the world and by the mid 1990s had become 100% digitally switched
lines.name: English

lines.value: a strategic alliance was formed between telecom eireann of ireland telia of sweden and kpn of netherlands in june 1996 after both companies purchased a combined 35 percent stake in board telcom eireann
lines.name: English

lines.value: the alliance was completed by 2001 when telia and kpn exited ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the time of the alliance it was headquartered in st stephens green and harcourt street dublin
lines.name: English

lines.value: the company also did a major upgrade to the payphone network in the late 1980s which saw the rollout of smart card based payphones across ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the telecom eireann callcard was one of the earliest implementations chip based cards in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: telecom eireann launched eircell now vodafone ireland in 1984 with operations commencing in 1986
lines.name: English

lines.value: the company deployed a national mobile telephone network based on a first generation mobile technology known as the total access communication system or tacs for short
lines.name: English

lines.value: this technology similar to amps was also used in the uk by vodafone and cellnet
lines.name: English

lines.value: eircell launched their digital network based on gsm technology from ericsson in 1993
lines.name: English

lines.value: gsm service rapidly replaced the tacs network as customers migrated over to new digital technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: within a few years the tacs network was obsolete and taken off air
lines.name: English

lines.value: *minitel ireland the company introduced a minitel videotext system into ireland in 1992 but due to poor uptake and lack of interesting services it faded from public attention quickly
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of other companies came together in 1988 with a plan to use the system for shopping and information
lines.name: English

lines.value: minitel services were ultimately withdrawn completely due to lack of interest
lines.name: English

lines.value: *telecom internet in 1997 telecom eireann established telecom internet also known as tinet the internet service provider the company rapidly became one of the partners in the internet neutral exchange and is today known as eircom net
lines.name: English

lines.value: *eirpage telecom eireann established eirpage a national paging system in ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: this system was then controlled and operated by voxpro communications formerly pageboy www.voxpro.ie until the closure of the national paging system in august 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: *eirpac launched in 1984 to replace euronet eirpac is the irish public switched data network supporting x.25 and x.28 *teis telecom eireann information systems this unit sold business systems and office telephone systems to business customers
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1988 it sponsored rte weather until 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: telecom eireann was privatised in 1999 and renamed as eircom plc
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was later split into eircell 2000 plc eircell the mobile networks business and eircom the fixed line business which also inherited other minor divisions such as the eirpage pager system and the telecom retail arm
lines.name: English

lines.value: eircell was sold to vodafone in may 2001 and later changed its name to the dual brand eircell vodafone before becoming vodafone ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: * communications in ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the bbc tv series coupling a phone with a telecom eireann logo appears in the episode gotcha
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the channel 4 series father ted(speed 3 a telecom eireann kiosk is seen near the end
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: tom a hall born september 2 1964 is a game designer born in wisconsin
lines.name: English

lines.value: he attended the university of wisconsin madison where he earned a bs in computer science
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1987 he worked at softdisk inc where he was both a programmer and the editor of softdisk a software bundle delivered monthly
lines.name: English

lines.value: along with some of his co workers john carmack john romero and adrian carmack he founded id software
lines.name: English

lines.value: he served as creative director and designer there working upon games such as the commander keen series wolfenstein 3d spear of destiny and doom
lines.name: English

lines.value: after some disputes with john carmack about the design for doom he left id software in august 1993 to join apogee/3d realms
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was the game designer for rise of the triad produced terminal velocity and helped in varying degrees on duke nukem ii and duke nukem 3d as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also worked on the prey engine until august 12 1996 when he left apogee
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall co founded ion storm with john romero where he produced anachronox
lines.name: English

lines.value: the company also produced the 2000 game of the year deus ex in which hall voiced one of the characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: he and romero then founded monkeystone games a company with the goal of producing mobile games in the then new mobile industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: he designed and romero programmed hyperspace delivery boy which was released on december 23 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: he and romero joined midway games in 2003 and monkeystone closed in january 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall also left midway early that year and did independent game consultation work out of austin texas until in february he joined a startup company called kingsisle entertainment based in the same area
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall left kingsisle and joined loot drop on january 1 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: along with loot drop he unsuccessfully tried to crowdfund a game called shaker on the crowdfunding platform kickstarter during october 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall later tried to crowdfund another game on kickstarter worlds of wander which was also unsuccessful in reaching its goal
lines.name: English

lines.value: in march 2013 hall joined playfirst as principal designer
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall is also the creator of the dopefish a large green buck toothed belching dimwitted fish whose thought process is restricted to swim swim hungry
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dopefish first appeared in commander keen episode iv and references to it have appeared in many other video games since
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall provided the following voices for the computer role playing game deus ex morpheus a sentient ai howard strong a ruthless and cruel mj12 operative and walton simons the nano augmented director of the federal emergency management agency fema
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also voiced the project director in deus ex invisible war opening cutscene and pal 18 councilman willis dr hush hush and eddie the chew in anachronox
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was also the voice and likeness of the main antagonist of rise of the triad el oscuro and also voiced the death monk enemies from the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: hall suffered a stroke on tuesday april 13 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was in rehabilitation until april 21 when he was released
lines.name: English

lines.value: age of mythology the titans is an expansion pack to the real time strategy video game of age of mythology
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was developed by ensemble studios and released on september 30 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: the titans adds a fourth culture to the game the atlanteans and three new major gods plus new units buildings and god powers
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also includes many new features such as auto queueing allows indefinite training of units as long as you have sufficient resources and the ability to summon a titan a gargantuan godlike being that forms the game's focal point
lines.name: English

lines.value: critics gave titans an average rating of 84% according to gamerankings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the largest new addition to titans is a new civilization the atlanteans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the atlanteans have no specific hero units but can convert most human units into a hero
lines.name: English

lines.value: citizens have no drop off point for resources and town centers can be built at any time during the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: atlantean citizens are much more effective in work than their greek norse or egyptian counterparts and do not require drop off points for resources instead harvested resources are automatically added to stockpiles
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are also slower to train and much more expensive
lines.name: English

lines.value: atlanteans gain favor through possessing town centers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the more they control the faster the rate of favor generation
lines.name: English

lines.value: a new unit the oracle is introduced on the side of the atlanteans
lines.name: English

lines.value: with a line of sight that expands when he stands still and a researchable ability to pick up relics he can be very effective in the early game but he only has an attack if upgraded to hero
lines.name: English

lines.value: most atlantean human units can be transformed into heroes including citizens which become a little bit better at everything they do
lines.name: English

lines.value: myth units naval units siege units titans and soban are the exceptions
lines.name: English

lines.value: as well as being strong against myth units atlantean heroes retain their own strengths and weaknesses so for example murmillo heroes are still weak against archers and strong against cavalry
lines.name: English

lines.value: titan worshippers have special powers such as kronos ability to move buildings from one location on the map to another or oranos sky passages which allow instant unit transportation across the map
lines.name: English

lines.value: this can significantly affect the gameplay of older maps designed for age of mythology pre expansion as areas of maps that were inaccessible become accessible
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earth entity gaia has the ability to grow lush from buildings preventing enemy players constructing buildings nearby as well as providing a small healing effect to buildings
lines.name: English

lines.value: other lesser god powers are available to the atlanteans at any time during the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike the other civilizations the atlanteans can use certain god powers multiple times
lines.name: English

lines.value: some like gaia's forest cause new forest to generate which provides a far more effective wall that only villagers or forest fires or colossi can break through
lines.name: English

lines.value: these too may alter gameplay on older maps
lines.name: English

lines.value: worshipping the titans kronos oranos or gaia entitles the player to summon one of several new myth units the behemoth essentially a living regenerating siege unit the automaton a robot that repairs other automatons during breaks in the fighting and the argus an indescribable creature with eyes covering its whole body floating in the air that kills units with acid
lines.name: English

lines.value: naval myth units include the servant which heals naval and coastal units and has a moderate attack also the man o war a lightning shooting jellyfish that causes damage to multiple units
lines.name: English

lines.value: the servant affects game play by adding the option of loading up a coastal region with servants who are not easily attacked by ground troops thus fighting there is a serious advantage to the player with servants
lines.name: English

lines.value: like the fenris wolf that grows in attack effectiveness with numbers the automaton grows also in effectiveness because a large army of them can self repair in time to be at full fighting strength before the next skirmish
lines.name: English

lines.value: these features make the servant and automaton particularly effective defensive units
lines.name: English

lines.value: another flying healer the caladria and flying attack unit the stymphalian bird round out the aerial myth units while the man o'war and nereid are available for naval combat
lines.name: English

lines.value: the satyr throws spears the lampades unleashes the chaos power on units at range and the heka gigantes generates shockwaves
lines.name: English

lines.value: prometheans split into smaller prometheans when killed
lines.name: English

lines.value: planting a hesperides tree allows players to summon dryads and another reusable god power puts carnivorous plants in the way of enemies
lines.name: English

lines.value: overall the game favors the more offensive player in the late game and the more defensive player early who builds up to summon the titan or earn these powers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the titan also a myth unit is the strongest useable unit in the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: titans can only be summoned by researching the secrets of the titans in the mythic age
lines.name: English

lines.value: after researching the secrets you'll be able to summon a titan gate anywhere within your line of sight
lines.name: English

lines.value: once it is placed you must task villagers on releasing the titan and must protect the gate from enemy attacks until the titan is released
lines.name: English

lines.value: the game has been criticized for having too much emphasis on the titan the construction of a titan gate being now an all or nothing gambit to win the game if the gate is destroyed no new one can be built
lines.name: English

lines.value: titans introduces six new maps types and seven new ai personalities
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the original civilizations several upgrades and changes were added
lines.name: English

lines.value: the upgrade beast slayer causes the greek gods unique units to do bonus damage against myth units
lines.name: English

lines.value: hands of the pharaoh lets egyptian priests pick up relics a power formerly reserved for the pharaoh unit only
lines.name: English

lines.value: range of attack is also increased by two for egyptian priests
lines.name: English

lines.value: the norse gain the axe of muspell upgrade which gives throwing axemen bonus damage against flying units
lines.name: English

lines.value: in terms of bonuses for every civilization the upgrade heroic fleet gives ships bonus damage against myth units
lines.name: English

lines.value: the non atlanteans can build town centers in the classical age in titans as opposed to heroic in the original
lines.name: English

lines.value: finally the titan unit is introduced to the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: titans are huge units possessing large amounts of hitpoints and armor while having high attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: the campaign is a third of the length of the one in age of mythology
lines.name: English

lines.value: this time focuses mostly on the atlantean civilization and its main defender kastor son of arkantos
lines.name: English

lines.value: arkantos who is now a minor god of titan fighting as mentioned in the game also makes a few minor appearances here
lines.name: English

lines.value: the story is set ten years after the events of the age of mythology storyline
lines.name: English

lines.value: the story begins with kronos who is still trapped in tartarus watching the atlanteans who are attempting to survive the harsh winters in the norselands after atlantis was destroyed 10 years ago in the events of age of mythology
lines.name: English

lines.value: he sends his unnamed servant to the colony who kills the theocrat krios and possesses his body
lines.name: English

lines.value: krios who is actually kronos in disguise says he saw a temple in his dream
lines.name: English

lines.value: the atlanteans leave the norselands by using the foreseen temple called a sky passage and they come to a resourceful island
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon their arrival krios pointed out the plant covered temples to oranos and kronos
lines.name: English

lines.value: krios says it was these imprisoned titans who helped them and convinces his people including kastor to worship them
lines.name: English

lines.value: the greeks are angered with the atlanteans new choice of gods and attack them
lines.name: English

lines.value: the atlanteans retaliate by destroying the entire greek colony from which some of the attacks came
lines.name: English

lines.value: however some of the greek ships escape and go to general melagius ruler of that colony and other lands
lines.name: English

lines.value: he is angered by the destruction of his colony and prepares for an attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: the atlanteans however still manage to invade melagius city called sikyos and slay him
lines.name: English

lines.value: just as the atlanteans kill melagius egyptian and norse allies of melagius come to aid the city
lines.name: English

lines.value: kastor decides they are too powerful and flees
lines.name: English

lines.value: however he does not go back to new atlantis but instead ventures up to the norselands
lines.name: English

lines.value: his plan is that the norse will not be expecting an attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: he destroys norse temples and replaces them with atlantean temples to show his superiority
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also destroys the tower of odin odin's only stronghold on earth by using a god power from kronos
lines.name: English

lines.value: some atlantean forces then sail to egypt
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scene cuts to egypt where queen amanra a comrade of arkantos when he was still a human is conversing with her troops
lines.name: English

lines.value: arkantos suddenly appears before amanra and tells her that the atlanteans are coming to steal relics from the egyptians
lines.name: English

lines.value: amanra fortifies the protections around the relics but the atlanteans still manage to steal them
lines.name: English

lines.value: just as the atlantean army closes around amanra and her few troops lightning bolts kill all the atlantean soldiers
lines.name: English

lines.value: arkantos appears and tells amanra that the atlanteans are being led by kastor
lines.name: English

lines.value: amanra questions this and arkantos tells amanra that kastor is being tricked
lines.name: English

lines.value: he tells her to find kastor and to help him
lines.name: English

lines.value: it then cuts to a new scene where krios congratulates kastor on his work and shows him a sky passage that he has found
lines.name: English

lines.value: krios tells kastor that the sky passage will take him behind greek lines
lines.name: English

lines.value: kastor enters it with his troop and finds himself not in the greek territories but on mount olympus
lines.name: English

lines.value: kastor believes that krios made a mistake about where the sky passage went
lines.name: English

lines.value: he and his troops discover they cannot go back the same way they came so they decide their only choice is to attack mount olympus
lines.name: English

lines.value: using special temples that change his men into different myth units kastor slays the followers of the olympian gods including odysseus
lines.name: English

lines.value: however once he does this the temple to zeus on the mountain collapses
lines.name: English

lines.value: kastor leaves with his army and heads to the greek territories
lines.name: English

lines.value: when he gets there he sees the titan prometheus and his army of prometheans from tartarus destroying sikyos
lines.name: English

lines.value: krios arrives and announces that kastor's actions in greece egypt and the norselands combined with his invasion of olympus have weakened the olympian gods control over these territories and allowed minor titans to spawn
lines.name: English

lines.value: krios reveals his true form a winged demon and servant of kronos and flees
lines.name: English

lines.value: kastor is then attacked by other atlanteans who are under krios's control
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile amanra meets ajax another companion of arkantos
lines.name: English

lines.value: apparently ajax was also looking for kastor
lines.name: English

lines.value: amanra tells ajax that kastor has been tricked and that they must find him
lines.name: English

lines.value: all this time kastor is being repeatedly attacked by atlanteans
lines.name: English

lines.value: amanra and ajax rescue him with a flock of rocs
lines.name: English

lines.value: arkantos appears and kastor tells his father that he did not realize he was being tricked
lines.name: English

lines.value: arkantos forgives him and tells the heroes that two other titans have been freed in the norselands and in egypt
lines.name: English

lines.value: amanra decides that they will go to egypt first as that is her homeland
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the heroes leave prometheus advances and continues to destroy any surrounding cities/villages/etc cerberus the titan summoned in egypt has begun wreaking havoc among the population
lines.name: English

lines.value: amanra orders her people to awaken the guardian a powerful being that previously aided her in age of mythology
lines.name: English

lines.value: the guardian is awakened and kills cerberus
lines.name: English

lines.value: they then travel to the norse lands and they meet king folstag a powerful frost giant whose lands are being destroyed by the titan ymir
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the help of folstag and the nidhogg dragon the heroes kill ymir and restore peace to the norse lands
lines.name: English

lines.value: the heroes then travel to greece to find the peaceful green countryside destroyed and in flames as a result of prometheus's attacks
lines.name: English

lines.value: amanra is the first to notice plants growing in a particular spot that surrounds a temple to gaia
lines.name: English

lines.value: arkantos appears before the heroes and explains to them gaia also a titan has been empowered by kastor's actions and has been using her power to heal greece
lines.name: English

lines.value: they spread the green lush of the benevolent earth titan gaia across the burnt land both healing it and weakening prometheus
lines.name: English

lines.value: they manage to overcome him in his weakened state
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the defeat of prometheus arkantos praises kastor and the others on their victory but he explains that there is still more to do
lines.name: English

lines.value: kastor reveals kronos's location the atlantean colony and they set off
lines.name: English

lines.value: the heroes then venture back to new atlantis where they rescue citizens from automatons
lines.name: English

lines.value: after battling all of the automatons kastor and his army retake new atlantis
lines.name: English

lines.value: kronos again retreats to a sky passage from the battered battlefield
lines.name: English

lines.value: kastor ajax and amanra enter the sky passage which takes them to old atlantis
lines.name: English

lines.value: kronos appears above them and announces the future arrival of kronos king of the titans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the only way to defeat the titan lord is to summon gaia the mother of the titans
lines.name: English

lines.value: while holding off the constant attacks from kronos's followers the heroes plant the four magical seeds of gaia in four mystical pools located in the four corners of old atlantis
lines.name: English

lines.value: these seeds bring forth four giant trees that begin to summon gaia
lines.name: English

lines.value: kastor's forces are at a stand by as they wait for gaia to arrive
lines.name: English

lines.value: shortly after the planting of all the trees kronos appears
lines.name: English

lines.value: kronos advances to destroy any opposition on the island
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually gaia is released who battles kronos eventually throwing him back through the door to tartarus and burying him in a landslide
lines.name: English

lines.value: she then returns back to the earth
lines.name: English

lines.value: kronos servant attempts to escape but after a brief struggle kastor stabs him through the heart
lines.name: English

lines.value: after kastor kills kronos servant arkantos appears to the atlanteans and grants kastor rulership of the atlantean people by giving him the staff of atlantis
lines.name: English

lines.value: the story ends with arkantos bidding his son and everyone else farewell before leaving as kastor the new ruler of atlantis and his people rebuild once again
lines.name: English

lines.value: father time commonly known as old father time is a weather vane at lord's cricket ground london in the shape of father time removing the bails from a wicket
lines.name: English

lines.value: the weathervane is a total of tall with the figure of father time standing at
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was given to lord's in 1926 by the architect of the grandstand sir herbert baker
lines.name: English

lines.value: although frequently referred to as old father time in television and radio broadcasts old is not part of the official title
lines.name: English

lines.value: the symbolism of the figure derives from law 16(3 of the laws of cricket after the call of time the bails shall be removed from both wickets old father time was originally located atop the old grand stand
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was wrenched from its perch during the blitz when it became entangled in the steel cable of a barrage balloon but was repaired and returned to its previous position
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1992 the weather vane was struck by lightning and the subsequent repairs were featured on children's television programme blue peter
lines.name: English

lines.value: old father time was permanently relocated to the mound stand in 1996 when the grand stand was demolished and rebuilt
lines.name: English

lines.value: father time was again damaged in march 2015 by the high winds of cyclone niklas which required extensive repair by specialists
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1969 old father time became the subject of a poem lord's test by the sussex and england cricketer john snow

lines.value: the flying p liners were the sailing ships of the german shipping company f laeisz of hamburg
lines.name: English

lines.value: the company was founded in 1824 by ferdinand laeisz as a hat manufacturing company
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was quite successful and distributed his hats even in south america
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1839 he had the three masted wooden brig carl named after his son built and entered the shipping business but lack of success made him sell the ship a short five years later
lines.name: English

lines.value: ferdinand's son carl laeisz entered the business in 1852
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was he who turned the f laeisz company into a shipping business
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1857 they ordered a barque which they named pudel which was the nickname of carl's wife sophie and from the mid 1880s on all their ships had names starting with p and they became known as the p line
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last ship without a p name was the wooden barque henriette behn which was stranded on the mexican coast in 1885
lines.name: English

lines.value: the laeisz company specialized in the south american nitrate trade
lines.name: English

lines.value: their ships were built for speed and they soon acquired an excellent reputation for timeliness and reliability which gave rise to the nickname the flying p line
lines.name: English

lines.value: the five masted barque potosi made the voyage from chile to england around cape horn in 1904 in just 57 days which was a record at the time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the laeisz company had some of the largest sailing ships ever built
lines.name: English

lines.value: they experimented with steel hulled five masters first the barque potosi 1895 and in 1902 the huge full rigged ship preussen with a length of 147 m 5.081 grt and over 7.800 tons dead weight
lines.name: English

lines.value: she could sail faster than 18 knots and her best 24-hour distance was 392 sm in 1908 on her voyage to yokohama
lines.name: English

lines.value: however these ships turned out to be too big their crews didn't like them and it became increasingly difficult to achieve a satisfactory utilization on the outbound leg from europe to chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: the later ships such as the peking or the passat returned to being smaller four masted barques
lines.name: English

lines.value: during world war i many of laeisz ships were blocked in chilean ports and had to be handed over as war reparations
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the laeisz company was able to reacquire many ships after the war and put them into service again
lines.name: English

lines.value: towards the end of the 1920s the company began pulling out of the nitrate trade and increasingly started transporting other goods e.g bananas
lines.name: English

lines.value: they also sold some of their older ships for instance the pamir to gustav erikson in finland who already had acquired the former norddeutscher lloyd ship herzogin cecilie
lines.name: English

lines.value: the last sailing ship ordered by the laeisz company was the padua in 1926
lines.name: English

lines.value: subsequently the laeisz company only ordered steam ships
lines.name: English

lines.value: four of the flying p liners still exist today
lines.name: English

lines.value: the money or the gun was an australian comedy/talk show on the abc network
lines.name: English

lines.value: it ran from 1989 to 1990 with occasional specials until 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was written by andrew denton simon dodd bruce griffiths and george dodd directed by martin coombes and produced by mark fitzgerald
lines.name: English

lines.value: each episode was based on a significant theme with denton interviewing a number of people as well as conducting vox pops on the street
lines.name: English

lines.value: significant episodes include guns the musical and the award winning episode on disabilities the year of the patronising bastard which picked up a united nations media peace prize
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1993 a one off special was called topic of cancer which talked to teenagers with cancer while at a canteen weekend
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2003 denton held a 10-year reunion for the people on the 1993 show as part of his abc interview programme enough rope
lines.name: English

lines.value: each week a guest would perform their own version of led zeppelin's stairway to heaven
lines.name: English

lines.value: versions would occasionally tie in with the theme of the episode guns the musical had a broadway style version by jodie gilles as the conclusion while the episode on australian comedy had the doug anthony all stars performing it with the assistance of barry crocker but the most surprising of all was the version by rolf harris which eventually reached number 7 on the uk singles chart
lines.name: English

lines.value: generally the performance of stairway would be a break in the program and the artists would have no other part in the program
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cd release won an aria award in australia in 1993 and was subsequently released on the atlantic label in the usa though truncated
