lines.value: the union canal was a towpath canal that existed in southeastern pennsylvania in the united states during the 19th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: first proposed in 1690 to connect philadelphia with the susquehanna river it ran approximately 82 mi from middletown on the susquehanna below harrisburg to reading on the schuylkill river
lines.name: English

lines.value: construction began in 1792 during the george washington administration but financial difficulties delayed its completion until 1828
lines.name: English

lines.value: called the golden link it provided a critical early transportation route for shipping anthracite coal and lumber eastward to philadelphia
lines.name: English

lines.value: closed in the 1880s remnants of the canal remain most notably the union canal tunnel a hand built engineering marvel that is the oldest existing transportation tunnel in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tunnel is a national historic landmark
lines.name: English

lines.value: a canal linking the susquehanna and delaware valleys in southeastern pennsylvania was first proposed in 1690 by william penn the founder of the pennsylvania colony
lines.name: English

lines.value: nearly a century passed before a route for the canal was surveyed by david rittenhouse and william smith between 1762 and 1770 the first canal ever surveyed in the us spurred by the 1791 discovery of anthracite in the upper susquehanna valley the pennsylvania general assembly chartered two companies to undertake the project the schuylkill and susquehanna canal company and the delaware and schuylkill canal company
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time of the initial construction in the 1792 philadelphia was involved in an intense rivalry with baltimore for the supremacy as a shipping port
lines.name: English

lines.value: the canal was backed by philadelphia businessmen as a means to divert commercial traffic from following the susquehanna downriver to the chesapeake bay its more natural destination
lines.name: English

lines.value: from west to east the route of the canal was to follow swatara creek upstream from middletown to quittapahilla creek which it then followed upstream past lebanon and myerstown to its headwaters
lines.name: English

lines.value: it then crossed overland to clarks run at the headwaters of tulpehocken creek following tulpehocken creek downstream to reading on the schuylkill river
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was to follow the schuylkill downriver to the delaware river at philadelphia
lines.name: English

lines.value: construction began in 1792 under the direction of william weston an experienced british canal engineer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first shovel of earth was turned by president george washington
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1793 several miles of the canal were dug and five locks were built between myerstown and lebanon before financial difficulties caused the work to cease
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1795 the pennsylvania legislature authorized a lottery to raise funds for the canal's construction
lines.name: English

lines.value: the largest canal lottery in us history it held 50 drawings over the next two decades awarding $33 million in prize money with only $270000 reaching the canal companies
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1800 construction of the canal was pathetic and the largest oldest cities on the east coast were experiencing an energy crisis—large stands of forest were no longer available near enough to the cities to easily bring in wood for fuel and charcoal production and cities were beginning to import smokey sooty bituminous coal from england and virginia
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1811 the two canal companies were reorganized and merged as the union canal company of pennsylvania and the project was given a new push by industrialists in new jersey and philadelphia
lines.name: English

lines.value: innovative industrialist josiah white had discovered how to properly burn anthracite circa 1808 and large easily mined deposits were found within 100 miles of philadelphia over a decade earlier but overland transportation by mule train of bulk commodities was extremely costly
lines.name: English

lines.value: local rivers were rapids strewn and ran fast not shallow and well behaved
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the end of the war of 1812 industrialists were getting desperate for fuels—mills and manufacturies were sometimes forced into going quiet for days
lines.name: English

lines.value: white and others pushed for canal funding applied for rights to improve navigations on the schuylkill and eventually split off when he disagreed with other investors as the best way to proceed
lines.name: English

lines.value: construction resumed in 1821 probably in response to the successful improvements along the lehigh designed by joshiah white's and the lehigh navigation company—which had begun in 1818 to regularly deliver growing amounts of anthracite coal from summit hill pa to the fuel starved coastal cities
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the principal challenges was the construction of a tunnel through the ridge separating the headwaters of quittapahilla creek and clarks run
lines.name: English

lines.value: the drilling of the tunnel was by hand using gunpowder to blast though argillaceous slate with veins of hard flinty limestone 80 feet 24 m below the summit of the ridge
lines.name: English

lines.value: the progress of the tunnel was approximately 15 ft 4.5 m per week requiring over two years to complete
lines.name: English

lines.value: another engineering difficulty was the lack of a sufficient continual supply of water at the summit level a task that was compounded by leakage and required an elaborate pumping mechanism
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the initial design called for the construction of a canal from the susquehanna to the delaware the 1825 opening of the rival schuylkill navigation from reading to philadelphia prompted the union canal company to focus solely on the middletown reading portion of the canal which when connected would complete the longer conveyance west to the susquehanna
lines.name: English

lines.value: the canal was completed in 1828 under the direction of canvass white the preeminent canal engineer of the day
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon its completion it was 8-1/2 ft 2.6 m wide and had 93 locks
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1832 a branch canal was constructed northward from the water works along the swatara creek to pine grove
lines.name: English

lines.value: the branch canal served as feeder for the summit level as well as allowing the transport of anthracite from the mountains which became the principal revenue source for the canal operation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the charter of the canal company allowed it to build lateral railroad lines from the canal to reach coal mines
lines.name: English

lines.value: it built a line from the end of the branch canal to lorberry junction in 1830 which was operated by horse power
lines.name: English

lines.value: this connected it to the lorberry creek railroad and brought coal traffic to the canal
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1844 the track was leased to the swatara railroad which extensively refurbished the right of way and began to operate it by steam locomotive in about 1850
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the 1840s the narrow size of the canal locks prevented the passage of the larger barges that were adopted for use on the pennsylvania main line and schuylkill navigation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the existing width restricted barges to
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1841 to 1858 under the direction of chief engineer loammi baldwin jr the canal was widened to 17 ft 5.2 m to allow the passage of the larger boats carrying to
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the process of the rebuilding the tunnel through the summit ridge was shortened to 600 ft 180 m
lines.name: English

lines.value: the widening of the canal allowed for a brief period of prosperity in the late 1850s and early 1860s
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 1862 a flood on swatara creek damaged the western portion of the canal completely destroying the pine grove feeder upon which the canal company depended for revenue
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flood prompted costly repairs that were compounded with continual water supply problems
lines.name: English

lines.value: the connecting railroad was leased to the philadelphia and reading railroad on july 26 1862 and sold outright in january 1866
lines.name: English

lines.value: the completion of the lebanon valley railroad in 1857 from reading to harrisburg cut into the canal revenues forcing its closure in 1881
lines.name: English

lines.value: in april 1950 the union canal tunnel was purchased by the lebanon county historical society
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tunnel was placed on the national register of historic places on october 1 1974
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was designated a national historic civil engineering landmark in 1970
lines.name: English

lines.value: on april 19 1994 the tunnel was designated a national historic landmark by the secretary of the interior bruce babbitt
lines.name: English

lines.value: the tunnel is open to visitors in the union canal tunnel park
lines.name: English

lines.value: a restored portion of the canal along tulpehocken creek is maintained by the berks county parks system at the union canal towpath park in wyomissing west of reading
lines.name: English

lines.value: this portion contains several restored locks along a towpath now used as a recreational trail
lines.name: English

lines.value: a portion of the canal along swatara creek is also preserved at swatara state park where there are remains of 7 locks a towpath bridge major sections of the towpath and three dams are still visible in swatara state park
lines.name: English

lines.value: the canal was never rebuilt because the railroad soon went into operation on the opposite bank of the swatara creek
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kokoda track or trail is a single file foot thoroughfare that runs overland -  in a straight line - through the owen stanley range in papua new guinea
lines.name: English

lines.value: the track was the location of the 1942 world war ii battle between japanese and allied - primarily australian - forces in what was then the australian territory of papua
lines.name: English

lines.value: the track runs from owers corner in central province east of port moresby across rugged and isolated terrain which is only passable on foot to the village of kokoda in oro province
lines.name: English

lines.value: it reaches a height of as it passes around the peak of mount bellamy
lines.name: English

lines.value: the track travels primarily through the land of the mountain koiari people
lines.name: English

lines.value: hot humid days with intensely cold nights torrential rainfall and the risk of endemic tropical diseases such as malaria make it a challenging trek
lines.name: English

lines.value: hiking the trail normally takes between four and twelve days the fastest recorded time is 16 hours 34 minutes
lines.name: English

lines.value: the track was first surveyed in 1899 by henry hamilton stuart russell in order to create a path from port moresby to the north coast of new guinea
lines.name: English

lines.value: stuart russell's group shot numerous local people as he encountered their opposition along his journey
lines.name: English

lines.value: in particular as they were approaching the yodda valley indigenous resistance was met with rifle fire with stuart russell noting that the tribesmen the colonial government having received messages of the surveyor's obstacles sent capt charles monckton to resupply the group with food ammunition and troopers of the native constabulary
lines.name: English

lines.value: monckton reached the surveyor's camp finding that they were barricaded in a log hut surrounded by local tribesmen
lines.name: English

lines.value: monckton's force swept away the surrounding natives and as soon as the rifle fire died away they were able to unite with stuart russell's group
lines.name: English

lines.value: stuart russell also discovered gold in the area which encouraged british and anglo australian prospectors to enter the region that was to become known as the yodda kokoda goldfields
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to conflict between these miners and the local tribes the colonial paramilitary force the armed native constabulary was ordered to enforce british rule in the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1900 officers such as william armit alexander elliot and archibald walker led their troopers to crush any opposition killing many villagers
lines.name: English

lines.value: armit who was previously a sub inspector in the notorious native police force in queensland alone led a patrol that shot dead seventeen people in one village in the upper reaches of the mambare river
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1904 the colonial management decided to establish a government settlement to act as a base for the troopers and consolidate british rule
lines.name: English

lines.value: this station became known as kokoda and from this base the armed native constabulary was able to subdue the local population
lines.name: English

lines.value: paths from kokoda were made with forced labour from local and distant tribes
lines.name: English

lines.value: government officer henry griffin ordered that those who refused to labour were to be punished with the shooting of their pigs and stealing of their taro plants
lines.name: English

lines.value: between july 1942 and november 1942 a series of battles afterwards called the kokoda track campaign were fought between the japanese and australian forces
lines.name: English

lines.value: this action was memorialised in the newsreel documentary kokoda front line filmed by cameraman damien parer which won australia's first academy award for its director ken g hall in 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the war the track fell into disuse and disappeared in many places
lines.name: English

lines.value: john landy the long distance runner set a record of four days for the crossing using carriers and guides during the 1950s and in 1964 angus henry the art teacher at sogeri high school along with two of his students john kadiba and misty baloiloi set a new record which was to stand until after the millennium by completing the journey in three and a quarter days without guides carriers or any signposts or bridges
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2006 the owen stanley ranges and kokoda track was included on the tentative list for world heritage along with three other sites from png
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1.5 million hectare property is a mixed cultural and natural site covering a significant proportion of the owen stanley ranges and including the kokoda track managalas plateau and mount victoria and mount albert edward region
lines.name: English

lines.value: the world war ii battle sites were a key reason for cultural listing along with the unique cultures of the koiari peoples
lines.name: English

lines.value: the owen stanley ranges through which the kokoda track passes is one of the most biologically important areas in the asia pacific with over 4000 plant species and many endemic bird and animal species
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kokoda track foundation established in 2003 helps villages along the track with education and healthcare
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a proposal to turn the track into an australian heritage destination on a par with anzac cove at gallipoli
lines.name: English

lines.value: creation of the heritage area is in part a response to the issue of an australian gold mining company wanting to mine on or near the track
lines.name: English

lines.value: , the idea was backed by the australian government and papua new guinea's foreign minister
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 2007 australian mining firm frontier resources announced plans to divert a section of the track to make way for a copper mine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plan has the support of the local landowners and the papua new guinean government but has been criticized by trekking operators
lines.name: English

lines.value: the track has been closed numerous times by villagers along the route in response to various grievances
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 2009 villagers at kovelo - near kokoda village - blocked the track after complaints that money collected from trekking fees was not being distributed fairly
lines.name: English

lines.value: since 2001 there has been a rapid increase in the number of people walking the track see table at right
lines.name: English

lines.value: six australian trekkers have died from natural causes while attempting to walk the track
lines.name: English

lines.value: four of those deaths occurred in 2009 with two in the same week in april and another two 8 days apart in september and october
lines.name: English

lines.value: the deaths have sparked calls for mandatory fitness tests for all walkers before starting
lines.name: English

lines.value: as popularity for walking the track has increased there have been calls for more regulation of trek operators with some operators taking as many as 150 walkers in a group
lines.name: English

lines.value: in response the kokoda track authority has announced that from the beginning of 2010 tour operators must have a commercial licence which will address things such as training requirements and first aid details
lines.name: English

lines.value: in august 2009 the kokoda track was the destination for a group of trekkers that were killed when their light plane airlines png flight 4684 crashed en route to kokoda station
lines.name: English

lines.value: all 13 people on board including 9 australian trekkers were killed in the crash
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result the australian government committed $1.8 million to improve safety along the track
lines.name: English

lines.value: funds would be used to improve the safety of airstrips at kokoda menari kagi melei efogi and naduri villages located along the track
lines.name: English

lines.value: a second radio channel would also be installed to deal with emergencies and maintenance work
lines.name: English

lines.value: in october 2009 don vale became the oldest australian at 83 to successfully complete the kokoda track
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 2009 australian paralympian kurt fearnley born without the lower section of his spine ) completed the track crawling north to south in 11 days
lines.name: English

lines.value: a multiple paralympic gold medalist t54 marathon in athens and beijing he used customized shin pads and wrist guards
lines.name: English

lines.value: his journey was to raise awareness of men's health issues and was inspired by the story of corporal john metson who crawled the track for three weeks refusing the assistance of a stretcher on the grounds it would burden his comrades
lines.name: English

lines.value: there has been much debate in australia about whether it should be called the kokoda trail or the kokoda track
lines.name: English

lines.value: the monument at owers corner uses both terms track on one side and trail on the other
lines.name: English

lines.value: kokoda trail was gazetted as the official name of the route by the australian administration of papua new guinea in 1972
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earliest mention of the route in an australian newspaper may be in the argus on wednesday 29 july 1942 in a map when it refers to the buna kokoda moresby track
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to historian stuart hawthorne before world war ii the route was referred to as the overland mail route or the buna road
lines.name: English

lines.value: he states that kokoda trail became common because of its use in australian newspapers during the war the first known instance being in sydney's daily mirror on 27 october 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: however all three terms kokoda track kokoda trail and buna kokoda road were commonly used during world war ii in australian newspapers from september 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: the diary of the australian army's 2/33rd battalion records the route being officially designated as the kokoda trail in september 1942
lines.name: English

lines.value: the australian army has used kokoda trail as a battle honour since 1957
lines.name: English

lines.value: the australian war memorial awm says that trail is probably of united states origin but has been used in many australian history books and appears to be used more widely
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the historical use of trail track gained dominance in the 1990s with the australian macquarie dictionary stating that while both versions were in use kokoda track appears to be the more popular of the two
lines.name: English

lines.value: the track can be walked from either direction
lines.name: English

lines.value: some say that from kokoda to owers corner is easier even though in that direction one must actually climb an extra 550 metres in height
lines.name: English

lines.value: the track can take anything from 4 days to 12 days to complete depending on fitness and rest time involved
lines.name: English

lines.value: locals are renowned for being able to regularly complete it in 3 days
lines.name: English

lines.value: the best time to trek kokoda is from april to september during the dry season
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are a number of guesthouses located along the way some at villages and others at traditional rest spots
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main villages passed through from owers corner are naoro menari efogi creek 1 & 2 kagi or naduri if shortcut is taken alolo isurava hoi kovolo
lines.name: English

lines.value: villagers are increasingly taking part in the commercial opportunities created by the growing number of tourists in october 2006 some were known to be selling cans of soft drink and beer at double the price payable in port moresby
lines.name: English

lines.value: guides and porters can be found more easily at the kokoda end of the track by asking the local police station for a reputable person
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kokoda track authority the png special purpose authority with responsibility for managing the track requires tour operators to hold a commercial operators licence to lead treks along the kokoda track and purchase a trek permit
lines.name: English

lines.value: licensed operators carry first aid kits undertake first aid training carry radios and or satellite phones respect the people who live along the track and ensure their porters and guides are treated in a professional manner
lines.name: English

lines.value: a list of licensed operators is available on its website
lines.name: English

lines.value: trekkers walking with unlicensed operators will be stopped by the kta rangers and the local people
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kokoda challenge race is an endurance running race that was revived on 27 august 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: the race originally ran in 1975 but stopped before becoming an annual event
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kokoda challenge inaugural race commenced in 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: the current race record holder in both directions is brendan buka with a best time of 16:34.05 in 2008 from owers corner to kokoda and a time of 17:20 in the direction of kokoda to owers corner via naduri
lines.name: English

lines.value: the inaugural race of 27 august 2005 was won by john hunt hiviki who completed it in 22 hours one minute and 14 seconds
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 27 august 2006 brendan buka a 22-year-old papua new guinean trekking porter from kokoda conquered the trail from owers corner to kokoda in a winning time of 17 hours 49 minutes and 17 seconds
lines.name: English

lines.value: a sydney engineer damon goerke 32 became the first australian to run the track in under 24 hours coming third in the 2006 challenge with a time of just under 19.5 hours
lines.name: English

lines.value: the race record was again broken by buka in the 2007 event when he completed the track in 17 hours 20 minutes on 26 august 2007 running in the reverse direction from kokoda to owers corner
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2007 event also featured runners running from owers corner to kokoda and a wnning time of 19 hours 9 minutes was set in this direction by tom hango
lines.name: English

lines.value: first australian over the line was kokoda talisman rohan george in what was recorded as the toughest race conditions to date
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 31 august 2008 buka once again rewrote the record books by winning the 2008 race with a time of 16:34:05
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conditions were the worst that they had been in the three years that buka had competed in the event
lines.name: English

lines.value: that year buka trained which is why he claims he broke his own record
lines.name: English

lines.value: wayne urina claiming second place is currently the 2nd fastest man to complete the crossing of the kokoda trail with a time of 18:34:06
lines.name: English

lines.value: cyprian aire came third with 19:11:40
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2011 the kokoda challenge race was run on 27 august
lines.name: English

lines.value: the race commenced from ower's corner and finished at the new kokoda archway
lines.name: English

lines.value: the race was organised and sponsored by kokoda trekking
lines.name: English

lines.value: brendan buka once again won the race in a time of 17:50:33 but did not break his previous record set in 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kokoda challenge race in 2012 was run on 25 august
lines.name: English

lines.value: the race commenced from the kokoda archway and went for the first time via kagi village and finished at owers corner
lines.name: English

lines.value: the race once again was sponsored by kokoda trekking
lines.name: English

lines.value: this year saw a new champion emerge by the name of ramsy idau of kokoda who walks the kokoda trail as a porter with kokoda trekking set a new record with a time of 18:28:00
lines.name: English

lines.value: prize money was set at k10000 png kina
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the race there were several top class competitors from australia damon goerke returning for a second time richard mountstephens chris wight nephew of stan and butch bissett 2/14th jonathan o'loughlin chris turnbull andrew turner and dave jennings
lines.name: English

lines.value: william bennett also competed in his second kokoda challenge race and finished in a time of 31:09:10
lines.name: English

lines.value: the race was a successful event which also saw for the first time two japanese runners compete against the 8 australians and 22 papua new guineans in this the 70th anniversary of the kokoda campaign
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two japanese runners makoto yoshimoto and yukiya higuchi finished in a time of 42:56:36
lines.name: English

lines.value: in computing and typesetting a soft hyphen iso 8859 0xad unicode html &#173 &shy or syllable hyphen ebcdic 0xca abbreviated shy is a code point reserved in some coded character sets for the purpose of breaking words across lines by inserting visible hyphens
lines.name: English

lines.value: two alternative ways of using the soft hyphen character for this purpose have emerged depending on whether the encoded text will be broken into lines by its recipient or has already been preformatted by its originator
lines.name: English

lines.value: the use of shy characters in text that will be broken into lines by the recipient is the application context considered by the post 1999 html and unicode specifications as well as some word processing file formats
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this context the soft hyphen may also be called a discretionary hyphen or optional hyphen
lines.name: English

lines.value: it serves as an invisible marker used to specify a place in text where a hyphenated break is allowed without forcing a line break in an inconvenient place if the text is reflowed
lines.name: English

lines.value: it becomes visible only after word wrapping at the end of a line
lines.name: English

lines.value: the soft hyphen's unicode semantics and html implementation are in many ways similar to unicode's zero width space with the exception that the soft hyphen will preserve the kerning of the characters on either side when not visible
lines.name: English

lines.value: the zero width space on the other hand will not as it is considered a visible character even if not rendered thus having its own kerning metrics
lines.name: English

lines.value: to show the effect of a soft hyphen in html the following words have been separated with soft hyphens <div style="background:#f7f7f7 width:70% margin:auto;"> margaret­are­you­grieving­over­goldengrove­unleaving­leaves­like­the­things­of­man­you­with­your­fresh­thoughts­care­for­can­you­ah­as­the­heart­grows­older­it­will­come­to­such­sights­colder­by­and­by­nor­spare­a­sigh­though­worlds­of­wanwood­leafmeal­lie­and­yet­you­will­weep­and­know­why­now­no­matter­child­the­name­sorrows­springs­are­the­same­nor­mouth­had­no­nor­mind­expressed­what­heart­heard­of­ghost­guessed­it­is­the­blight­man­was­born­for­it­is­margaret­you­mourn­for on html browsers supporting soft hyphens resizing the window will rebreak the above text only at word boundaries and insert a hyphen at the end of each line
lines.name: English

lines.value: html4 describes it as a hyphenation hint though it suggests that that interpretation is not universal in html there are two types of hyphens the plain hyphen and the soft hyphen
lines.name: English

lines.value: the plain hyphen should be interpreted by a user agent as just another character
lines.name: English

lines.value: the soft hyphen tells the user agent where a line break can occur
lines.name: English

lines.value: those browsers that interpret soft hyphens must observe the following semantics
lines.name: English

lines.value: if a line is broken at a soft hyphen a hyphen character must be displayed at the end of the first line
lines.name: English

lines.value: if a line is not broken at a soft hyphen the user agent must not display a hyphen character
lines.name: English

lines.value: for operations such as searching and sorting the soft hyphen should always be ignored
lines.name: English

lines.value: the shy character is also being used in text where paragraphs have already been broken into lines such as certain plain text files text sent to vt100-style terminal emulators or printers or pages represented in page description languages
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is the application context originally considered by the ebcdic and iso 8859-1 standards and implemented in many vt100 terminal emulators
lines.name: English

lines.value: here shy is a visible hyphen that is usually visually indistinguishable from a regular hyphen but has been inserted solely for the purpose of line breaking
lines.name: English

lines.value: the purpose of the soft hyphen here is to distinguish it from any regular hyphen that might have been part of the original spelling of the word
lines.name: English

lines.value: this distinction helps to reuse already formatted text when line breaks and soft hyphens inserted during word wrapping have to be removed to convert the text back into its unformatted form
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example the copy or paste function of a terminal emulator can offer to replace line breaks with a space character and remove any soft hyphens including any immediately following whitespace characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: an example application that outputs soft hyphens for this reason is the groff text formatter as used on many unix/linux systems to display man pages
lines.name: English

lines.value: shy characters in coded characters sets roughly in chronological order * troff and groff
lines.name: English

lines.value: soft hyphens have been used to obscure malicious domains or urls in e mail spam
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wales national rugby league team represents wales in international rugby league football matches
lines.name: English

lines.value: currently the team is ranked ninth in the rlif world rankings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team was run under the auspices of the rugby football league but an independent body wales rugby league now runs the team from cardiff
lines.name: English

lines.value: three welsh players have been entered into the rugby league hall of fame
lines.name: English

lines.value: as with other welsh national sporting teams wales strip has been primarily red
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in the world cup campaign in 2000 they wore a shirt featuring the welsh flag adding a touch of green and white
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team is known as the dragons and so the teams logo on the shirt is a red dragon
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team date back to 1907 making them the third oldest national side after england and new zealand and it was a touring new zealand side that wales first played against in 1908 winning 9 8 at aberdare
lines.name: English

lines.value: since then wales have regularly played england since 1935 france as well as welcomed the touring australia and new zealand teams although they rarely toured themselves not playing a match in the southern hemisphere until 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: for 26 years wales competed against their two biggest rivals england and france in the european nations cup winning the trophy four times
lines.name: English

lines.value: wales has also competed in the world cup on four occasions the first time being in 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1995 and 2000 they had their most successful tournaments to date making the semi finals on both occasions before being beaten by england and australia respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: wales failed to qualify for the 2008 world cup being the second highest ranked side not to do so having lost to scotland on points difference over two matches
lines.name: English

lines.value: they then qualified for the 2013 world cup but failed to win a game including losing 32 16 to low ranked italy in their opening game at the millennium stadium in cardiff
lines.name: English

lines.value: in recent seasons wales has taken massive strides under former player iestyn harris who had coached wales to back to back european cup successes which culminated in a four nations appearance in 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2014 former england and france coach john kear became the new head coach after iestyn harris left the post to concentrate on his new job as head coach at salford red devils
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 5 april 1904 england played an international match against the other nationalities a team of welshmen and scotsmen in wigan
lines.name: English

lines.value: of the twelve players who played for the other nationalities team as it was a 12-a-side game ten of them were welshmen coming from northern english clubs
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the turn of the century many welshmen made the switch from rugby union wanting to be paid for playing and although the numbers switching were constantly increasing the northern union did not think that a welsh side would be strong enough for england
lines.name: English

lines.value: after 80 minutes however the other nationalities had beaten england 9 3
lines.name: English

lines.value: nevertheless this team carried on for another two years playing england annually in 1905 and 1906 losing 26 11 and drawing 3 3 respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: from 1905 to 1910 rugby league as a sport enjoyed growth not just in wales and england but also on the east coast of australia and in northern new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: when albert henry baskerville's nz all golds with their guest australian star dally messenger arrived in britain for the inaugural tour by a southern hemisphere side the first full international was against wales on new year's day 1908
lines.name: English

lines.value: the welsh rugby league team were contesting their first national fixture and managed to beat the touring kiwis 9 8 in aberdare in front of 20000 spectators
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was the first international match played under new northern union rules which would later be rapidly changed again but these rules were a small departure from traditional rugby union rules which had been used in previous international matches minus the amount of players which were experimentally changed by the nu several times
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new zealand team or the all golds as they were being called by the new zealand newspapers had never played rugby by these rules before but did have a week of preparation and training sessions leading up to the match
lines.name: English

lines.value: with this welsh victory and large crowd wales played their second fixture in tonypandy and managed to win that match too recording a 35 18 win against what would soon become their main rival the england lions
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the end of 1908 wales played their third and final fixture of the decade playing england again but this time in broughton lancashire
lines.name: English

lines.value: this time they lost 31 7
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in 1909 another victory was to occur for welsh rugby league with a welsh league xiii made up of players still playing in wales beating a touring australian side 14 13 in merthyr
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the years before the outbreak of the war wales regularly played england
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two national teams played each other every year including 1914
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to rugby league only extensively being played in the two countries in the whole of the northern hemisphere touring australia and new zealand teams were the only chances to play someone different
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the two matches against the english played in wales were played in ebbw vale in monmouthshire the welsh travelled around england for away matches playing in coventry oldham plymouth and st helens
lines.name: English

lines.value: collectively those seven matches in wales and england produced six defeats for the welsh team although there were signs of improvement in the last match in st helens the dragons narrowly lost by just four points the match ending 16 12
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the 7 october 1911 wales played australia for the first time
lines.name: English

lines.value: the match held at ebbw vale again drew 7000 people to watch wales go down 20 28
lines.name: English

lines.value: the match was significant though because throughout the next few decades australia would play the dragons in wales whenever they toured great britain
lines.name: English

lines.value: during and after the first world war many sports suffered and rugby league in wales was no exception the team didn't play a match again until 1921
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a seven year hiatus wales once again played england and continued to do so annually throughout the 1920s apart from in 1924
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of the long hiatus a large proportion of players competing in the 1921 match were earning their first cap for the team
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first game at leeds saw wales lose 35 9 in front of 13000
lines.name: English

lines.value: a further 13000 saw the 1921 22 kangaroo touring side play wales in december 1921 this time in pontypridd
lines.name: English

lines.value: like the first time these nations played each other australia narrowly defeated the welsh the final score being 16 21
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1922 wales took part in the first international rugby league match to be played in london
lines.name: English

lines.value: england beat wales 12 7 in herne hill but just 3000 people turned up to watch one of the lowest attendances to ever watch a wales match
lines.name: English

lines.value: after four more matches against england in various rugby league strongholds in northern england the dragons once again played in wales
lines.name: English

lines.value: two matches were played in 1926 in pontypridd the same year that a pontypridd domestic side joined the english leagues although they disbanded a year later
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first match saw finished wales 22 30 england with a record 23000 in attendance
lines.name: English

lines.value: the second match saw wales comfortably beat the touring new zealand 34 8
lines.name: English

lines.value: three more matches against england were played including one in november 1928 played in cardiff
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was in the 1920s that jim sullivan one of three welsh players to be enrolled into the rugby league hall of fame started rising through the ranks at wigan
lines.name: English

lines.value: a career spanning 25 years saw him play many times for wales picking up 26 caps a record that was only beaten in 2010 by ian watson
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also represented great britain 25 times and glamorgan & monmouthshire 12 times
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1930s were to herald a new era for the team as it emerged at times as one of the dominant sides in world rugby league
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1930 and 1933 wales played australia at wembley stadium in london
lines.name: English

lines.value: on both occasions they failed to win losing 26 10 and being thrashed 51 19
lines.name: English

lines.value: however at the time australia were arguably considered the world's second best nation behind england and so particularly in the first game wales had done very well against the touring kangaroos
lines.name: English

lines.value: wales luck against england did not change either suffering three losses to the lions in three games in huddersfield salford and leeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were very unlucky in the latter however with england winning 14 points to 13
lines.name: English

lines.value: exactly 27 years after wales played their first match they played france for the first time in a new competition called the european nations cup in which wales france and england would play two matches each
lines.name: English

lines.value: wales and france kicked off the tournament on new year's day in front of 15000 in bordeaux
lines.name: English

lines.value: but the dragons lost 18 11 and their match against england was just as bad losing 24 11 in liverpool
lines.name: English

lines.value: the france versus england match finished a 15 15 draw so england won the inaugural competition on points difference
lines.name: English

lines.value: wales finished bottom
lines.name: English

lines.value: the next european nations cup brought better fortunes to the welsh and they kicked off the competition which was staged across winter 1935 and 1936 with a 41 7 thrashing against france
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team were cheered on by 25000 people at llanelli and three months later wales did the unexpected and squeezed past england winning 14 17 away at hull
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was a huge result for wales having not beaten england since 1923 and they had won the cup for the first time
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the next two competitions wales successfully defended the cup
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 3 2 win against the english in pontypridd coupled with a 9 3 victory in paris saw wales clinch the cup for the second time and then in 1938 the dragons beat england again by one point in bradford before beating the french 18 2
lines.name: English

lines.value: this represents perhaps the highest point in welsh rugby league history with great players such as jim sullivan gus risman alan edwards and alec givvons featuring
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1935 welsh rugby league would produce its first black international in george bennett some 48 years before welsh rugby union would do so
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1938/1939 tournament the last to be held for six years because of the second world war wales beat their main rivals england before dramatically losing 16 10 in bordeaux against les tricolores
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of the french's victory against england wales finished second and the cup was taken across the channel
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 1978 kangaroo tour wales played australia at st helen's ground in swansea losing 8 3
lines.name: English

lines.value: queer collaborations qc is a national australian queer conference
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conference is held annually usually in july and makes use of the safer spaces agreement
lines.name: English

lines.value: in recent years the conference has attracted over 200 delegates
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is often referred to as a student conference although that is not strictly true
lines.name: English

lines.value: the majority of delegates are students but the facilitation collectives have not usually restricted registration
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conference has traditionally been supported by the national union of students of australia nus and has used the nus standing orders but officially the conference is autonomous and not affiliated with nus
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conference began in 1991 as a one day meeting of students from universities around sydney
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually qc expanded to its current format of a one week national conference
lines.name: English

lines.value: a challenge to the conference occurred in 2001 in newcastle when a political dispute caused the conference floor to split
lines.name: English

lines.value: many of the delegates left the conference and formed their own conference in a bar down the street
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university of wollongong were the 2010 hosts defeating the cross campus queer network western australia 62-60 in the second round of voting after monash clayton was eliminated in the first round
lines.name: English

lines.value: at wollongong in 2010 the nus queer officers were censured by the conference floor
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the 2012 conference it was determined that a collection of sydney area universities would host the 2013 event
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sydney universities were chosen over a bid from brisbane who had also bid the previous year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2017 queer collaborations conference is to be held at the university of wollongong in wollongong
lines.name: English

lines.value: xprize is a nonprofit organization that designs and manages public competitions intended to encourage technological development that could benefit humanity
lines.name: English

lines.value: their board of trustees include james cameron larry page arianna huffington ratan tata among others
lines.name: English

lines.value: the xprize mission is to bring about radical breakthroughs for the benefit of humanity through incentivized competition
lines.name: English

lines.value: it fosters high profile competitions to motivate individuals companies and organizations across all disciplines to develop innovative ideas and technologies that help solve the grand challenges that restrict humanity's progress
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highest profile xprize to date was the ansari x prize relating to spacecraft development awarded in 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: this prize was intended to inspire research and development into technology for space exploration
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first xprize - the ansari xprize - was inspired by the orteig prize a $25000 prize offered in 1919 by french hotelier raymond orteig for the first nonstop flight between new york city and paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1927 underdog charles lindbergh won the prize in a modified single engine ryan aircraft called the spirit of st louis
lines.name: English

lines.value: in total nine teams spent $400000 in pursuit of the orteig prize
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1996 entrepreneur peter diamandis offered a $10-million prize to the first privately financed team that could build and fly a three passenger vehicle 100 kilometers into space twice within two weeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: the contest later titled the ansari xprize for suborbital spaceflight motivated 26 teams from seven nations to invest more than $100 million in pursuit of the $10 million purse
lines.name: English

lines.value: on october 4 2004 the ansari xprize was won by mojave aerospace ventures who successfully completed the contest in their spacecraft spaceshipone
lines.name: English

lines.value: the prize was awarded in a ceremony at the saint louis science center in st louis missouri
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2011 the science center maintains numerous exhibits about the xprize
lines.name: English

lines.value: the foundation has also created the xprize cup rocket challenge competition
lines.name: English

lines.value: xprizes are monetary rewards to incentivize three primary goals the prize can increase attention to endeavors that otherwise might not receive much publicity
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example attempts in the recent lunar lander competition have been well publicized in the media increasing visibility of both the foundation and the participants
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the ansari xprize xprize established a model in which offering a prize for achieving a specific goal can stimulate entrepreneurial investment
lines.name: English

lines.value: since then new challenges have expanded into a range of other fields
lines.name: English

lines.value: xprize is developing new prizes in exploration space and oceans life sciences energy & environment education and global development
lines.name: English

lines.value: some hope the prizes will help improve lives create equity of opportunity and stimulate new important discoveries
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of january 2018 there are seven completed contests eight active contests and one contest that has been canceled
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ansari xprize for suborbital spaceflight was the first prize from the foundation
lines.name: English

lines.value: it successfully challenged teams to build private spaceships capable of carrying three people and fly two times within two weeks to open the space frontier
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first part of the ansari xprize requirements was fulfilled by mike melvill on september 29 2004 on spaceshipone a spacecraft designed by burt rutan and financed by paul allen co founder and former ceo of microsoft
lines.name: English

lines.value: on that ship melvill broke the 100-kilometer 62.5 mi mark internationally recognized as the boundary of outer space winning the prize
lines.name: English

lines.value: brian binnie completed the second part of the requirements on october 4 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result us$10 million was awarded to the winner but more than $100 million was invested in new technologies in pursuit of the prize
lines.name: English

lines.value: today sir richard branson jeff bezos and others are creating a personal spaceflight industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: awarding this first prize gave xprize as much publicity as the winners themselves
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the 2004 success there was ample media coverage to afford both scaled composites and xprize additional support for them to expand and continue to pursue their aims
lines.name: English

lines.value: following this early success several other xprizes were announced that have yet to be awarded despite various attempts to meet the requirements
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ansari xprize won the space foundation's douglas s morrow public outreach award in 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: the award is given annually to an individual or organization that has made significant contributions to public awareness of space programs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the goal of the progressive insurance automotive xprize was to design build and race super efficient vehicles that achieve 100 mpge 2.35 liter/100 kilometer efficiency produce less than 200 grams mile well to wheel co 2 equivalent emissions and could be manufactured for the mass market
lines.name: English

lines.value: the winners of the competition were announced on september 16 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wendy schmidt oil cleanup xchallenge was introduced on july 29 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: the $1 million prize had a goal to inspire a new generation of innovative solutions that will speed the pace of cleaning up seawater surface oil resulting from spillage from ocean platforms tankers and other sources
lines.name: English

lines.value: the team of elastec/american marine won the challenge by developing a device that skims oil off water three times faster than previously existing technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: the northrop grumman lunar lander xchallenge ngllxpc was a competition co-hosted by nasa to build precise efficient small rocket systems
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was introduced in 2006 and awarded on november 5 2009 in washington dc to masten space systems led by david masten the top $1 million prize while armadillo aerospace led by id software founder john carmack took home the second place prize of $500000 plus an additional $500000 in 2008
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nokia sensing xchallenge goal is accelerating the use of sensors and sensing technology to tackle health care problems and find ways for people to monitor and maintain their personal well being
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was composed of two distinct challenges held in 2013 and 2014
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was announced in 2012 and 12 finalists announced in 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: on november 11 2014 the winner has been named and prize purses totaling $2.25 million were awarded
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wendy schmidt ocean health xprize is a $2 million competition to improve our understanding of ocean acidification
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 20 2015 the winners of the challenge have been announced
lines.name: English

lines.value: the qualcomm tricorder xprize was announced on may 10 2011 and is sponsored by qualcomm foundation
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was officially launched on january 10 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: the $10 million prize is awarded for creating a mobile device that can diagnose patients better than or equal to a panel of board certified physicians
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name is taken from the tricorder device in star trek which can be used to instantly diagnose ailments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the google lunar xprize was introduced on september 13 2007
lines.name: English

lines.value: the goal of the prize was similar to that of the ansari xprize to inspire a new generation of private investment in space exploration and technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: the challenge called for teams to compete in successfully launching landing and operating a rover on the lunar surface
lines.name: English

lines.value: the prize was going to award $20 million to the first team to land a rover on the moon that successfully roved more than 500 meters and transmitted back high definition images and video
lines.name: English

lines.value: there was a $5 million second prize as well as $5 million in potential bonus prizes for extra features such as roving long distances greater than 5000 meters capturing images of man made objects on the moon or surviving a lunar night
lines.name: English

lines.value: on january 23 2018 the prize ended when no team was able to schedule confirm and pay for a launch attempt
lines.name: English

lines.value: the x prize foundation announced that no team would be able to make a launch attempt to reach the moon by the 31 march 2018 deadline and the us$30 million google lunar xprize will go unclaimed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the archon genomics xprize the second xprize to be offered by the foundation was announced october 4 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: the goal of the archon genomics xprize was to greatly reduce the cost and increase the speed of human genome sequencing to create a new era of personalized predictive and preventive medicine eventually transforming medical care from reactive to proactive
lines.name: English

lines.value: the $10 million prize purse was promised to the first team that can build a device and use it to sequence 100 human genomes within 10 days or less with an accuracy of no more than one error in every 100000 bases sequenced with sequences accurately covering at least 98% of the genome and at a recurring cost of no more than $1000 per genome
lines.name: English

lines.value: if more than one team attempted the competition at the same time and more than one team fulfilled all the criteria then teams would have been ranked according to the time of completion
lines.name: English

lines.value: no more than three teams would have been ranked and would have shared the purse in the following manner $7.5 million to the winner and $2.5 million to the second place team if two teams were successful or $7 million $2 million and $1 million if three teams are successful
lines.name: English

lines.value: actual competition events were originally scheduled to take place twice a year with all eligible teams given the opportunity to make an attempt starting at precisely the same time as the other teams
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was changed to a single competition scheduled for september 5 2013 to october 1 2013 which was canceled on august 22 2013
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rationale for the change was articulated by the ceo today companies can do this for less than $5000 per genome in a few days or less - and are moving quickly towards the goals we set for the prize
lines.name: English

lines.value: for this reason we have decided to cancel an xprize for the first time ever
lines.name: English

lines.value: the global learning xprize launched in september 2014 is a $15-million prize to create mobile apps to improve reading writing and arithmetic in developing nations
lines.name: English

lines.value: each application will be developed during an 18-month period and the top five teams will receive $1 million each with each of the winning apps being made available under an open source license
lines.name: English

lines.value: the finalist that develops an app with that produces the highest performance gains will win a $10 million prize
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ai xprize was announced as having an aim to use an artificial intelligence system to deliver a compelling ted talk
lines.name: English

lines.value: diamandis hopes to contrast the benevolent value of ai against the dystopian point of view that sometimes enter ai conversations
lines.name: English

lines.value: the winning team of the contest which is scheduled for 2020 will be determined by the audience
lines.name: English

lines.value: on december 14 2015 peter diamandis chairman and ceo of x prize announced the launch of a new $7 million prize that will be a three year global competition that challenges researchers to build better technologies for mapping earth's seafloor
lines.name: English

lines.value: on september 29 2015 peter diamandis chairman and ceo of x prize announced the launch of a $20 million prize for a 4.5-year competition on testing technologies which converts co 2 into products with the highest net value to reduce carbon dioxide emissions of either a coal or a natural gas power plant
lines.name: English

lines.value: round three began in april 2018 as the 27 semifinalists were cut down to ten finalists each receiving an equal share of $5 million milestone prize money
lines.name: English

lines.value: five teams will compete at in coal fired power plant in gillette wy and the remaining five teams will compete at a natural gas fired power plant in alberta canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february 2020 this operational round will conclude and winners will be announced the following month
lines.name: English

lines.value: find solutions how to improve literacy proficiency of adults in reading within a 12-month period
lines.name: English

lines.value: the challenge has been announced on june 8 2015 and is awarded with $7 million by barbara bush foundation for family literacy and the dollar general literacy foundation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the winners will be announced in january 2019
lines.name: English

lines.value: the anu & naveen jain women's safety xprize was launched on october 24 2016 and has a $1 million purse
lines.name: English

lines.value: the goal for competing teams is to develop a safety device for women that can autonomously and inconspicuously trigger an emergency alert while transmitting information to a network of community responders
lines.name: English

lines.value: the water abundance xprize was launched on october 24 2016 and has a $1.75 million purse provided by the tata group and australian aid
lines.name: English

lines.value: competing teams must develop an atmospheric water generator that extracts a minimum of 2000 liters of water per day using 100% renewable energy at a cost of no more than 2 cents per liter
lines.name: English

lines.value: 2018 ana avatar xprize the $10 million ana avatar xprize is a four year competition focused on accelerating the integration of emerging and exponential technologies into a multipurpose avatar system that will seamlessly transport human skills and experience to the exact location where and when they are needed
lines.name: English

lines.value: considering the potential of indian talent x prize foundation set up a trust/ngo in november 2014 in mumbai india
lines.name: English

lines.value: the xprize foundation is governed by a board of directors that determine the annual roadmaps and act as stewards for the foundation
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of january 2018 the board of directors are
lines.name: English

lines.value: the xprize foundation also has a board of trustees that provides insights on new technologies grand challenges requiring significant innovation and other areas that lend themselves to prize philanthropy
lines.name: English

lines.value: albert gleaves january 1 1858 - january 6 1937 was a decorated admiral in the united states navy also notable as a naval historian
lines.name: English

lines.value: born in nashville tennessee gleaves graduated from the united states naval academy in 1877
lines.name: English

lines.value: after serving on board and he was appointed an ensign in 1881
lines.name: English

lines.value: assigned to many ships and stations he commanded during the spanish american war and later the battleship
lines.name: English

lines.value: promoted to rear admiral in 1915 in world war i he commanded the cruiser and transport force
lines.name: English

lines.value: for his outstanding contribution he was awarded the army and navy distinguished service medals
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1919 he was promoted to admiral and commanded the asiatic fleet
lines.name: English

lines.value: while serving at the naval ordnance proving ground admiral gleaves made outstanding contributions in the field of gunnery and torpedoes
lines.name: English

lines.value: while carrying out some tests on torpedo steering devices he changed these weapons from instruments of luck into instruments of precision
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gear which he tested in cushing provided the imprints which made the torpedo the terrible weapon of world war i in spite of a life of constant action in war and peace he found time to write a biography of captain james lawrence the history of the cruiser and transport force and the life of an american sailor william hensley emory rear admiral usn
lines.name: English

lines.value: after a most distinguished career he retired in january 1 1922
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a companion of the naval order of the united states and was assigned insignia number 756
lines.name: English

lines.value: admiral gleaves died at haverford pennsylvania january 6 1937 a few days after his 79th birthday
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has been quoted as saying to seamen a ship becomes endowed with human virtues and faults she ceases to be a mere inanimate thing
lines.name: English

lines.value: here is admiral albert gleaves's ribbon bar
lines.name: English

lines.value: , a was the lead ship of her class and named for admiral gleaves
lines.name: English

lines.value: his memoirs titled the admiral the memoirs of albert gleaves admiral usn was published in 1985 by hope publishing house pasadena california hope ).
lines.name: English

lines.value: james shedden palmer october 13 1810 &ndash december 7 1867 was an officer in the united states navy during the civil war
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was later promoted to rear admiral
lines.name: English

lines.value: palmer was born at elizabethtown new jersey
lines.name: English

lines.value: he entered the united states navy on august 26 1824 as ship's boy aboard
lines.name: English

lines.value: palmer was appointed midshipman january 1 1825
lines.name: English

lines.value: he commanded during the mexican american war and and during the civil war
lines.name: English

lines.value: he commanded the naval station at new orleans and the west gulf squadron during 1864
lines.name: English

lines.value: appointed to command the west indies squadron in 1865 he was commissioned rear admiral on july 25 1866 and died at st thomas virgin islands
lines.name: English

lines.value: palmer was commanding officer of iroquois which was part of the us mediterranean squadron at the time of the attack on fort sumter
lines.name: English

lines.value: he returned to the united states in january 1862 where he was on leave without orders until march when he was reappointed commander of the iroquois
lines.name: English

lines.value: he saw service as part of farragut's western gulf blockading squadron and was one of the captains present at the attack and capture of new orleans and at farragut's attempt to do the same at vicksburg in 1862
lines.name: English

lines.value: promoted to captain for his role in the victory at new orleans in july of that year the following month he took command of farragut's flagship hartford
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 7 february 1863 palmer was promoted to commodore
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 1864 he was made senior officer of naval forces on the mississippi in the vicinity of new orleans and concurrently the commanding officer of until april of that year when he assumed command of in place of the pensacola
lines.name: English

lines.value: in august he became commanding officer of the 1st division of ironclads western gulf blockading squadron with as his flagship ironic as richmond was not an ironclad
lines.name: English

lines.value: he held this post until november 1864
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was then acting commander of farragut's squadron during the latter's absence from november 1864 to february 1865
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then reverted to his previous post which he held until may 1865
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was promoted to rear admiral on 25 july 1865
lines.name: English

lines.value: from may through december 1865 palmer held administrative posts in washington dc that december he was appointed commander of the north atlantic squadron with serving as his flagship
lines.name: English

lines.value: on july 25 1866 he was promoted to the rank of rear admiral
lines.name: English

lines.value: while still commanding the north atlantic squadron rear admiral james s palmer died of yellow fever at st thomas virgin islands
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was buried in new york city
lines.name: English

lines.value: the destroyer was named for him
lines.name: English

lines.value: life savers is an american brand of ring shaped hard candy
lines.name: English

lines.value: its range of mints and artificial fruit flavors is known for its distinctive packaging coming in paper wrapped aluminum foil rolls
lines.name: English

lines.value: candy manufacturer clarence crane of garrettsville ohio father of the poet hart crane invented the brand in 1912 as a summer candy that could withstand heat better than chocolate
lines.name: English

lines.value: the candy's name is derived from its similarity to the shape of life preservers used for saving people who have fallen from boats
lines.name: English

lines.value: after registering the trademark crane sold the rights to his pep o mint peppermint candy to edward john noble for $2900
lines.name: English

lines.value: instead of using cardboard rolls which were not very successful noble created tin foil wrappers to keep the mints fresh
lines.name: English

lines.value: noble founded the life savers and candy company in 1913 and significantly expanded the market for the product by installing life savers displays next to the cash registers of restaurants and grocery stores
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also encouraged the owners of the establishments to always give customers a nickel in their change to encourage sales of the $0.05 life savers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the slogan still only 5 cents helped life savers to become a favorite treat for children with a tight allowance
lines.name: English

lines.value: since then many different flavors of life savers have been produced
lines.name: English

lines.value: the five flavor roll first appeared in 1935
lines.name: English

lines.value: a series of mergers and acquisitions by larger companies began in 1956
lines.name: English

lines.value: life savers is currently a property of mars incorporated
lines.name: English

lines.value: in recent decades the brand expanded to include gummi savers in 1992 life saver minis in 1996 creme savers in 1998 and life saver fusions in 2001
lines.name: English

lines.value: discontinued varieties include fruit juicers holes life saver lollipops and squeezit
lines.name: English

lines.value: life savers was first created in 1912 by clarence crane a cleveland ohio candy maker and father of the famed poet hart crane
lines.name: English

lines.value: crane developed a line of hard mints but did not have the space or machinery to make them
lines.name: English

lines.value: he contracted with a pill manufacturer to press the mints into shape
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1913 crane sold the formula for his life savers candy to edward noble of gouverneur new york for $2900
lines.name: English

lines.value: noble started his own candy company and began producing and selling the mints known as pep o mint life savers
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also began to package the mints into rolls wrapped in tin foil to prevent them from going stale
lines.name: English

lines.value: this process was done by hand until 1919 when machinery was developed by edward noble's brother robert peckham noble to streamline the process
lines.name: English

lines.value: robert was a purdue educated engineer
lines.name: English

lines.value: he took his younger brother's entrepreneurial vision and designed and built the manufacturing facilities needed to expand the company
lines.name: English

lines.value: the primary manufacturing plant for life savers was located in port chester new york a local landmark replete with a life savers motif cast into the cornice
lines.name: English

lines.value: robert led the company as its chief executive officer and primary shareholder for more than 40 years until selling the company in the late 1950s
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1919 six other flavors wint-o-green cl o ve lic o rice cinn o mon vi o let and choc o late had been developed and these remained the standard flavors until the late 1920s
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1920 a new flavor called malt o milk was introduced
lines.name: English

lines.value: this flavor was received so poorly that it was discontinued after only a few years
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1925 the tinfoil was replaced with aluminum foil
lines.name: English

lines.value: noble promoted the candy at the cash registers of saloons cigar stores drug stores barber shops and restaurants
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had the candy placed with a five cent price near the cash register
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1921 the company began to produce solid fruit drops
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1925 technology improved to allow a hole in the center of the fruit candies
lines.name: English

lines.value: these were introduced as the fruit drop with the hole and came in orange lemon and lime each of which were packaged in their own separate rolls
lines.name: English

lines.value: in contrast to the opaque white mints previously produced by the company these new candies were crystal like in appearance
lines.name: English

lines.value: these new flavors quickly became popular with the public
lines.name: English

lines.value: four new flavors were quickly introduced namely anise butter rum cola and root beer which were made in the clear fruit drop style
lines.name: English

lines.value: these did not prove to be as popular as the three original fruit drop flavors
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1931 the life savers cough drop was introduced with menthol but it was not successful
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1931 rolls of pineapple and cherry fruit drops were also introduced
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the public response proved positive for these a new variety of mint called cryst o mint made in this same crystal like style was introduced in 1932
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1935 the classic five flavor rolls were introduced offering a selection of five different flavors pineapple lime orange cherry and lemon in each roll
lines.name: English

lines.value: this flavor lineup was unchanged for nearly 70 years until 2003 when three of the flavors were replaced in the united states making the rolls pineapple cherry raspberry watermelon and blackberry
lines.name: English

lines.value: however orange was subsequently reintroduced and blackberry was dropped
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original five flavor lineup is still sold in canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the late 1930s and early 1940s four new mint flavors were introduced molas o mint spear o mint choc o mint and stik o pep
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the second world war other candy manufacturers donated their sugar rations to keep life savers in production so that the little candies could be shared with armed forces as a tasty reminder of life at home
lines.name: English

lines.value: soon after the war ended the manufacturing license was withdrawn
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1947 uk based rowntree's which formerly had been licensed to make life savers started to manufacture a similar product called the polo mint
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1981 nabisco brands inc acquired life savers from the er squibb corporation
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of early mint flavors including cl o ve vi o let lic o rice and cinn o mon were discontinued due to poor sales
lines.name: English

lines.value: nabisco introduced a new cinnamon flavor hot cin o mon as a clear fruit drop type candy
lines.name: English

lines.value: this replaced the white mint flavor cinn o mon which had recently been discontinued
lines.name: English

lines.value: the other original mint flavors were retired
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of other flavors were also quickly discontinued after nabisco took over in order to make the business more profitable
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 the us life savers business was acquired by wrigley's
lines.name: English

lines.value: wrigley's introduced two new mint flavors for the first time in over sixty years in 2006 orange mint and sweet mint
lines.name: English

lines.value: they also revived some of the early mint flavors such as wint o green
lines.name: English

lines.value: life savers production was based in holland michigan until 2002 when it was moved to montreal quebec canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: significantly lower sugar prices in that country were the reason behind the move
lines.name: English

lines.value: the company's headquarters in port chester new york where life savers were made from 1920 until 1984 was distinctive
lines.name: English

lines.value: although it has been converted to apartments it still retains some lifesavers signage
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was added to the national register of historic places in 1985
lines.name: English
