lines.value: the decade of the 1970s in film involved many significant films
lines.name: English

lines.value: asian cinema of the 1970s catered to the rising middle class fantasies and struggles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the bollywood cinema of india this was epitomized by the films of bollywood superhero amitabh bachchan
lines.name: English

lines.value: these films portrayed adventurous plots with car chase trying to imitate hollywood films like the french connection presented music with disco beats and also presented the young middle class man as an angry young man
lines.name: English

lines.value: the women on the other hand were shown as ones who have adopted western values and outfits especially by heroines like parveen babi who was featured on the cover of time magazine for a story on bollywood's success and zeenat aman
lines.name: English

lines.value: however towards the very end of the 1970s especially after the steep rise in land prices in urban areas and the decline in employment security the heroines were seen more often as saree women striving to have a prosperous middle class family especially heroines like jaya prada and hema malini
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this way the cinema of asian region becomes a sociological statement of the social economic times of the region and its people
lines.name: English

lines.value: in malayalam cinema adoor gopalakrishnan made swayamvaram in 1972 which got wide critical acclaim
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was followed by the film nirmalyam by m t vasudevan nair in 1973
lines.name: English

lines.value: another asian touchstone beginning in the early 1970s was traditional hong kong martial arts film which sparked a greater interest in chinese martial arts to the west
lines.name: English

lines.value: martial arts film reached the peak of its popularity largely in part due to its greatest icon bruce lee
lines.name: English

lines.value: his films elevated the genre to a new level and sparked a greater interest in martial arts in the west
lines.name: English

lines.value: lee became famous for playing kato in the tv series the green hornet during the 1960s yet it was when he returned to hong kong and starred in three films that shot him to stardom all over asia the big boss 1971 fist of fury 1972 and way of the dragon 1972
lines.name: English

lines.value: yet he achieved global stardom in his last completed film and the first kung fu film to be produced by a hollywood studio enter the dragon 1973
lines.name: English

lines.value: in european cinema the failure of the prague spring brought about nostalgic motion pictures reminiscent of the ones that celebrate the 1970s itself
lines.name: English

lines.value: these films expressed a yearning and as a premonition to the decade and its dreams
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hungarian director istvan szabo made the motion picture szerelmesfilm 1970 which is a nostalgic portrayal and a premonition of the fading of the young 1970s ethos of change and a friendlier social structure
lines.name: English

lines.value: the italian director bernardo bertolucci made the motion picture the conformist 1970
lines.name: English

lines.value: german films after the war asked existential questions especially the works of rainer fassbinder
lines.name: English

lines.value: the films of the swedish director ingmar bergman reached a new level of expression in motion pictures like cries and whispers 1973
lines.name: English

lines.value: young german directors made films that came to be known as the german new wave
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was the voice of a new generation that had grown up after the second world war
lines.name: English

lines.value: these included directors like wim wenders hans jurgen syberberg and werner herzog
lines.name: English

lines.value: the decade opened with hollywood facing a financial slump reflecting the monetary woes of the nation as a whole during the first half of the decade
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite this the 1970s proved to be a benchmark decade in the development of cinema both as an art form and as a business
lines.name: English

lines.value: with young filmmakers taking greater risks and restrictions regarding language and sexuality lifting hollywood produced some of its most critically acclaimed and financially successful films since its golden era in the years previous to 1970 hollywood had begun to cater to the younger generation with films such as the graduate
lines.name: English

lines.value: this proved a folly when anti war films like r p m and the strawberry statement became major box office flops
lines.name: English

lines.value: even solid films with bankable stars like the pearl harbor epic tora
lines.name: English

lines.value: tora
lines.name: English

lines.value: tora flopped leaving studios in dire straits financially
lines.name: English

lines.value: unable to repay financiers studios began selling off land furniture clothing and sets acquired over years of production
lines.name: English

lines.value: nostalgic fans bid on merchandise and collectibles ranging from judy garland's sparkling red shoes to mgm's own back lots
lines.name: English

lines.value: more of the successful films were those based in the harsh truths of war rather than the excesses of the 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: films like the francis ford coppola scripted patton starring george c scott as the world war ii general and robert altman's mash about a korean war field hospital were major box office draws in 1970
lines.name: English

lines.value: honest old fashioned films like summer of 42 and the erich segal adaptation love story were commercial and critical hits
lines.name: English

lines.value: love story and summer remain two of the most successful films in hollywood history
lines.name: English

lines.value: summer costing $1000000 usd brought in $25000000 at the box office while love story with a budget of $2200000 earned $106400000
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the most insightful films of the decade came from the mind of a hollywood outsider czechoslovakian director milos forman whose taking off became a bold reflection of life at the beginning of the 1970s
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1971 film satirized the american middle class following a young girl who runs away from home leaving her parents free to explore life for the first time in years
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the film was never given a wide release in america it became a major critical achievement both in america and around the world garnering the film high honors at the cannes film festival and several bafta award nominations
lines.name: English

lines.value: sean connery returned to the role of james bond in 1971 in diamonds are forever after george lazenby filled the role in 1969
lines.name: English

lines.value: roger moore succeeded connery in 1973 with an adaptation of ian fleming's live and let die which was the most successful of his bond films in terms of admissions
lines.name: English

lines.value: live and let die was followed by an adaptation of the man with the golden gun in 1974 which at the time garnered the lowest box office taking of any bond film before it
lines.name: English

lines.value: after its release harry saltzman co owner of danjaq with albert r broccoli sold his half to united artists causing a three year gap until the next bond film the longest gap since the start of the franchise in 1962
lines.name: English

lines.value: the series picked up again in 1977 with the spy who loved me and ended the decade with moonraker in 1979 which was the highest grossing bond film not adjusting for inflation of all time until goldeneye in 1995
lines.name: English

lines.value: an adaptation of an arthur hailey novel would prove to be one of the most notable films of 1970 and would set the stage for a major trend in 1970s cinema
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film airport featured a complex plot characters and an all star cast of hollywood a listers and legends
lines.name: English

lines.value: airport followed an airport manager trying to keep a fictional chicago airport operational during a blizzard as well as a bomb plot to blow up an airplane
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was a major critical and financial success helping pull universal studios into the black for the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film earned senior actress helen hayes an oscar for best supporting actress and garnered many other nominations in both technical and talent categories
lines.name: English

lines.value: the success of the film launched several other disaster films many of which following the same blueprint of major stars a melodramatic script and great suspense
lines.name: English

lines.value: three airport sequels followed in 1974 1977 and 1979 each successor making less money than the last
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1972 brought the poseidon adventure which starred a young gene hackman leading an all star cast to safety in a capsized luxury liner
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film earned an academy award for visual effects and best original song for the morning after as well as numerous nominations including one for its notable supporting star shelley winters but its sequel in 1979 was far less successful
lines.name: English

lines.value: the towering inferno teamed steve mcqueen and paul newman against a fire in a san francisco skyscraper
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film cost a whopping $14 million to produce expensive for its time and won academy awards for cinematography film editing and best original song
lines.name: English

lines.value: the same year the epic earthquake featured questionable effects camera shake and models to achieve a destructive 9.9 earthquake in los angeles
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite this the film was one of the most successful of its time earning $80 million at box office
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the late 1970s the novelty had worn off and the disasters had become less exciting
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1977 brought a terrorist targeting a rollercoaster 1978 a swarm of bees and a less than threatening meteor in 1979
lines.name: English

lines.value: the early 1970s also brought a rebirth of gritty crime film three years after the influential bullitt
lines.name: English

lines.value: william friedkin's the french connection starring gene hackman as a drug detective and sidney lumet's serpico starring al pacino in the true life story of an honest cop who fought corruption were two of the most famous ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: films like get carter featured gratuitous nudity while stanley kubrick's groundbreaking a clockwork orange featured much physical and sexual violence to complement its complex story
lines.name: English

lines.value: african american filmmakers also found success in the 1970s with such hits as shaft and sweet sweetback's baadasssss song
lines.name: English

lines.value: like other sequels in the 1970s shaft went on to have two more adventures each less successful than the last
lines.name: English

lines.value: an adaptation of a mario puzo novel the godfather was a box office and critical success in 1972
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three hour epic followed a mafia boss played by marlon brando through his life of crime
lines.name: English

lines.value: beyond the violence and drama were themes of love pride and greed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the godfather went on to earn $134 million at american box office and $245 million throughout the world becoming the highest grossing film of all time
lines.name: English

lines.value: it won academy awards for best picture best actor and best screenplay
lines.name: English

lines.value: its director francis ford coppola was passed over in favor of bob fosse and his musical cabaret which also earned an oscar for its star liza minnelli
lines.name: English

lines.value: the godfather part ii followed in 1974 with roughly the same principal cast and crew earning oscars for star robert de niro its director composer screenwriters and art directors
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film also earned the best picture oscar for that year
lines.name: English

lines.value: not all of the street smart urban related films were 100% live action
lines.name: English

lines.value: director ralph bakshi released the first animated full length feature specifically oriented towards adults fritz the cat then moved on to two other features that dealt with the mafia and other ethnic related urban issues
lines.name: English

lines.value: both heavy traffic and coonskin would prove that this kind of material could be handled effectively in the animation genre
lines.name: English

lines.value: bakshi would later produce fantasy oriented films wizards and the lord of the rings before the decade ended
lines.name: English

lines.value: inaugurated by the 1969 release of andy warhol blue movie the phenomenon of adult erotic films being publicly discussed by celebrities like johnny carson and bob hope and taken seriously by critics like roger ebert a development referred to by ralph blumenthal of the new york times as porno chic and later known as the golden age of porn began for the first time in modern american culture
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to award winning author toni bentley radley metzger 1976 film the opening of misty beethoven based on the play pygmalion by george bernard shaw and its derivative my fair lady and due to attaining a mainstream level in storyline and sets is considered the crown jewel of this golden age
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the middle 1970s films began to also reflect the disenfranchisement brought by the excesses of the past twenty years
lines.name: English

lines.value: a deeply unsettling look at alienation and city life martin scorsese's taxi driver earned international praise first at the cannes film festival and then at the academy awards where it was nominated for best leading actor robert de niro best supporting actress jodie foster best score bernard herrmann and best picture
lines.name: English

lines.value: all the president's men dealt with the impeachment of richard nixon while lumet's network portrayed greed and narcissism in both american society and television media
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film won oscars for best actor peter finch best actress faye dunaway best supporting actress beatrice straight and best screenplay paddy chayefsky
lines.name: English

lines.value: thanks to a stellar cast experienced director and a poignant story network became one of the largest critical successes of 1976
lines.name: English

lines.value: another film rocky about a clubhouse boxer played by sylvester stallone who is granted a world championship title fight won the best picture academy award that year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film also became a major commercial success and spawned four sequels through the rest of the 1970s and 1980s
lines.name: English

lines.value: throughout the 1970s the horror film developed into a lucrative genre of film
lines.name: English

lines.value: it began in 1973 with the terrifying the exorcist directed by william friedkin and starring the young linda blair
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film saw massive success and the first of several sequels was released in 1977
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1976 brought the equally creepy suspense thriller marathon man about a man who becomes the target of a former nazi dentist's torment after his brother dies
lines.name: English

lines.value: the same year the devil himself made an appearance in the omen about the spawn of satan
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1978's halloween was a precursor to the slasher films of the 1980s and 1990s with its psychopathic michael myers
lines.name: English

lines.value: cult horror films were also popular in the 1970s such as wes craven's early gore films last house on the left and the hills have eyes as well as tobe hooper's the texas chain saw massacre
lines.name: English

lines.value: the blockbuster was born in 1975
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the 1973 horror classic the exorcist was among the top five grossing films of the 1970s the first film given the blockbuster distinction was 1975's jaws
lines.name: English

lines.value: released on june 20 the film about a series of horrific deaths related to a massive great white shark was director steven spielberg's first big budget hollywood production coming in at $9 million in cost
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film slowly grew in ticket sales and became one of the most profitable films of its time ending with a $260 million gross in the united states alone
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film won academy awards for its skillful editing chilling score and sound recording
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was also nominated for best picture that year though it lost to milos forman's one flew over the cuckoo's nest which also won acting awards for jack nicholson and louise fletcher
lines.name: English

lines.value: it spawned the successful sequel jaws 2 in 1978 which featured the same cast but without steven spielberg
lines.name: English

lines.value: another tailor made blockbuster dino de laurentiis king kong was released but to less than stellar success
lines.name: English

lines.value: king kong did mark the first time a film was booked to theaters before a release date a common practice today
lines.name: English

lines.value: the massive success of jaws was eclipsed just two years later by another legendary blockbuster and film franchise
lines.name: English

lines.value: the george lucas science fiction film star wars hit theater screens in may 1977 and became a major hit growing in ticket sales throughout the summer and the rest of the year
lines.name: English

lines.value: in time earning some $460 million the good versus evil fantasy set in space was not soon surpassed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film's breathtaking visual effects won an academy award
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film also won for john williams's uplifting score as well as art direction costume design film editing and sound
lines.name: English

lines.value: star wars effectively removed any specter of studio bankruptcy that had haunted the studios since early in the decade
lines.name: English

lines.value: when a television film star wars holiday special was released as a spin off from star wars in 1978 it failed to receive the status of the original film and was deemed a flop
lines.name: English

lines.value: it would be two years until the star wars series would be revived with the empire strikes back
lines.name: English

lines.value: another success in visual effects came the same year as star wars with spielberg's close encounters of the third kind another blockbuster and alien contact set in the wilderness
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the picture spielberg received his first oscar nomination for directing
lines.name: English

lines.value: a year later the most iconic superhero was brought to the screen in superman who was portrayed by classically trained actor christopher reeve
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was met by resounding praise for strong performances and its epic scope which resulted in numerous sequels and is regarded as one of the greatest superhero films ever made beginning a new era of superhero films
lines.name: English

lines.value: the success of woody allen's annie hall in 1977 stirred a new trend in filmmaking
lines.name: English

lines.value: annie hall a love story about a depressed comedian and a free spirited woman was followed with more sentimental films including neil simon's the goodbye girl an unmarried woman starring jill clayburgh the autobiographical lillian hellman story julia starring jane fonda and vanessa redgrave and 1978's heaven can wait and international velvet
lines.name: English

lines.value: younger audiences were also beginning to be the focus of cinema after the huge blockbusters that had attracted them back to the theater
lines.name: English

lines.value: john travolta became popular in the pop culture landmark films saturday night fever which introduced disco to middle america and grease which recalled the world of the 1950s
lines.name: English

lines.value: comedy was also given new life in the irreverent animal house set on a college campus during the 1960s
lines.name: English

lines.value: up in smoke starring cheech & chong was another irreverent comedy about marijuana use became popular among teenagers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new television comedy program saturday night live launched the careers of several of its comedians such as chevy chase who co starred in the 1978 hit foul play with goldie hawn
lines.name: English

lines.value: the decade closed with two films chronicling the vietnam war michael cimino's the deer hunter and francis ford coppola's apocalypse now
lines.name: English

lines.value: both films focused on the horrors of war and the psychological damage caused by such horrors
lines.name: English

lines.value: christopher walken and director michael cimino earned oscars for their work on the film which earned a best picture academy award
lines.name: English

lines.value: robert de niro and meryl streep were also nominated for their work in the deer hunter
lines.name: English

lines.value: apocalypse now won for cinematography and sound and earned nominations for robert duvall and coppola
lines.name: English

lines.value: hal ashby's coming home portrayed life for vietnam veterans
lines.name: English

lines.value: actor jon voight won an academy award for his role in the film
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1979 saw the poignant kramer vs kramer the inspiring norma rae and the nuclear thriller the china syndrome
lines.name: English

lines.value: alien scared summer film going audiences of 1979 with its horrible monster from outer space achieving similar success that jaws had seen four years earlier
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile the onion field and and justice for all focused on the failures of the american judicial system
lines.name: English

lines.value: the year ended with hal ashby's subtle black comedy being there and the muppet movie a family film based on the jim henson puppet characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the films in the 1970s came in many different varieties as the socially conscious directors that emerged in the late 1960s grew in very different ways influenced by music literature crime and war
lines.name: English

lines.value: the decade is most known for excelling in the crime drama genre
lines.name: English

lines.value: the early part of the decade focused on increasingly realistic gritty films including coppola's first two godfather pictures and robert altman's black comedy mash
lines.name: English

lines.value: a trend that lasted through the decade was the popularity of disaster films starting with airport in 1970
lines.name: English

lines.value: another trend was the birth of the blockbuster horror film initiated by william friedkin's the exorcist which spawned numerous imitators
lines.name: English

lines.value: a pivotal moment in films was the release of steven spielberg's first blockbuster hit jaws which was considered to be the birth of the blockbuster motion picture a trend sealed two years later with the release of star wars
lines.name: English

lines.value: the end of the decade saw two epic vietnam war films from directors michael cimino the deer hunter and coppola apocalypse now
lines.name: English

lines.value: a multiplayer video game is a video game in which more than one person can play in the same game environment at the same time
lines.name: English

lines.value: video games are often single player activities putting the player against preprogrammed challenges or ai controlled opponents which lack the flexibility of human thought
lines.name: English

lines.value: multiplayer games allow players interaction with other individuals in partnership competition or rivalry providing them with social communication absent from single player games
lines.name: English

lines.value: in multiplayer games players may compete against two or more human contestants work cooperatively with a human partner to achieve a common goal supervise other players activity co op and objective based modes assaulting or defending a control point
lines.name: English

lines.value: multiplayer games typically require players to share the resources of a single game system or use networking technology to play together over a greater distance
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the earliest video games were two player games including early sports games such as 1958's tennis for two and 1972's pong early shooter games such as spacewar
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1962 and early racing video games such as astro race 1973
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first examples of multiplayer real time games were developed on the plato system about 1973
lines.name: English

lines.value: multi user games developed on this system included 1973's empire and 1974's spasim the latter was an early first person shooter
lines.name: English

lines.value: other early video games included turn based multiplayer modes popular in tabletop arcade machines
lines.name: English

lines.value: in such games play is alternated at some point often after the loss of a life
lines.name: English

lines.value: all players scores are often displayed onscreen so players can see their relative standing
lines.name: English

lines.value: gauntlet 1985 and quartet 1986 introduced co operative 4-player gaming to the arcades
lines.name: English

lines.value: the games had broader consoles to allow for four sets of controls
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first large scale serial sessions using a single computer were star based on star trek ocean a battle using ships submarines and helicopters with players divided between two combating cities and 1975's cave based on dungeons and dragons created by christopher caldwell with art work and suggestions by roger long and assembly coding by robert kenney on the university of new hampshire's decsystem 1090
lines.name: English

lines.value: the university's computer system had hundreds of terminals connected via serial lines through cluster pdp 11s for student teacher and staff access
lines.name: English

lines.value: the games had a program running on each terminal for each player sharing a segment of shared memory known as the high segment in the os tops 10
lines.name: English

lines.value: the games became popular and the university often banned them because of their ram use
lines.name: English

lines.value: star was based on 1974's single user turn oriented basic program star written by michael o'shaughnessy at unh
lines.name: English

lines.value: ken wasserman and tim stryker in a 1980 byte article identified three factors which make networked computer games appealing flight simulator ii released in 1986 for the atari st and commodore amiga allowed two players to connect via modem or serial cable and fly together in a shared environment
lines.name: English

lines.value: midi maze an early first person shooter released in 1987 for the atari st featured network multiplay through a midi interface before ethernet and internet play became common
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is considered the first multiplayer 3d shooter on a mainstream system and the first network multiplayer action game with support for up to 16 players
lines.name: English

lines.value: there followed ports to a number of platforms including game boy and super nes in 1991 under the title faceball 2000 making it one of the first handheld multi platform first person shooters and an early console example of the genre
lines.name: English

lines.value: networked multiplayer gaming modes are known as netplay
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first popular video game title with a lan version 1991's spectre for the apple macintosh featured appletalk support for up to eight players
lines.name: English

lines.value: spectre's popularity was partially attributed to the display of a player's name above their cybertank
lines.name: English

lines.value: there followed 1993's doom whose first network version allowed four simultaneous players
lines.name: English

lines.value: networked multiplayer lan games eliminate common internet problems such as lag and anonymity and are the focus of lan parties
lines.name: English

lines.value: play by email multiplayer games use email to communicate between computers
lines.name: English

lines.value: other turn based variations not requiring players to be online simultaneously are play by post gaming and play by internet
lines.name: English

lines.value: some online games are massively multiplayer with a large number of players participating simultaneously
lines.name: English

lines.value: two massively multiplayer genres are mmorpg such as world of warcraft or everquest and mmorts
lines.name: English

lines.value: some networked multiplayer games including muds and massively multiplayer online games such as runescape omit a single player mode
lines.name: English

lines.value: first person shooters have become popular multiplayer games battlefield 1942 and counter strike have little or no single player gameplay
lines.name: English

lines.value: developer and gaming site omgpop's library includes multiplayer flash games for the casual player
lines.name: English

lines.value: the world's largest mmog is south korea's lineage with 19 million registered players primarily in asia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the largest western mmog in 2008 was world of warcraft with over 10 million registered players worldwide
lines.name: English

lines.value: this category of games requires multiple machines to connect via the internet before the internet became popular muds were played on time sharing computer systems and games like doom were played on a lan
lines.name: English

lines.value: gamers refer to latency using the term ping after a utility which measures round trip network communication delays by the use of icmp packets
lines.name: English

lines.value: a player on a dsl connection with a 50-ms ping can react faster than a modem user with a 350-ms average latency
lines.name: English

lines.value: other problems include packet loss and choke which can prevent a player from registering their actions with a server
lines.name: English

lines.value: in first person shooters this problem appears when bullets hit the enemy without damage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the player's connection is not the only factor some servers are slower than others
lines.name: English

lines.value: beginning with the sega netlink in 1996 game.com in 1997 and dreamcast in 2000 game consoles support network gaming over lans and the internet
lines.name: English

lines.value: many mobile phones and handheld consoles also offer wireless gaming with bluetooth or similar technology
lines.name: English

lines.value: by the early 2010s online gaming had become a mainstay of console platforms such as xbox and playstation
lines.name: English

lines.value: in modern console arcade and personal computer games multiplayer implies play with several controllers plugged into one game system
lines.name: English

lines.value: home console games often use split screen so each player has an individual view of the action important in first person shooters and racing video games most arcade games and some console games since pong do not
lines.name: English

lines.value: nearly all multiplayer modes on beat em up games have a single system option but racing games are abandoning split screen in favor of a multiple system multiplayer mode
lines.name: English

lines.value: turn based games such as chess also lend themselves to single system single screen and even a single controller
lines.name: English

lines.value: the term local co op refers to local multiplayer games played in a cooperative manner on the same system these may by split screen or other display method
lines.name: English

lines.value: hotseat games are typically turn based games with only one controller or input set such as a single keyboard mouse on the system
lines.name: English

lines.value: players rotate using the input device to perform their turn such that each is taking a turn on the hotseat
lines.name: English

lines.value: online cheating in gaming modifies the game experience to give one player an advantage over others
lines.name: English

lines.value: an asymmetric video game is a type of multiplayer video game in which players may play on in an unbalanced way
lines.name: English

lines.value: in soft asymmetry games the players have the same basic mechanics such as movement and death yet all have different roles
lines.name: English

lines.value: in strong asymmetry games typically have one team that are practically the same or in soft asymmetric roles while the other team features players that play in a drastically different way
lines.name: English

lines.value: asynchronous multiplayer is a form of multiplayer gameplay where players do not have to be playing at the same time
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao tukaroto matutaera potatau te wherowhero tawhiao c 1822 26 august 1894 was leader of the waikato tribes the second maori king and a religious visionary
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a member of the ngati mahuta iwi tribe of waikato
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao's father te wherowhero was the leader of the waikato people and his mother whakaawi was te wherowhero's senior wife
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was born around 1822
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the waikato were defeated by musket armed ngapuhi led by hongi hika in a battle at matakitaki pirongia in 1822 they retreated to orongokoekoea pa in what is now the king country and lived there for several years
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao was born at orongokoekoea in about 1825 and was named tukaroto to commemorate it is said his father's stand at matakitaki
lines.name: English

lines.value: tukaroto was later baptised matutaera methuselah by anglican missionary robert burrows but repudiated it in 1867
lines.name: English

lines.value: te ua haumene the hauhau prophet gave him the name tawhiao in 1864
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao was raised by his mother's parents
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1858 te wherowhero was installed as the first maori king taking the name potatau his purpose being to promote unity among the maori people in the face of pakeha encroachment
lines.name: English

lines.value: when potatau died in 1860 tawhiao his sister te paea tiaho and wiremu tamihana tarapipipi of ngati haua were candidates to succeed him
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao was chosen and reigned for thirty four years during one of the most difficult and discouraging periods of maori history
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this period there were de jure two governments english law and governance prevailed within the british settlements and maori custom over the rest of the country although the influence of the king was largely confined to the waikato and even there chiefs such as rewi maniapoto only cooperated with the king when it suited him
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the pakeha population was increasing rapidly while the maori population was unknown as there was no reliable census of maori and pakeha maori for 80 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: because maori separated themselves from paheka many believed wrongly that the maori population was declining rapidly
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was also the period when british industrial trade and political power was at its height
lines.name: English

lines.value: the presence of an independent native state in the central north island was officially ignored by the government until it developed the potential to undermine the colonial government's sovereignty
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1863 after maniapoto warriors ambushed and killed british soldiers escorting a british soldier along the beach to new plymouth for trial the government attacked the kingitanga in waikato to suppress the king movement and remove the threat of a supposed attack on auckland
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conquered land was confiscated altogether about a million acres 4000 km²
lines.name: English

lines.value: six months later with a change of government the king was offered large reserves which he initially refused but much later accepted
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao and his people moved southwards into the territory of the ngati maniapoto the area of new zealand that is still known as the king country
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a pacifist or perhaps he was simply a realist who recognized the futility of trying to fight the colonial government
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the next twenty years he lived an itinerant lifestyle travelling among his people in taranaki and maniapoto settlements reminding them that war always had its price and the price was always higher than expected
lines.name: English

lines.value: he considered himself the anointed leader of a chosen people wandering in the wilderness
lines.name: English

lines.value: but he also predicted that the maori people would find justice and restitution for the wrongs they had suffered
lines.name: English

lines.value: he preached that kingites should keep separate from pakeha
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was strongly against maori children going to school to get an education
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result when the railway went through kingite territory kingites were only able to get unskilled jobs such as bush clearing
lines.name: English

lines.value: this strong anti education stance started a kingite tradition that led to increasing isolation and lower standard of living than maori experienced elsewhere in new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was not until after the turn of the century that kingites were finally persuaded to abandon their hatred of formal education in schools
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1878 the new zealand government with george grey as premier approached tawhiao with the proposal that some of their waikato land would be restored to them if they would accept the integration of the king country with the rest of new zealand
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the advice of his council tawhiao rejected the offer
lines.name: English

lines.value: however it was accepted three years later in a modified form
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the early 1880s there had already been two failed petitions taken to the british government by maori
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1884 there were only 1000 kingite supporters left
lines.name: English

lines.value: king tawhiao went around the north island collecting money
lines.name: English

lines.value: this netted 3000 pounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: he withdrew all the funds that had been deposited in the kingitanga bank by the many maori land sellers and travelled to london to see queen victoria to try and persuade her to honour the treaty between their peoples
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao's petition was different from the previous failed ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: he asked for nothing less than the complete separate maori self government
lines.name: English

lines.value: he did not get beyond lord derby secretary of state for the colonies who said it was a new zealand problem
lines.name: English

lines.value: returning to new zealand the premier robert stout insisted that all events happening prior to 1863 were the responsibility of the imperial government
lines.name: English

lines.value: the maori bank depositors finding their money gone raided the bank looking for their cash and finding none burnt it down in 1884
lines.name: English

lines.value: thoroughly disillusioned tawhiao tried various initiatives to promote the independence and welfare of his people but he had been effectively marginalized
lines.name: English

lines.value: his problems were not solely due to the attitude of the new zealand government
lines.name: English

lines.value: the king movement had never represented all the maori people and as it lost its mana or standing they became even more disunited
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the remainder of his life tawhiao was respected and even entertained as royalty by many of the maori and pakeha people
lines.name: English

lines.value: but he was allowed almost no influence over political events as he had no legal authority
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao is buried at mount taupiri
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was succeeded as king by his son mahuta tawhiao
lines.name: English

lines.value: the church of jesus christ of latter day saints lds church was active in new zealand from 1867
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the 1880s a wairarapa newspaper quoted tawhiao as claiming a belief in mormonism i was some time ago converted to a belief in the mormon faith and i now altogether hold to it
lines.name: English

lines.value: my people in the north are believers also in mormonism and it is my wish that all the maori should be of that faith
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the lds church has no record of tawhiao being baptized other maori joined the church based on a prophecy they claimed tawhiao made in the 1860s-that messengers of god would come from over the sea of kiwa the pacific ocean traveling in pairs and teaching the maori people in their own language
lines.name: English

lines.value: when some who heard tawhiao's prophecy observed pairs of mormon missionaries from the united states teaching in maori language they immediately accepted mormonism
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was also claimed by some maori converts that tawhiao accurately predicted the site of the lds church's hamilton new zealand temple which was built in 1958
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is little direct contemporary evidence of tawhiao being a convert to mormonism
lines.name: English

lines.value: the widely published accounts of his tangihanga make no mention of mormonism but speak instead of native priests
lines.name: English

lines.value: or tohunga
lines.name: English

lines.value: what is beyond doubt however is that he and other maori leaders of the time did meet with latter day saint missionaries
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao had children by three wives and other women
lines.name: English

lines.value: his principal wife was the daughter of his adviser tamati ngapora
lines.name: English

lines.value: they had three children tiahuia who married te tahuna herangi and was the mother of te puea mahuta who succeeded tawhiao as king and te wherowhero who acted as king for a time
lines.name: English

lines.value: tawhiao's other wives were with whom he had two children pokaia and haunui and with whom he had puahaere
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of his other children were not acknowledged except within their mothers hapu
lines.name: English

lines.value: wartburgkreis is a kreis district in the west of thuringia germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: neighboring districts are from the north clockwise the districts unstrut hainich gotha schmalkalden meiningen and the districts fulda hersfeld rotenburg and werra meibner in hesse
lines.name: English

lines.value: the district free city eisenach is nearly completely surrounded by the district
lines.name: English

lines.value: the district was created in 1994 by merging the previous districts eisenach and bad salzungen and a few municipalities from the district bad langensalza
lines.name: English

lines.value: the city eisenach left the district in 1998 and became a district free city
lines.name: English

lines.value: the district is named after the wartburg a castle near eisenach most famous as the place of residence of ludwig landgrave of thuringia and his wife saint elizabeth of hungary and as martin luther's refuge in 1521
lines.name: English

lines.value: the district is located in the thuringian forest including the hainich national park
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main river in the district is the werra
lines.name: English

lines.value: the growing season is the part of the year during which local weather conditions i.e rainfall and temperature permit normal plant growth
lines.name: English

lines.value: while each plant or crop has a specific growing season that depends on its genetic adaptation growing seasons can generally be grouped into macro environmental classes
lines.name: English

lines.value: geographic conditions have major impacts on the growing season for any given area
lines.name: English

lines.value: the elevation or the height above sea level and temperature of a region are two of the main factors that affect the growing season
lines.name: English

lines.value: generally speaking the distance a location is from the equator can be a strong indicator as to what the growing season will look like however in a high elevation area regardless of proximity to the equator a shorter growing season will generally be experienced
lines.name: English

lines.value: proximity to the ocean also can create less extreme conditions especially in terms of temperature which has the potential to extend the growing season further in either direction
lines.name: English

lines.value: in hotter climates particularly in deserts despite the geographic barrier of limited water sources people have been able to extend their growing season in these regions by way of diverting water from other areas and using it in their agriculture
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ability to use these irrigation methods despite geographic challenges has made it possible to enjoy almost a year round growing season
lines.name: English

lines.value: in agriculture season extension is anything that allows a crop to be cultivated beyond its normal outdoor growing season
lines.name: English

lines.value: examples include greenhouses polytunnels row cover and cloches
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the united states and canada the growing season usually refers to the time between two dates the last frost in the spring and the first hard frost in the fall
lines.name: English

lines.value: specifically it is defined as the period of time between the average last date at which the overnight low temperature drops below in the spring and the average date at which the overnight low first drops down below in the fall
lines.name: English

lines.value: these average last and first frost dates have reportedly been occurring earlier and later respectively at a steady rate as observed over the last 30 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: as a result the overall observed length of the growing season in the united states has increased by about two weeks in the last 30 years
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the cooler areas of north america specifically the northern regions of the united states and canada the growing season is observed to be between april or may and goes through october
lines.name: English

lines.value: a longer season starts as early as february or march along the lower east coast from northern florida to south carolina along the gulf coast in south texas and southern louisiana and along the west coast from coastal oregon southward and can continue all the way through november or december
lines.name: English

lines.value: the longest growing season is found in central and south florida where many tropical fruits are grown year round
lines.name: English

lines.value: these rough timetables vary significantly for areas that are at higher elevations or close to the ocean
lines.name: English

lines.value: because several crops grown in the united states require a long period of growth growing season extension practices are commonly used as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: these include various row covering techniques such as using cold frames and garden fabric over crops
lines.name: English

lines.value: greenhouses are also a common practice to extend the season particularly in elevated regions that only enjoy 90-day growing seasons
lines.name: English

lines.value: in much of europe the growing season is defined as the average number of days a year with a 24-hour average temperature of at least 5 °c 6 °c is sometimes used
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is typically from april until october or november although this varies considerably with latitude and altitude
lines.name: English

lines.value: the growing season is almost year round in most of portugal and spain and may be only from june to september in northern finland and the higher alps
lines.name: English

lines.value: proximity to the gulf stream and other maritime mediations of temperature extremes can extend the season
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the united kingdom the growing season is defined as starting when the temperature on five consecutive days exceeds 5 °c and ends after five consecutive days of temperatures below 5 °c
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 1961 to 1990 average season length was
lines.name: English

lines.value: in some warm climates such as the subtropical savanna and sonoran deserts or in the drier mediterranean climates the growing season is limited by the availability of water with little growth in the dry season
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike in cooler climates where snow or soil freezing is a generally insurmountable obstacle to plant growth it is often possible to greatly extend the growing season in hot climates by irrigation using water from cooler and or wetter regions
lines.name: English

lines.value: this can in fact go so far as to allow year round growth in areas that without irrigation could only support xerophytic plants
lines.name: English

lines.value: also in these tropical regions the growing season can be interrupted by periods of heavy rainfall called the rainy season
lines.name: English

lines.value: for example in colombia where coffee is grown and can be harvested year round they don't see a rainy season
lines.name: English

lines.value: however in indonesia another large coffee producing area they experience this rainy season and the growth of the coffee beans is interrupted
lines.name: English

lines.value: hms brave was a type 22 frigate of the royal navy
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was built by yarrow shipbuilders ltd glasgow scotland and launched on 19 november 1983
lines.name: English

lines.value: brave was decommissioned on 23 march 1999 and was expended as a target in august 2004 by the submarine and frigate
lines.name: English

lines.value: brave cost some £250m to build and spent most of her first commission 1985-1987 as a trials ship
lines.name: English

lines.value: she achieved various firsts in her weapons and communications fit
lines.name: English

lines.value: thus from 1985 1987 brave had a number of civilian military contractors personnel embarked and commander coyote the seawolf trials mascot became a familiar figure on board
lines.name: English

lines.value: she had a reputation as a happy ship
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was not until the autumn of 1987 that she undertook basic operational sea training at portland and joined the fleet as a fully worked up unit and she became leader of the 9th frigate squadron
lines.name: English

lines.value: her programme from 1986 to 1987 included visits to lowestoft gibraltar funchal madeira porto london alongside hms belfast in december 1986 newcastle upon tyne alicante and torquay
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 1991 she was deployed to active service in the gulf war
lines.name: English

lines.value: whilst there she acted as the flagship for the senior naval officer middle east snomi commander of the sea based task force
lines.name: English

lines.value: her duties included providing anti missile defense for us aircraft carriers and battleships sonar tasks and mine watching
lines.name: English

lines.value: on a couple of occasions she came close to mines which had been dispatched by the iraq military
lines.name: English

lines.value: her main task during normal service was sonar patrols and between 1990 and 1992 carried out many successful patrols of the waters around the uk
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was at first affiliated to waveney district and the port of lowestoft suffolk this followed from the last ship of the name's second world war association with the suffolk town of beccles
lines.name: English

lines.value: other associations included the royal irish rangers the worshipful company of haberdashers the algerines association and sea cadet and combined cadet force units
lines.name: English

lines.value: she had also forged a liaison with the mohawk indians in canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: ts mohawk
lines.name: English

lines.value: her final affiliation was with the town of dover in 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: lumpsuckers or lumpfish are mostly small scorpaeniform marine fish of the family cyclopteridae
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are found in the cold waters of the arctic north atlantic and north pacific oceans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the greatest number of species are found in the north pacific
lines.name: English

lines.value: the roe of cyclopterus lumpus the lumpsucker or lumpfish to most europeans and people living along the east coast of the united states known as stenbider literally stone biter in danish is used extensively in scandinavian cuisine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the roe is also used as an affordable alternative to the caviar produced by sturgeons
lines.name: English

lines.value: the family name cyclopteridae derives from the greek words kukaos kyklos meaning circle and ntepue pteryx meaning wing or fin in reference to the circle shaped pectoral fins of most of the fish that comprise this family
lines.name: English

lines.value: lumpsuckers are named appropriately enough their portly bodies are nearly spherical with generally drab coloration and lithic patterns
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sucker part refers to the fish's modified pelvic fins which have evolved into adhesive discs located ventrally behind the pectoral fins the fish use these discs to adhere to the substrate
lines.name: English

lines.value: many species have bony wart like tubercles adorning the head and body these are important taxonomic features of the family
lines.name: English

lines.value: the simple rounded fins are small with the exception of the broad fan like pectorals which actually extend ventrally
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first of the two dorsal fins is spinous with 4-8 spines in some species this fin is completely overgrown with skin and therefore not visible
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the lateral line in lumpsuckers is otherwise reduced or absent it is well developed in the head some species even have tubular whisker like external projections of the opercular canal which is a part of the cranial lateral line system
lines.name: English

lines.value: the relatively small mouths of lumpsuckers are lined with narrow rows of small conical teeth
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gas bladder is absent
lines.name: English

lines.value: in terms of length lumpsuckers range in size from in the case of lethotremus awae up to more than in the case of the common lumpsucker cyclopterus lumpus
lines.name: English

lines.value: as their appearance might suggest lumpsuckers are poor swimmers
lines.name: English

lines.value: most species are benthic that is they spend most of their time on or near the bottom
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fish are found on rocky or muddy substrates where their colouration allows for effective camouflage
lines.name: English

lines.value: members of the family are found primarily on the continental shelf or slope at depths down to
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the deeper living species are however pelagic remaining some distance above the ocean floor
lines.name: English

lines.value: benthic species feed on sessile invertebrates such as polychaete worms crustaceans and mollusks
lines.name: English

lines.value: pelagic species target prey they are capable of overtaking namely slow moving jellyfish and ctenophores
lines.name: English

lines.value: lumpsuckers are a poorly studied group with little known of their behaviour and biology
lines.name: English

lines.value: at least some species are known to travel great distances in order to spawn in shallow intertidal waters from december to june in the smooth lumpsucker this may well be true of all species
lines.name: English

lines.value: males are also known to guard the brood of spherical eggs
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the peculiarities of lumpsuckers neural system is that they lack mauthner cell neurons in their hindbrain while these cells are present in virtually all other teleost fish
lines.name: English

lines.value: nevertheless the lumpsuckers do have a c startle response which is apparently mediated by other hindbrain cells
lines.name: English

lines.value: hatchlings have well developed pectoral fins and adhesive pelvic discs which the fish use to cling to rocks in shallow water
lines.name: English

lines.value: young fish remain in shallow warmer water until fully developed
lines.name: English

lines.value: pacific cod and sablefish are known predators of lumpsuckers
lines.name: English

lines.value: cyclopterus lumpus plays an important role in the icelandic fishing industry lotna ehf a fishing company partly owned by everton midfielder gylfi sigurdsson has recorded catches of lumpfish as large as 2 tonnes
lines.name: English

lines.value: other fish often caught on trawlers simultaneously with lumpfish include cod
lines.name: English

lines.value: lumpfish are also investigated in combating the effects of sea lice infections on salmon farming operations
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are about 30 species in seven genera
lines.name: English

lines.value: in chemistry a reaction mechanism is the step by step sequence of elementary reactions by which overall chemical change occurs
lines.name: English

lines.value: a chemical mechanism is a theoretical conjecture that tries to describe in detail what takes place at each stage of an overall chemical reaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: the detailed steps of a reaction are not observable in most cases
lines.name: English

lines.value: the conjectured mechanism is chosen because it is thermodynamically feasible and has experimental support in isolated intermediates see next section or other quantitative and qualitative characteristics of the reaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also describes each reactive intermediate activated complex and transition state and which bonds are broken and in what order and which bonds are formed and in what order
lines.name: English

lines.value: a complete mechanism must also explain the reason for the reactants and catalyst used the stereochemistry observed in reactants and products all products formed and the amount of each
lines.name: English

lines.value: the electron or arrow pushing method is often used in illustrating a reaction mechanism for example see the illustration of the mechanism for benzoin condensation in the following examples section
lines.name: English

lines.value: a reaction mechanism must also account for the order in which molecules react
lines.name: English

lines.value: often what appears to be a single step conversion is in fact a multistep reaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: reaction intermediates are chemical species often unstable and short lived however sometimes can be isolated which are not reactants or products of the overall chemical reaction but are temporary products and or reactants in the mechanism's reaction steps
lines.name: English

lines.value: reaction intermediates are often free radicals or ions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the kinetics relative rates of the reaction steps and the rate equation for the overall reaction are explained in terms of the energy needed for the conversion of the reactants to the proposed transition states molecular states that corresponds to maxima on the reaction coordinates and to saddle points on the potential energy surface for the reaction
lines.name: English

lines.value: information about the mechanism of a reaction is often provided by the use of chemical kinetics to determine the rate equation and the reaction order in each reactant
lines.name: English

lines.value: consider the following reaction for example :co + no 2 &rarr co 2 + no in this case experiments have determined that this reaction takes place according to the rate law
lines.name: English

lines.value: this form suggests that the rate determining step is a reaction between two molecules of no 2
lines.name: English

lines.value: a possible mechanism for the overall reaction that explains the rate law is when determining the overall rate law for a reaction the slowest step is the step that determines the reaction rate
lines.name: English

lines.value: because the first step in the above reaction is the slowest step it is the rate determining step
lines.name: English

lines.value: because it involves the collision of two no 2 molecules it is a bimolecular reaction with a rate law of
lines.name: English

lines.value: other reactions may have mechanisms of several consecutive steps
lines.name: English

lines.value: in organic chemistry the reaction mechanism for the benzoin condensation put forward in 1903 by a j lapworth was one of the first proposed reaction mechanisms
lines.name: English

lines.value: a chain reaction is an example of a complex mechanism in which the propagation steps form a closed cycle
lines.name: English

lines.value: many experiments that suggest the possible sequence of steps in a reaction mechanism have been designed including
lines.name: English

lines.value: a correct reaction mechanism is an important part of accurate predictive modeling
lines.name: English

lines.value: for many combustion and plasma systems detailed mechanisms are not available or require development
lines.name: English

lines.value: even when information is available identifying and assembling the relevant data from a variety of sources reconciling discrepant values and extrapolating to different conditions can be a difficult process without expert help
lines.name: English

lines.value: rate constants or thermochemical data are often not available in the literature so computational chemistry techniques or group additivity methods must be used to obtain the required parameters
lines.name: English

lines.value: computational chemistry methods can also be used to calculate potential energy surfaces for reactions and determine probable mechanisms
lines.name: English

lines.value: molecularity in chemistry is the number of colliding molecular entities that are involved in a single reaction step
lines.name: English

lines.value: lgwade,organic chemistry 7th ed,2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: * reaction mechanisms for combustion of hydrocarbons
lines.name: English

lines.value: down periscope is a 1996 american military comedy film from 20th century fox produced by robert lawrence directed by david s ward that stars kelsey grammer lauren holly and rob schneider
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film co stars bruce dern harry dean stanton william h macy and rip torn
lines.name: English

lines.value: lieutenant commander thomas dodge fights to save his naval career while also being saddled with a group of misfit seamen brought together as the crew of his first command the uss stingray a rusted and obsolete world war ii era diesel submarine recommissioned to participate in a special naval war game
lines.name: English

lines.value: lt commander thomas dodge kelsey grammer is about to be passed over a third time for his own nuclear submarine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the reasons given are 1 his unorthodox command methods 2 an unfortunate brushing incident with a russian submarine and 3 the rumor of a genital tattoo he acquired after getting blind drunk following that incident
lines.name: English

lines.value: failure to secure a submarine will result in dodge being dropped from the navy's command program
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his career tom dodge has made an enemy of rear admiral yancy graham bruce dern who strongly speaks out against dodge's promotion
lines.name: English

lines.value: vice admiral dean winslow comsublant rip torn likes dodge and his unorthodox methods
lines.name: English

lines.value: a war game is planned to test the navy's defenses against attack from older soviet diesel powered submarines in the hands of america's enemies
lines.name: English

lines.value: dodge is selected to put the world war ii era balao class diesel sub uss stingray ss-161 back in commission as the war game's opposing force
lines.name: English

lines.value: winslow tells him to think like a pirate promising dodge that if he can sink a target ship in norfolk harbor dodge will be considered for a command
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham handpicks a crew from hell for stingray hot tempered uptight lt martin pascal rob schneider as the executive officer crusty civilian naval contractor howard harry dean stanton as chief engineer rebellious engineman 1st class brad stepanek bradford tatum sharp eared sonarman 2nd class et sonar lovacelli harland williams compulsive gambler seaman stanley spots sylvesterson jonathan penner former college basketball player seaman jefferson r.j jackson duane martin shock addled electrician's mate nitro toby huss and not so culinary specialist second class buckman ken hudson campbell as stingray's cook
lines.name: English

lines.value: graham also selects lt emily lake lauren holly to serve as the sub's diving officer the only woman aboard
lines.name: English

lines.value: using unorthodox tactics and an atlantic storm dodge and his crew sneak into charleston harbor and set off signal flares
lines.name: English

lines.value: now desperate to defeat dodge graham reduces the war game containment area by half without winslow's authorization
lines.name: English

lines.value: failing to penetrate norfolk harbor dodge leaves the containment area and heads out to sea
lines.name: English

lines.value: irate at this lapse in protocol the strident by the book pascal attempts to take command of the stingray the crew does not support his action so dodge charges pascal with mutiny
lines.name: English

lines.value: wearing mock buccaneer outfits and talking like pirates dodge and crew force the blindfolded xo to walk the plank into the raised fishing net of a waiting trawler that will take him ashore
lines.name: English

lines.value: during stingrays second attempt at norfolk graham assumes personal control of the submarine uss orlando
lines.name: English

lines.value: dodge employs an incredibly dangerous maneuver to sneak past the ships and aircraft protecting norfolk
lines.name: English

lines.value: orlando is able to locate and chase her down
lines.name: English

lines.value: before the orlandos shooting solution is obtained dodge is able to fire two live torpedoes at 900 yards into the anchored target ship at norfolk winning the war game for stingray
lines.name: English

lines.value: returning to port graham is chastised by admiral winslow and denied his promotion
lines.name: English

lines.value: winslow informs dodge that he will not get his own los angeles class submarine as previously discussed but a new seawolf class submarine the us navy's most advanced attack submarines plus a proper crew
lines.name: English

lines.value: dodge respectfully requests that his entire stingray crew be transferred with him
lines.name: English

lines.value: he then dismisses his crew to begin a well earned shore leave
lines.name: English

lines.value: as dodge and lake leave the dock she poses a query now that they know each other what exactly is this tattoo i keep hearing about
lines.name: English

lines.value: the name of the film is a play on the title of the 1959 world war ii drama up periscope and spoofs several titles in the submarine film subgenre including cold war drama the hunt for red october
lines.name: English

lines.value: down periscope began shooting on may 6 1995 and finished on july 27 a from world war ii now a museum ship and memorial in san francisco played the part of the uss stingray
lines.name: English

lines.value: the nearby suisun bay reserve fleet played the part of naval station norfolk
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film makes use of both standard us navy stock footage as well as scenes shot specifically for the film
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scenes of the fictional uss orlando were taken of the home ported at the new london submarine base in groton connecticut during a one day vip cruise for the christening committee of the
lines.name: English

lines.value: the target ship that is torpedoed and sunk ending the film's war game is both naval stock footage of the and a prop shooting miniature
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fletcher is one of the most decorated ships in us navy history
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the closing credits a music video is shown of the village people and the film's cast performing in the navy aboard the stingray
lines.name: English

lines.value: down periscope had its us theatrical release on march 1 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film grossed $25785603 domestically and $37553752 worldwide it currently sits at the position of 2871 for all time domestic gross
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film was released five months later on home video on august 6 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: critical reception for the film was generally negative
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the film review aggregator website rotten tomatoes the film carries a score 3.8/10 rotten from 33 reviews the audience score 61% liked it
lines.name: English

lines.value: the film carries an average audience rating of 2.8/5
lines.name: English

lines.value: stephen holden of the new york times felt the tone of the acting which is set by mr grammer's blandly laid back performance is all wrong for a genre that demands over the top hamming
lines.name: English

lines.value: holden furthermore notes that the film does manage to provide a couple of amusing bits but the energy level of down periscope is so low that moments like these which should flare hilariously reach a wan flicker

lines.value: the former yan (; 337-370 was a state of xianbei ethnicity during the era of sixteen kingdoms in china
lines.name: English

lines.value: initially murong huang and his son murong jun claimed the jin dynasty 265-420)-created title prince of yan but subsequently in 352 after seizing most of the former later zhao territory murong jun would declare himself emperor and after that point the rulers of the former yan declared themselves emperors
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the winter of 342 the xianbei of former yan ruled by the murong clan attacked and destroyed goguryeo's capital hwando capturing 50000 goguryeo men and women to use as slave labor in addition to taking the queen mother and queen prisoner and forced king gogukwon to flee for a while
lines.name: English

lines.value: the xianbei also devastated buyeo in 346 accelerating buyeo migration to the korean peninsula.<ref name="tennant"> their capital was yan beijing in 350 then yecheng in 357 and finally luoyang in 364
