lines.value: theresa anne villiers pronounced villers born 5 march 1968 is a british conservative party politician
lines.name: English

lines.value: she was first elected as the member of parliament mp for chipping barnet in 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers was the secretary of state for northern ireland from 2012 to 2016
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers was born in lambeth in 1968 the third child of major george edward villiers by his marriage to anne virginia threlfall she has two elder brothers edward and henry
lines.name: English

lines.value: on her father's side she is a descendant of edward ernest villiers 1806-1843 brother of george villiers 4th earl of clarendon thomas hyde villiers charles pelham villiers henry montagu villiers and a direct descendant of edward ii
lines.name: English

lines.value: growing up in north london she was educated at the independent francis holland school
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers gained a bachelor of laws llb degree with first class honours in 1990 from the university of bristol and a year later the postgraduate degree of bachelor of civil law bcl from jesus college oxford
lines.name: English

lines.value: after university she qualified for the bar at the inner temple and worked as a lecturer at king's college london from 1994 until 1999
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers was elected as a member of the european parliament mep for the london constituency in 1999 and was reelected in 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: she stood down after the 2005 general election when she was elected as the member of parliament uk mp for chipping barnet
lines.name: English

lines.value: as an mep her main interests were finance and financial services the preservation of london's green belt cyprus animal welfare and campaigning against the euro and the european constitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: she served as deputy leader of the conservatives in the european parliament between 2001 and 2002
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also served as a member of the governing board of the conservative party during this period
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2003 following sir sydney chapman's announcement that he would retire at the following election villiers was selected as the conservative prospective parliamentary candidate for chipping barnet
lines.name: English

lines.value: although chapman's majority at the 2001 general election had only been 2701 votes the party viewed chipping barnet to be quite a safe conservative seat and villiers held it at the 2005 general election with an increased majority of 5960 votes which she increased again to 11927 in 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon her election to the house of commons she resigned from her seat in the european parliament it went to syed kamall the next candidate on the conservatives regional list for london
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers now lives at arkley in her constituency and formerly lived at hillsborough castle
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers was sworn of the privy council on 9 june 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: in december 2005 following the election of david cameron as conservative party leader villiers was promoted to the shadow cabinet after just seven months in parliament as shadow chief secretary to the treasury
lines.name: English

lines.value: in july 2007 cameron promoted her to shadow secretary of state for transport
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the 2010 general election the conservatives short of an overall majority formed a coalition government with the liberal democrats
lines.name: English

lines.value: this required positions in cabinet to be awarded to lib dem mps so villiers did not become secretary of state for transport as might have been expected in the event of a majority conservative government taking office
lines.name: English

lines.value: that role went instead to philip hammond who had shadowed the post of chief secretary to the treasury
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers instead became a minister of state at the department for transport
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers was appointed secretary of state for northern ireland in september 2012 but continued to spend three days a week in her north london constituency of chipping barnet
lines.name: English

lines.value: her time in northern ireland was perceived negatively
lines.name: English

lines.value: she made a speech in february 2016 defending the royal ulster constabulary and the british army which had been accused of colluding with loyalist murderers in the loughinisland massacre
lines.name: English

lines.value: the police ombudsman who investigated the murders dr michael maguire later stated with regard to law enforcement authorities colluding with the murderers i have no hesitation in unambiguously determining that collusion is a significant feature of the loughinisland murders
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers had said that a pernicious counter narrative of the troubles was emerging whereby responsibility for acts of terrorism was being shifted onto the security forces through allegations of collusion misuse of agents and informers or other forms of unlawful activity
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers was one of the six cabinet ministers who came out in support of brexit during the eu referendum
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the nationwide vote to leave the eu both her constituency chipping barnet and area of cabinet responsibility northern ireland had majorities voting overwhelmingly to remain
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the referendum on 14 july 2016 villiers resigned from her position as northern ireland secretary after explaining that new prime minister theresa may had offered her a post outside the cabinet which was not one which i felt i could take on
lines.name: English

lines.value: the daily telegraph reported on 11 may 2009 that theresa villiers had bought a property in kennington london for £345000
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2007-08 she claimed a total of £18181 in parliamentary allowances for a second home
lines.name: English

lines.value: she also has a house in arkley in her north london constituency of chipping barnet
lines.name: English

lines.value: the house a semi detached property that she bought for £296500 in may 2004 is an eight minute drive away from high barnet tube station from which commuters can reach westminster in about forty five minutes
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers supported the temporary suspension of ken livingstone then mayor of london by the adjudication panel for england which examined the case after a complaint from the board of deputies of british jews to the standards board for england
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers is a member of conservative friends of israel
lines.name: English

lines.value: since late september 2008 villiers has dedicated a considerable proportion of her public announcements to aviation policy specifically the [[list of airports in the united kingdom and the british crown dependencies#airports in england|expansion of airports in the south east of england]]
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers underlined that despite differences of opinion the coalition government's policy was opposed to a third runway
lines.name: English

lines.value: she has also spoken out against boris johnson's favoured proposal for a new london airport to be built in the thames estuary and alternative expansions at gatwick and stansted airports arguing that airlines should make greater use of the uk's regional airports though some regional airports themselves have expressed concern about being adversely affected by capacity shortages in the south east
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers favours construction of a high speed rail link from london to birmingham and manchester arguing that flyers could use capacity at airports such as birmingham international and manchester international airport
lines.name: English

lines.value: in november 2016 villiers was one of several conservative mps who signed a letter to theresa may demanding a hard brexit i.e withdrawal from both the single market and the customs union
lines.name: English

lines.value: in may 2017 villiers announced that she fundamentally supports the ban on hunting of wild animals with dogs but suggested that there remains scope for reform of the hunting act 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: villiers married fellow barrister sean wilken in 1997 and the following year they co wrote a book on matters of contract and quasi contract law which was published by a major publishing house
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are now divorced
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bio bio region (; ), is one of chile's fifteen first order administrative divisions it is divided into four provinces arauco bio bio concepcion and nuble
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is also known by its original denomination viii region
lines.name: English

lines.value: concepcion is the capital and largest city
lines.name: English

lines.value: other important cities include chillan coronel hualpen los angeles and talcahuano
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region of the bio bio is bordered on the west by the pacific ocean on the east by argentina on the north by the chilean region of maule and on the south by the chilean region of araucania
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region has been hit by many chilean earthquakes including the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in 1960 and the great earthquake of 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: many communities in the region were greatly affected by the earthquake of 2010 and the subsequent tsunami
lines.name: English

lines.value: that earthquake damaged talcahuano and dichato the tsunami destroyed much of what remained of the port town
lines.name: English

lines.value: this region has played a distinguished role in the history and culture of chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: many patriots who fought for independence presidents politicians and artists like pianist claudio arrau and folklorist violeta parra were born here
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is an inland valley between the cities of concepcion and los angeles and it felt the greatest impact of the earthquake of 27 february 2010
lines.name: English

lines.value: the department of rere was a vital settlement area of chileans and the three hundred year struggle until the 1870s to defeat the strong indigenous tribe of the mapuches
lines.name: English

lines.value: chilean settlers of spanish california from the present region of the bio bio especially from concepcion talcahuano los angeles santa barbara and the department of rere may have played a part in the establishment of los angeles california and the rest of southern california in the period between 1775 and 1820
lines.name: English

lines.value: thousands of chilean miners ranchers and shopkeepers from the bio bio region are thought to have settled the coasts mountains and valleys of what became american california both before and after the mexican american war and to have helped create the cities of san francisco san jose santa barbara and san diego california
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to data from the 2017 census the region of the bio bio with 2018803 inhabitants is the second most populous region of chile after the metropolitan region of santiago
lines.name: English

lines.value: in connection with the 1992 census reflecting a total population of 1734305 inhabitants there was a population growth of 7.3% in 10 years 1992-2002 the second lowest nationally after the region magallanes and chilean antarctica
lines.name: English

lines.value: taking into account their 37062.6 km ² in area was in 2002 a density of 50.23 inhabitants per km² the third highest nationally
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 2002 census showed an urban population of 1528306 inhabitants corresponding to 82.1% of regional population and a rural population of 333256 inhabitants equivalent to 17.9% of the population of the region
lines.name: English

lines.value: of the 1861562 inhabitants of the region of bio bio in 2002 915200 49.16% were men and 946362 50.84% were women
lines.name: English

lines.value: the metropolitan area of concepcion is one of the most populated conurbations in the country with a population of 979937 inhabitants corresponding to the sum of the population of the ten districts of greater concepcion concepcion 216061 inhabitants talcahuano 250348 hualpen 88046 san pedro de la paz 80447 chiguayante 81302 colonel 95528 lota 49089 penco 46016 tome 52440 and hualqui 20660
lines.name: English

lines.value: another of the most populated cities in the region are chillan with 165528 inhabitants is the tenth most populous urban area in the country and is a conurbation with a portion of its population living in urban areas of the town of chillan 146701 inhabitants and another that lives in the urban area of the town of chillan viejo 1,.827 inhabitants and los angeles with its 166556 inhabitants is the eighteenth most populous urban area in the country
lines.name: English

lines.value: with regard to the province of nuble besides the city of chillan other important cities are san carlos with 29359 inhabitants bulnes with 10681 inhabitants and yungay with 9288 inhabitants all of these located in the intermediate depression and coelemu with 9845 inhabitants located in the cordillera de la costa near the rio itata
lines.name: English

lines.value: with regard to the province of bio bio in addition to los angeles other major cities are mulchen with 21819 inhabitants birth to 20884 inhabitants the conurbation la laja san rosendo with a total population of 19537 inhabitants with 11947 inhabitants in cabrero
lines.name: English

lines.value: with regard to the province of arauco the most populated cities are curanilahue with 30126 inhabitants lebu the provincial capital with 20838 inhabitants with 19839 inhabitants canete arauco with 16291 inhabitants and los alamos with 13035 inhabitants
lines.name: English

lines.value: with regard to membership or indigenous native peoples 52918 people declared in the census of 2002 as mapuche this is a 2.84% of regional population and used the relationship p(aternal = female amerindian to determine the racial classification of persons identified as mapuche
lines.name: English

lines.value: the communes of the bio bio region are
lines.name: English

lines.value: along with araucania maule and o'higgins regions bio bio's population is believed to be a remarkably homogeneous culture but is of various ethnic and racial backgrounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: about 53% habitants are of european origin primarily of spanish german french and other european communities
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mestizos make up 44% of the population and are the result of mixing between europeans and amerindians while amerindian population is 3% mainly mapuche
lines.name: English

lines.value: there is a romantic symbol of chilenidad huaso or cowboy/ shepherd culture typical of chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: large numbers of andalusian asturian basque galician leonese murcian navarrese and valencian nationalities other than the castilian spanish established the nation and culture and gave the spanish language to chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: small waves of non spanish settlement of the region include germans from germany austria and switzerland french and italians whom contributed to the regional wine industry british people like english and scottish have densely settled concepcion on the coast dutch greek and portuguese founded the oceanic fishing industry arab peoples like the lebanese and palestinians established several small businesses and small scattering of us americans scandinavians and eastern europeans mostly from the former soviet union czechoslovakia and yugoslavia especially croats established themselves in chile as they fled political turmoil
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to a 2002 census 58.63% of the inhabitants of the bio bio region profess catholicism equivalent to 805517 people the third largest concentration of catholics in a region in chile while the lowest percentage of catholics corresponding to a region nationwide
lines.name: English

lines.value: 28.36% declare themselves as protestant or evangelical equivalent to 389632 people the second largest concentration of protestants in a region while the highest percentage of evangelicals corresponding to a region nationwide
lines.name: English

lines.value: the province of arauco is the only province to national level in which the number of evangelicals corresponding to 47.47% of the population is greater than that of catholics corresponding to 36.33% of the population
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a result of protestant lutheran and calvinist jehovah's witnesses seventh day adventist and mormon missionary work in arauco during the 20th century
lines.name: English

lines.value: bio bio tends to show a more culturally conservative attitude in contrast to the urban areas of santiago/valparaiso which have a more liberal cosmopolitan position
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is more common for residents to attend church regularly be it catholic or protestant
lines.name: English

lines.value: for decades the characteristic feature of the bio bio region has been its manufacturing industry which contributes 35.6% of its gdp and operates mainly around the ports of talcahuano san vicente lirquen and coronel the greatest concentration of ports in chile
lines.name: English

lines.value: the range of activities is broad extending from iron and steel making to foodstuffs manufacture petrochemicals metalworking oil refining and shipyards
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region's dynamism is also rooted in its large rivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the important hydroelectric power complex on the laja river is composed of the el toro abanico and antuco power plants and the pangue and ralco plants on the upper bio bio river
lines.name: English

lines.value: these facilities supply 26.6% of the energy used from taltal in the north to chiloe archipelago to the south
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region contains almost 44% of chile's forest plantations of which around 82% are radiata pine
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the largest exporter of forestry products and supplies raw materials for pulp and paper plants sawmills and related activities
lines.name: English

lines.value: the fishing industry is another dynamic sector
lines.name: English

lines.value: the region possesses 32% of the country's total fishing fleet while approximately 50% of the national catch is unloaded at its ports
lines.name: English

lines.value: moreover this region alone is responsible for 4% of the world's catch of seafood
lines.name: English

lines.value: main items include shellfish and conger eel sardines anchovy mackerel hake mollusks crustaceans and algae
lines.name: English

lines.value: high quality fertile soils support a wide variety of crops principally produce grains vegetables artificial and improved pastures
lines.name: English

lines.value: animal husbandry focuses on production of beef milk and dairy products
lines.name: English

lines.value: mining activity includes non metallic minerals principally quartz for the glass and steel industries
lines.name: English

lines.value: * official website of the regional government of bio bio
lines.name: English

lines.value: filthy rich & catflap is a bbc sitcom produced in 1986 and broadcast in 1987
lines.name: English

lines.value: the series featured former the young ones co stars nigel planer rik mayall and adrian edmondson as its three title characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was written by ben elton with additional material credited to mayall and produced and directed by paul jackson who also directed the young ones with film sequences directed by ed bye
lines.name: English

lines.value: the show's music was written by peter brewis
lines.name: English

lines.value: one series consisting of six half hour episodes was produced
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite the continuity announcer saying that the show would return the following year only one series was ever made
lines.name: English

lines.value: the series enjoyed a resurgence of interest in 2004 when it was officially released on dvd by independent dvd production company playback
lines.name: English

lines.value: the vhs and dvd versions were cut for musical rights
lines.name: English

lines.value: these included richie singing where is love morning has broken and consider yourself and eddie singing roxanne you've got to pick a pocket or two and message in a bottle
lines.name: English

lines.value: a 25th-anniversary dvd was released in 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the run of the series richie kills several milkmen eddie blackmails richie with a paternity suit scam ralph gets sent to prison and hanged richie is blackmailed by the nolan sisters they spoof newspaper tycoon rupert murdoch and feature bodyguards wearing federation stormtrooper uniforms that previously featured in the sci fi show blake's 7
lines.name: English

lines.value: richie appeared as a guest on a panel game called ooer
lines.name: English

lines.value: sounds a bit rude
lines.name: English

lines.value: which bore more than a passing resemblance to the bbc quiz show blankety blank
lines.name: English

lines.value: richie finally becomes famous by slandering everyone in showbiz and becoming the only person censors deem clean enough to host every show on television precisely everybody from the a list names down to the entire cast of grange hill
lines.name: English

lines.value: this leads to a memorable song and dance routine from richie celebrating the fact that in his words he's made it as well as the nolans other people appearing as themselves include midge ure and anne diamond then an anchor woman for breakfast tv station tv am it was rare then for the bbc to mention rival channels
lines.name: English

lines.value: the show also features cameos by barbara windsor lynda bellingham jools holland and a then unknown david baddiel
lines.name: English

lines.value: contemporaries from the alternative comedy scene who also appeared include stephen fry hugh laurie helen lederer gareth hale norman pace arthur smith the first milkman to be murdered mel smith playing the fictional head of light entertainment at the bbc jumbo whiffy chris barrie lee cornes andy de la tour john bird and harry enfield
lines.name: English

lines.value: most of these guests have previously appeared in the young ones
lines.name: English

lines.value: us route 177 is a spur of us route 77
lines.name: English

lines.value: it currently runs for 233 miles 375 km from south haven kansas at us 81 to madill oklahoma at us 70
lines.name: English

lines.value: it passes through the states of kansas and oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177 begins concurrent with state highway 199 at the us 70 junction near madill oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: from this point it heads northwest serving as the southern terminus of state highway 1 and the main street of mannsville
lines.name: English

lines.value: the route turns northward in dickson where it splits from sh 199
lines.name: English

lines.value: east of gene autry it is the eastern end of sh 53
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177 then runs through the chickasaw national recreation area and the town of sulphur where it has a brief concurrency with sh 7
lines.name: English

lines.value: on the north side of sulphur lies a partial interchange with the chickasaw turnpike
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177 continues north into western garvin county serving as the eastern terminus of sh 29 and crossing sh 19 in stratford
lines.name: English

lines.value: the route then cuts across the narrow eastern tip of mcclain county where it begins concurrencies with both state highway 59 and state highway 3w
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three highways then cross the canadian river into pottawatomie county where they meet sh 39 at a four way stop in asher
lines.name: English

lines.value: near unincorporated pearson sh 59 splits off to the east
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177/sh 3w continue north to tecumseh where they have an interchange with sh 9
lines.name: English

lines.value: at this interchange us 270 joins the concurrency
lines.name: English

lines.value: the three highways run along the west side of shawnee
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the interstate 40 interchange sh 3w reunites with sh 3e and the unified sh 3 along with us 270 follows i 40
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177 continues northward alone
lines.name: English

lines.value: after crossing into lincoln county us 177 meets us 62 in jacktown
lines.name: English

lines.value: just west of warwick it meets sh 66 old route 66 and then passes under interstate 44 the turner turnpike with no interchange
lines.name: English

lines.value: i 44 is accessed through the sh 66 - wellston exit 157 interchange
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177 then continues north connecting to the town of carney via sh 40a the shortest state highway in oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: west of tryon it intersects state highway 105
lines.name: English

lines.value: it then enters payne county just south of the cimarron river
lines.name: English

lines.value: in payne county us 177 almost immediately passes through the town of perkins
lines.name: English

lines.value: north of that community it has a one mile 1.6 km concurrency with state highway 33
lines.name: English

lines.value: it then passes through the county seat stillwater the home of oklahoma state university
lines.name: English

lines.value: there it intersects sh 51
lines.name: English

lines.value: north of stillwater it serves as the western terminus of the cimarron turnpike spur
lines.name: English

lines.value: farther north in noble county it crosses us highway 64 and the mainline of the cimarron turnpike
lines.name: English

lines.value: it then has a four mile 6.4 km concurrency with state highway 15
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177 then enters its final county in oklahoma kay county
lines.name: English

lines.value: it serves ponca city where it begins a wrong way concurrency with its parent us 77 as well as us 60 which is signed the correct direction
lines.name: English

lines.value: the routes split near tonkawa
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177 then runs through blackwell and braman
lines.name: English

lines.value: north of braman the route is the northernmost exit on interstate 35 in oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: six miles 9.7 km after the i 35 junction us 177 leaves oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: us 177 then enters sumner county kansas near hunnewell
lines.name: English

lines.value: only 4 mi 6.4 km north of the state line us 177 ends at us 81 in downtown south haven kansas
lines.name: English

lines.value: the terminus is less than a mile from the western terminus of us route 166 also on us 81 north of town
lines.name: English

lines.value: originally the highway functioned as a shortcut for wichita to oklahoma city traffic traveling between us 81 at south haven ks and us 77 at three sands jct oklahoma where us 77 and state highway 156 intersect outside marland oklahoma today
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the 1960s the highway was extended south to madill oklahoma replacing the entire length of state highway 40 from ponca city oklahoma to then us highway 66 near wellston oklahoma and the portion of state highway 18 between shawnee oklahoma and madill oklahoma the segment between us 66 and shawnee was constructed at this time
lines.name: English

lines.value: vestiages of these highways remain in spur routes state highway 40a located entirely in carney oklahoma and state highway 18a located south of sulphur oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: during this extension the alignments of us 77 and us 177 were altered in north central oklahoma as follows us 77 was relocated to run north from three sands jct to tonkawa oklahoma on the former route of us 177 then east on us 60 to ponca city oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: this also involved a new us 60 alignment between tonkawa oklahoma and ponca city oklahoma where us 60 us 77 and us 177 all overlap on the same highway which results in northbound us 77 eastbound us 60 and southbound us highway 177 traffic running in the same compass direction east
lines.name: English

lines.value: state highway 40a is an highway in lincoln county oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is numbered after state highway 40 the predecessor to us 177
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is the shortest state highway in oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: the highway connects us 177 to the town of carney oklahoma
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has a 25 mph 40 km h speed limit
lines.name: English

lines.value: the grammy award for best male rap solo performance was an honor presented to male recording artists at the 45th grammy awards in 2003 and the 46th grammy awards in 2004 for quality rap solo performances
lines.name: English

lines.value: the grammy awards an annual ceremony that was established in 1958 and originally called the gramophone awards are presented by the national academy of recording arts and sciences of the united states to honor artistic achievement technical proficiency and overall excellence in the recording industry without regard to album sales or chart position
lines.name: English

lines.value: starting in 1991 the academy began to honor individual rap performances with the best rap solo performance category
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2003 the category was divided by gender with the introduction of the female to accompany the award for male rap solo performances
lines.name: English

lines.value: the categories remained separated by gender until 2005 when they were combined into the genderless category originally known as best rap solo performance
lines.name: English

lines.value: american singers nelly and eminem received the awards for best male rap solo performance
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1991 the academy began to honor individual rap performances with the best rap solo performance category
lines.name: English

lines.value: the category name remained unchanged until 2004 when it was split into separate categories for female and male rap solo performances
lines.name: English

lines.value: the categories remained separated by gender for one additional year
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2005 they were merged into the genderless category originally known as best rap solo performance
lines.name: English

lines.value: female rapper mc lyte has campaigned for the reinstatement of the female specific category and believes that it destroys [hip-hop] culture to not have the perspective of a woman
lines.name: English

lines.value: bill freimuth recording academy vice president of awards claimed that the category was eliminated because [there] wasn't enough competition essentially due to the lack of the number of releases in that category black entertainment television bet executive stephen hill cited a similar reason for the elimination of the female categories by the bet hip hop awards and vh1's hip hop honors reflecting a lack of female representation in the hip hop music scene for several years
lines.name: English

lines.value: as of 2011 the category name has not changed since 2005
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the 45th grammy awards 2003 best male rap solo performance nominees included eminem for without me jay z for song cry ludacris for rollout my business mystikal for bouncing back bumping me against the wall and nelly for hot in herre
lines.name: English

lines.value: additionally eminem was nominated for record of the year and best short form music video for without me as well as album of the year and best rap album for the eminem show
lines.name: English

lines.value: ludacris word of mouf and mystikal's tarantula were also nominated for best rap album
lines.name: English

lines.value: nelly also earned nominations for album of the year and best rap album for the album nellyville as well as record of the year and best rap/sung collaboration for the song dilemma featuring kelly rowland for a total five
lines.name: English

lines.value: regarding his nominations nelly commented it's always good to be nominated especially for something as big as the grammys
lines.name: English

lines.value: just the recognition itself is an award
lines.name: English

lines.value: but you want that little gold record player
lines.name: English

lines.value: you just want to take it home the award for best male rap solo performance was presented to nelly at madison square garden in new york city though not broadcast on television
lines.name: English

lines.value: his performances of hot in herre and dilemma alongside rowland at the awards ceremony included pyrotechnics
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition nelly received the grammy award for best rap/sung collaboration
lines.name: English

lines.value: nominees for the 46th grammy awards included 50 cent for in da club joe budden for pump it up eminem for lose yourself ludacris for stand up and sean paul for get busy
lines.name: English

lines.value: 50 cent's other nominations included best new artist and best rap performance by a duo or group with lil kim best rap album for get rich or die trying and best rap song for in da club for a total of five
lines.name: English

lines.value: lose yourself also earned eminem nominations for record of the year song of the year best rap song and [[grammy award for best song written for a motion picture television or other visual media|best song written for a motion picture television or other visual media]]
lines.name: English

lines.value: ludacris was also nominated for best rap performance by a duo or group for gossip folks with missy elliott while paul was nominated for best new artist and received the award for best reggae album for dutty rock
lines.name: English

lines.value: the award was presented to eminem who also received the award for best rap song
lines.name: English

lines.value: lose yourself also earned eminem an academy award for best original song marking the first rap song to receive the honor
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2004 the american film institute included the song at no
lines.name: English

lines.value: 93 on their list of america's greatest music in the movies list and rolling stone ranked the song no
lines.name: English

lines.value: 166 on their list of the 500 greatest songs of all time
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to the separate female and male categories eminem received the award for best rap solo performance in 2000 for my name is and in 2001 for the real slim shady
lines.name: English

lines.value: nelly earned nominations in 2001 for country grammar hot shit and in 2002 for ride wit me
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the return to the genderless category eminem earned nominations in 2005 for just lose it in 2006 for mockingbird and in 2010 for beautiful
lines.name: English

lines.value: eminem was presented the award for best rap solo performance in 2011 for not afraid
lines.name: English

lines.value: swing low sweet chariot is an american negro spiritual
lines.name: English

lines.value: the earliest known recording was in 1909 by the fisk jubilee singers of fisk university
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2002 the library of congress honored the song as one of 50 recordings chosen that year to be added to the national recording registry
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was also included in the list of songs of the century by the recording industry association of america and the national endowment for the arts
lines.name: English

lines.value: swing low sweet chariot may have been written by wallis willis a choctaw freedman in the old indian territory in what is now choctaw county near the county seat of hugo oklahoma sometime after 1865
lines.name: English

lines.value: he may have been inspired by the red river which reminded him of the jordan river and of the prophet elijah's being taken to heaven by a chariot 2 kings 2:11
lines.name: English

lines.value: some sources claim that this song and steal away also sung by willis had lyrics that referred to the underground railroad the freedom movement that helped black people escape from southern slavery to the north and canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: alexander reid a minister at the old spencer academy a choctaw boarding school heard willis singing these two songs and transcribed the words and melodies
lines.name: English

lines.value: he sent the music to the jubilee singers of fisk university in nashville tennessee
lines.name: English

lines.value: the jubilee singers popularized the songs during a tour of the united states and europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song enjoyed a resurgence during the 1960s civil rights struggle and the folk revival it was performed by a number of artists
lines.name: English

lines.value: perhaps the most famous performance during this period was that by joan baez during the legendary 1969 woodstock festival
lines.name: English

lines.value: oklahoma state senator judy eason mcintyre from tulsa proposed a bill nominating swing low sweet chariot as the oklahoma state official gospel song in 2011
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bill was co sponsored by the oklahoma state black congressional caucus
lines.name: English

lines.value: oklahoma governor mary fallin signed the bill into law on may 5 2011 at a ceremony at the oklahoma cowboy hall of fame making the song the official oklahoma state gospel song
lines.name: English

lines.value: chorus chorus chorus 3&times
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song has frequently been used in films and television
lines.name: English

lines.value: a popular early recording was by the fisk university jubilee quartet for victor records no
lines.name: English

lines.value: swing low sweet chariot has been sung by rugby players and fans for some decades and there are associated gestures sometimes used in a drinking game which requires those who wrongly perform the gestures to buy a round of drinks
lines.name: English

lines.value: it became associated with the english national side in particular in 1988
lines.name: English

lines.value: coming into the last match of the 1988 season against ireland at twickenham england had lost 15 of their previous 23 matches in the five nations championship
lines.name: English

lines.value: the twickenham crowd had only seen one solitary england try in the previous two years and at half time against ireland they were 0 3 down
lines.name: English

lines.value: however during the second half england scored six tries to give them a 35 3 win
lines.name: English

lines.value: three of the tries came in quick succession from black player chris oti making his twickenham debut
lines.name: English

lines.value: a group of boys from the benedictine school douai following a tradition at their school games sang swing low sweet chariot whenever a try was scored
lines.name: English

lines.value: when oti scored his second try amused spectators standing close to the boys joined in and when oti scored his hat trick the song was heard around the ground
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song is still regularly sung at matches by english supporters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the england national rugby union team returned from the 2003 rugby world cup triumph in australia on a plane dubbed sweet chariot
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song became the england rugby world cup theme for 1991 when performed by union featuring the england world cup squad

lines.value: it reached number 16 on the uk singles chart

lines.value: the song was then covered in 1995 for that year's tournament by british reggae duo china black together with south african male choral group ladysmith black mambazo
lines.name: English

lines.value: it reached number 15 on the chart selling 200000 copies
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1999's tournament featured russell watson record a version which had less success only peaking at number 38 on the uk chart
lines.name: English

lines.value: the song enjoyed more success in 2003's tournament but included the album homegrown when recorded by ub40 and the united colours of sound
lines.name: English

lines.value: it originally peaked at number 23 but following england's victory in the tournament returned to reach number 15
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the wake of the tournament ub40 performed the song at a concert at the nec arena birmingham that was attended by england rugby fans and captain martin johnson

lines.value: a new version was recorded by blake for the 2007 rugby world cup

lines.value: for 2011 rugby world cup in new zealand popular all girl group our lady muse o.l.m released an england rugby world cup song

lines.value: an upbeat party anthem version of swing low sweet chariot - the song was premiered at the polo rocks concert in aid of the prince's trust

lines.value: english singer ella eyre released a cover version of the song on 7 september 2015 as a digital download in association with england rugby to coincide with the 2015 rugby world cup with the song raising money for england rugby's all schools programme

lines.value: it's inspiring to see the levels of support for the players and we're raising money for a great cause

lines.value: fere-en-tardenois is a commune in the aisne department in hauts de france in northern france

lines.value: it was the birthplace of camille claudel 1864-1943 sculptor and graphic artist

lines.value: the chateau de fere-en-tardenois dates originally from 1206 with later important renaissance altertions

lines.value: the oise aisne american cemetery and memorial is one and a half miles east of fere-en-tardenois

lines.value: it contains the graves of 6012 american soldiers who died while fighting in this vicinity during world war i including the poet joyce kilmer and until 1987 eddie slovik a deserter and the first american soldier to be executed for desertion since the american civil war

lines.value: the farmington river is a river in length along its main stem which is located in northwest connecticut with major tributaries extending into southwest massachusetts
lines.name: English

lines.value: via its longest branch the west branch the farmington's length increases to making it the connecticut river's longest tributary by a mere over the major river directly to its north the westfield river
lines.name: English

lines.value: the farmington river's watershed covers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the river historically played an important role in small scale manufacturing in towns along its course but it is now mainly used for recreation and drinking water
lines.name: English

lines.value: the farmington river watershed association is a non profit organization for conservation and preservation of this river
lines.name: English

lines.value: headwaters for both main branches of the farmington river referred to as the east branch and west branch are found in southwestern massachusetts though only the west branch officially begins north of the connecticut border
lines.name: English

lines.value: the west branch rises at the outlet of hayden pond in otis massachusetts
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1994 a stretch of the branch was designated a national wild and scenic river
lines.name: English

lines.value: the east branch begins in hartland connecticut at the confluence of pond hubbard and valley brooks
lines.name: English

lines.value: however this branch has been impounded along the first 11 miles of its course to form the barkhamsted reservoir and lake mcdonough it does not assume a particularly river like appearance until it exits lake mcdonough in new hartford connecticut
lines.name: English

lines.value: the east branch and west branch join in new hartford connecticut just about one mile south of lake mcdonough
lines.name: English

lines.value: upper reaches of the river flow mostly southward but the river turns northward in farmington connecticut and then runs mostly north and east until it flows into the connecticut river near the loomis chaffee school in windsor connecticut
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are several whitewater sections
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of these the so called upper farmington section of the west branch in new boston massachusetts is about 7 miles 11 km long
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is class 2 through farm and woods scenery to an iron bridge where kayak and canoe slalom races are held
lines.name: English

lines.value: below the bridge the river becomes class 3-4 very technical at low water and technical and pushy at higher water with a short gorge with several abrupt drops
lines.name: English

lines.value: the biggest of these is about four feet at decoration rock
lines.name: English

lines.value: below the river continues fast and technical with many rocks and constant maneuvering required
lines.name: English

lines.value: the river is continuously rapid leading through larger drops at battering ram rapid and corkscrew
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually it flattens to class 2 until a final ledge rapid at bear's den just above the reservoir
lines.name: English

lines.value: the upper farmington is barely runnable very scratchy with many exposed rocks and pinning possibilities during fall dam releases and is a much better run at levels of about 600 cubic feet per second 16990 l s or about 5 feet 1.5 m on the internet gauge for that section
lines.name: English

lines.value: a second whitewater section is found in tariffville connecticut one mile 1.6 km of technical class 3 water which is runnable all year round
lines.name: English

lines.value: the river is normally paddled at levels between 1.5 and 2.75 feet 45-75 cm on the internet gauge above 2.5 feet 75 cm it becomes significantly heavier and more dangerous
lines.name: English

lines.value: this section includes the famous t ville hole where kayakers can practice hole surfing and freestyle moves above a flat pool
lines.name: English

lines.value: below the hole is a broken dam where the river funnels through an abrupt four foot drop into a large wave
lines.name: English

lines.value: this area is popular with swimmers in summer and it is risky due to heavy currents and undercut rocks
lines.name: English

lines.value: there have been at least three fatal drownings in the tariffville gorge section primarily people who were not properly prepared or trained for the heavy rapids and pinning obstacles in the gorge
lines.name: English

lines.value: paddlers without helmets lifejackets and class 3 whitewater skills should end downriver trips at tariffville park just above the start of the gorge
lines.name: English

lines.value: other whitewater areas include satan's kingdom in new hartford connecticut which is popular with tubers and the crystal rapids section in collinsville and unionville connecticut which is about four miles 6 km of class 1-3 training waters with a bicycle and pedestrian path on the right side of the river
lines.name: English

lines.value: entrance to the park is free
lines.name: English

lines.value: a service will also pick tubers up and drop them off at certain points
lines.name: English

lines.value: the west branch of the river includes two hydroelectric dams in west hartland and colebrook run by connecticut's metropolitan district commission
lines.name: English

lines.value: the largest dam on the east branch is the saville dam which impounds the barkhamsted reservoir
lines.name: English

lines.value: the rainbow dam a dam with a hydroelectric generator and a fish ladder dams the river at windsor a few miles before the river flows into the connecticut river
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of other dams have been built on the river since european settlement usually to power mills and other industry
lines.name: English

lines.value: a few such as in collinsville are still mostly intact
lines.name: English

lines.value: the collinsville renewable energy promotion act hr 316;113th congress would instruct the federal energy regulatory commission to issue licenses to the town of canton connecticut to restart two small power dams along the river
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bill passed the united states house of representatives on february 12 2013 but has not yet become law
lines.name: English

lines.value: water released from or flowing over the otis reservoir dam enters the farmington river just north of reservoir road in otis massachusetts
lines.name: English

lines.value: significant quantities of water are released during the fall in order to drop the reservoir water level for the winter
lines.name: English

lines.value: the farmington river was the home of a native american indigenous people called the massaco who inhabited the simsbury and canton area of connecticut
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of the eighteen bands of the wappinger they lived and fished along the river which later acquired the name farmington the land of the massaco was subsequently purchased by the dutch
lines.name: English

lines.value: this and its settlement during the era of the connecticut colony are described in the early history of simsbury
lines.name: English

lines.value: the spoonville dam built on the farmington river in 1899 below the tariffville gorge in east granby was breached in the flood of 1955 and remained as a partial dam for several decades before being removed in july 2012
lines.name: English

lines.value: the dam as well as the bridge crossing the farmington river downstream at route 187 derived its name from the silver plating factory erected in 1840 on the north bank of the river
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was the first factory of its kind in the united states
lines.name: English

lines.value: several old bridges constructed in the 19th century and early 20th century still span the farmington river to this day
lines.name: English

lines.value: among these are
lines.name: English

lines.value: the farmington river and its tributaries are known to contain 11 species of freshwater mussels
lines.name: English

lines.value: the farmington has the highest mussel species diversity of any tributary to the connecticut lacking only the yellow lampmussel which is found only in the mainstem of the connecticut from turners falls ma downriver to windsor ct
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam motor car company limited was a british motor car manufacturer with its works at moorfields in blakenhall a suburb of wolverhampton in the county of staffordshire now west midlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: its sunbeam name had been registered by john marston in 1888 for his bicycle manufacturing business
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam motor car manufacture began in 1901
lines.name: English

lines.value: the motor business was sold to a newly incorporated sunbeam motor car company limited in 1905 to separate it from marston's pedal bicycle business sunbeam motorcycles were not made until 1912
lines.name: English

lines.value: in house designer coatalen's enthusiasm for motor racing accumulated expertise with engines
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam manufactured their own aero engines during the first world war and 647 aircraft to the designs of other manufacturers
lines.name: English

lines.value: engines drew sunbeam into grand prix racing and participation in the achievement of world land speed records
lines.name: English

lines.value: in spite of its well regarded cars and aero engines by 1934 a long period of very slow sales had incurred continuing losses
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam was unable to repay money borrowed for ten years in 1924 to fund its grand prix racing programme and a receiver was appointed
lines.name: English

lines.value: there was a forced sale and sunbeam was picked up by the rootes brothers
lines.name: English

lines.value: manufacture of sunbeam's now old fashioned cars did not resume under the new owners but sunbeam trolleybuses remained in production
lines.name: English

lines.value: rootes had intended to sell luxury cars under the sunbeam name but nearly four years later in 1938 the two brothers instead chose to add the name sunbeam to their talbot branded range of rootes designs calling them sunbeam talbots
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1954 they dropped the word talbot leaving just sunbeam
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam continued to appear as a marque name on new cars until 1976
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was then used as a model name firstly for the chrysler sunbeam from 1977 to 1979 and following the takeover of chrysler europe by psa group for the talbot sunbeam from 1979 through to its discontinuation in 1981
lines.name: English

lines.value: john marston the london educated son of a sometime mayor of ludlow and landowner had been apprenticed to edward perry tinplate works master and twice mayor of wolverhampton
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1859 aged 23 marston bought two other tinplate manufacturers in bilston four miles away and set himself up on his own account
lines.name: English

lines.value: on perry's death marston bought his jeddo works in paul street wolverhampton left bilston and continued perry's business
lines.name: English

lines.value: an avid cyclist in 1887 he established his sunbeamland cycle factory in his paul street premises manufacturing and assembling pedal bicycles he branded sunbeam
lines.name: English

lines.value: his sunbeam trademark was registered in 1893
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1895 a company john marston limited was incorporated and took ownership of john marston's business
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sunbeam trademark was registered for motor cars in 1900
lines.name: English

lines.value: rugby educated thomas cureton 1863 1921 began as his apprentice then became marston's right hand man in the cycle works and the cautious advocate of a motor car venture
lines.name: English

lines.value: their board of directors did not favour it but marston and cureton continued their project
lines.name: English

lines.value: between 1899 and 1901 sunbeam produced a number of experimental cars driven about wolverhampton but none was offered for sale
lines.name: English

lines.value: in late 1900 they announced the purchase in blakenhall of a large area of land in upper villiers street for the erection of works for the manufacture of cars alongside the premises of marston's villiers engineering business
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first announcement of their new autocar was in 22 september 1900 issue of the autocar but no full description was provided to the public until february 1901
lines.name: English

lines.value: it would be supplied with a 2-seater body on a channel steel frame powered by a 4-horsepower horizontal engine with electric ignition intended to run at 700 rpm and have two forward speeds and reverse using belt drive to differential gears on the live axle
lines.name: English

lines.value: dimensions weight 10 cwt overall measurements 84 inches by 57 inches
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first production car branded sunbeam was not marston and cureton's but a car designed and developed by a young architect maxwell mabberly smith powered by a single cylinder 2¾ horsepower de dion engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: described as a sociable it carried two passengers sitting close together facing the roadside from above a central belt drive
lines.name: English

lines.value: to begin with they faced opposite roadsides
lines.name: English

lines.value: this layout provided propinquity while maintaining propriety
lines.name: English

lines.value: their driver at his tiller sat behind them his body facing the opposite roadside
lines.name: English

lines.value: wheels were arranged in a diamond formation
lines.name: English

lines.value: they used a frame like a motorised quadracycle version of starley's coventry rotary and were to be referred to by the automotor journal as the curiously light vehicles with which their sunbeam name has for some time been associated
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sunbeam mabley was a limited success several hundred sold in 1901 and 1902 at £130
lines.name: English

lines.value: more stock was still in the sunbeam catalogue in early 1904 with the following specification single cylinder 74 x 76 mm
lines.name: English

lines.value: 327 cc engine designed to run at 1800 rpm 2-speed gearbox central wheels driven by belt then chain drives from the differential
lines.name: English

lines.value: weight 4½ cwt
lines.name: English

lines.value: price £120
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the annual stanley cycle show in november 1902 sunbeam thoroughly approved by the magazine's correspondent displayed beside more mableys a 12-horsepower four cylinder car with the engine beneath a bonnet at the front camshaft within the crank chamber a four speed gearbox and all four artillery wheels of the same size fitted with pneumatic tyres
lines.name: English

lines.value: price 500 guineas or £525
lines.name: English

lines.value: listed in february 1904 its specification was four cylinders 80 x 120 mm
lines.name: English

lines.value: 1527 cc engine designed to run at 1000 rpm four speed gearbox rear wheels driven by chain drives from the differential
lines.name: English

lines.value: weight 16 cwt
lines.name: English

lines.value: price £512
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february 1904 the 12-horsepower car was given a six cylinder 16-horsepower stablemate
lines.name: English

lines.value: like the 12 the new engine was designed to give its full power at what were even then considered low engine speeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: particular note was made that special attention had once more been paid to further controlling the airflow beneath the car's apron and the chassis to reduce that bane of passengers comfort the car's disturbance of dust on the road
lines.name: English

lines.value: the new car also featured chain cases so the chains ran in oil were rendered almost silent and were protected from dirt
lines.name: English

lines.value: london born thomas charles willis pullinger 1866-1945 joined sunbeam in 1902
lines.name: English

lines.value: he had repaired then made bicycles and then in 1891 was sent by humber to france for humber's joint venture with gladiator but humber struck difficulties and pullinger stayed in france with alexandre darracq as darracq's designer and personal assistant
lines.name: English

lines.value: he moved on as works manager to other french firms designing perhaps the first small car and certainly designing the first water cooled cylinder head
lines.name: English

lines.value: very keen to design and build his own car he moved back to england and arrived at sunbeam in wolverhampton on a motor quadracycle he had built himself
lines.name: English

lines.value: he prepared a report for the sunbeam directors and delivered it on 11 november 1902
lines.name: English

lines.value: his first recommendation was that sunbeam should buy in a car from an established firm then as sales built up buy them without certain components which would instead be made by sunbeam until all that was bought in would be an engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: the report concluded with his advice that the cars should be supplied to sunbeam by berliet
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also advised the remaining stock of mabley cars should be sold off as quickly as possible
lines.name: English

lines.value: a decision was made to sell shares in the company to the general public
lines.name: English

lines.value: some of the board approved because they could see much growth ahead some only because they wanted other people to come in to cut back on their own risk
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 31 january 1905 the architect signed the plans for the new motorcar buildings on the land in upper villiers street
lines.name: English

lines.value: in january 1905 the sunbeam motor car company ltd was formed to purchase and remove motor cars and their villiers street works from the rest of the john marston business which retained sunbeam cycles
lines.name: English

lines.value: six years later after several further issues of shares to provide capital for greater expansion there was a technically public offer of ordinary and preference shares to sunbeam agents and their customers representing a small part of the company's capital
lines.name: English

lines.value: twelve months later in january 1912 its shares were formally listed on the london stock exchange and sunbeam became a public listed company
lines.name: English

lines.value: the breton car designer louis coatalen joined sunbeam from hillman coatalen in 1909 and became chief designer
lines.name: English

lines.value: he soon reorganised production so almost all parts were built in house instead of relying on outside suppliers with their variable quality
lines.name: English

lines.value: he quickly introduced his first design the sunbeam 14/20 their first to use a shaft driven rear axle
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was upgraded in 1911 with a slightly larger engine and rebranded 16/20
lines.name: English

lines.value: coatalen also designed a number of passenger cars notably the sunbeam 12 16
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1911 sunbeam were building about 650 cars a year and were regarded as a substantial motor manufacturer
lines.name: English

lines.value: wolseley sold 3000 cars of similar quality in 1913
lines.name: English

lines.value: ford sold 6000 model ts that same year assembled at trafford park manchester
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1914 ford switched on britain's first moving assembly line for car production and it began its run at a rate of 21 cars an hour
lines.name: English

lines.value: ;aero engines in 1912 they began to make aircraft engines introducing a series of engines that were not a commercial success
lines.name: English

lines.value: coatalen seemed to believe the proper solution was a bespoke design for an aircraft designer's requirements instead of designing and producing a successful engine to let the aircraft designers build their aircraft around it
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam's designs included the troublesome v8 sunbeam arab which was ordered in quantity in 1917 but suffered from continual vibration and reliability problems and only saw limited service and the more successful v12 sunbeam cossack
lines.name: English

lines.value: meanwhile coatalen continued to experiment with ever more odd designs such as the star layout sunbeam malay which never got beyond a prototype the air cooled sunbeam spartan and the diesel powered sunbeam pathan
lines.name: English

lines.value: however sunbeam was successful with the introduction of newer manufacturing techniques and became one of the first to build aluminium single block engines a design that would not become common until the 1930s
lines.name: English

lines.value: ;vehicles and aircraft during the first world war sunbeam built trucks and ambulances
lines.name: English

lines.value: it also participated in the society of british aircraft constructors pool which shared aircraft designs with anyone that could build them
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this role sunbeam produced 15 short bombers powered by their own sunbeam gurkha engines 20 short type 827s 50 short 310s and others including avro 504 trainers they even designed their own sunbeam bomber which lost to a somewhat simpler sopwith design
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam had produced 647 aircraft of various types by the time the lines shut down in early 1919
lines.name: English

lines.value: marston's third son roland had been expected to take over as chairman of sunbeam but he suddenly died in march 1918 and john marston himself died the morning after roland's funeral
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was aged 82
lines.name: English

lines.value: cureton was already in poor health and would die in 1921
lines.name: English

lines.value: they had made coatalen a joint managing director in 1914 alongside william marklew iliff 1873-1957
lines.name: English

lines.value: in june 1920 darracq bought wolverhampton's sunbeam motor car company limited
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1919 following the first world war darracq had bought a london motor manufacturer clement-talbot
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sunbeam talbot and darracq businesses retained their separate identities
lines.name: English

lines.value: the sunbeam car would continue to be made at moorfield works wolverhampton the talbot in north kensington and the darracq at suresnes with central buying selling administration and advertising departments with s t d in britain on 13 august 1920 darracq changed its name to s t d motors limited
lines.name: English

lines.value: the initials represented sunbeam talbot and darracq
lines.name: English

lines.value: std motors limited had been first incorporated in london in 1905 at that time bearing the name a darracq and company 1905 limited though it continued to manufacture its darracq cars in suresnes paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam did not survive the great depression
lines.name: English

lines.value: it fell into receivership in 1934 and was sold by the receiver to the rootes brothers
lines.name: English

lines.value: when at its height in the 1920s sunbeam motor car company's moorfield works employed 3500 staff on their 50-acre site
lines.name: English

lines.value: the buildings covered a full 15 acres
lines.name: English

lines.value: under vscc rules all cars made in wolverhampton at least qualify as post vintage thoroughbreds
lines.name: English

lines.value: all cars built before the end of the first world war are covered by the vcc
lines.name: English

lines.value: coatalen's obsession with improvement meant that there were numerous small changes in models from year to year
lines.name: English

lines.value: therefore although his designs are basically similar few parts are interchangeable
lines.name: English

lines.value: two models dominated production the most successful judged by volumes was the 16 hp 16.9 followed by 20 hp 20.9 made from 1926 to 1930
lines.name: English

lines.value: whilst the 16 was solid and very reliable it was a little underpowered at 2.1 litres the 20.9 made a big jump to 3 litres and with similar body weight and vacuum servo brakes and was capable of
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam built their own bodies but also supplied to the coachbuilder trade many limousines were built on sunbeam chassis
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam wolverhampton england started to build aircraft engines in 1912
lines.name: English

lines.value: louis coatalen joined sunbeam as chief engineer in 1909 having previously been chief engineer at the humber works in coventry
lines.name: English

lines.value: the company quickly became one of the uk's leading engine manufacturers and even designed an aircraft of its own
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam discontinued the production of aero engines after coatalen left the company in the 1930s
lines.name: English

lines.value: sunbeam's great era was really the 1920s under coatalen's leadership with very well engineered high quality reliable cars and a great reputation on the track
lines.name: English

lines.value: coatalen was pleased to build racing cars for henry segrave,who won the french and spanish gps in 1923/4
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1921 segrave participated in his first ever grand prix on talbot no.10 in effect a rebadged 1921 grand prix sunbeam this important straight eight dohc four valve per cylinder aluminium block car influenced by the great designer ernest henry proceeded to win the 1922 tourist trophy in the hands of jean chassagne
lines.name: English

lines.value: a different team of 2-litre dohc 1922 grand prix sunbeams designed by ernest henry were entered in that year's french grand prix
lines.name: English

lines.value: he also built a brooklands racer with a purpose built v12 18.3-litre engine whose design was a hybrid of the sunbeam manitou and the sunbeam arab aero engines
lines.name: English

lines.value: this engine had four blocks of three cylinders arranged in two banks set at 60 degrees unlike the arab which were set at 90 degrees
lines.name: English

lines.value: each cylinder had one inlet and two exhaust valves actuated by a single overhead camshaft
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two camshafts were driven by a complex set of 16 gears from the front of the crankshaft - a very similar arrangement to that used on the maori engine which had two ohc per bank of cylinders
lines.name: English

lines.value: this famous car sunbeam 350hp established three land speed records the first achieved by kenelm lee guinness at brooklands in 1922 with a speed of 133.75 mph
lines.name: English

lines.value: malcolm campbell then purchased the car had it painted in his distinctive colour scheme named it blue bird and in september 1924 achieved a new record speed of 146.16 mph at pendine sands in south wales raising it the following year to 150.76 mph
lines.name: English

lines.value: the same year coatalen's new 3-litre super sports came 2nd at le mans beating bentley - this was the first production twin cam car in the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1926 segrave captured the lsr in a new 4-litre v12 sunbeam racer originally named ladybird and later renamed tiger
lines.name: English

lines.value: coatalen decided to reenter the lsr field himself building the truly gigantic sunbeam 1000hp powered by two matabele engines
lines.name: English

lines.value: on 29 march 1927 the car captured the speed record at
lines.name: English

lines.value: the car is now at the national motor museum beaulieu uka later land speed record attempt with the 1930 silver bullet failed to achieve either records or the hoped for advances in aero engines

lines.value: rootes was an early proponent of badge engineering building a single mass produced chassis and equipping it with different body panels and interiors to fit different markets

lines.value: they ended production of existing models at all the new companies replacing them with designs from hillman and humber that were more amenable to mass production

lines.value: although rootes intention had been to continue the sunbeam name on a large and expensive luxury car the eight cylinder sunbeam 30 after almost four years it was announced sunbeam motors and clement talbot were now combined under the ownership of clement talbot limited - since renamed sunbeam talbot limited - and would produce good quality cars at reasonable prices
lines.name: English

lines.value: during 1937 humber limited bought clement talbot limited and sunbeam motors limited from rootes securities limited
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1938 rootes created a new marque called sunbeam talbot which combined the quality talbot coachwork and the current hillman and humber chassis and was assembled at the talbot factory in london
lines.name: English

lines.value: the initial two models were the sunbeam talbot 10 and the 3-litre followed by the sunbeam talbot 2 litre and 4-litre models based on the earlier models only with different engines and longer wheelbases

lines.value: production of these models continued after the war until 1948

lines.value: in the summer of 1948 the sunbeam talbot 80 and sunbeam talbot 90 were introduced with a totally new streamlined design with flowing front fenders wings
lines.name: English

lines.value: the 80 used the hillman minx based engine with ohv and the 90 used a modified version of the humber hawk with ohv

lines.value: the car bodies were manufactured by another rootes group company british light steel pressings of acton however the convertible drophead coupe shells were completed by thrupp & maberly coachbuilders in cricklewood

lines.value: the 90 was renamed the 90 mark ii and then the 90 mark iia and eventually in 1954 the sunbeam mark iii finally dropping the talbot name

lines.value: with the model name changes the headlights were raised on the front fenders and an independent coil front suspension and the engine displacement went from 1944 cc to 2267 cc with a high compression head and developing

lines.value: there was one more model of the sunbeam talbot that appeared in 1953 in the form of an alpine a two seater sports roadster which was initially developed by a sunbeam talbot dealer george hartwell in bournemouth as a one off rally car that had its beginnings as a 1952 drophead coupe
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was named supposedly by norman garrad works competition department who was heavily involved in the sunbeam talbot successes in the alpine rally in the early 1950s using the saloon model

lines.value: the alpine mark i and mark iii a mark ii was never made were hand built like the drophead coupe at thrupp & maberly coachbuilders from 1953 to 1955 when production ceased after close to 3000 were produced

lines.value: it has been estimated that perhaps only 200 remain in existence today

lines.value: production ceased in 1956 and was replaced by the sporty sunbeam rapier

lines.value: after several successful series of the alpine were released director of us west coast operations ian garrad became interested in the success of the ac cobra which mounted a small block v 8 engine in the small ac ace frame to create one of the most successful sports cars of all time
lines.name: English

lines.value: garrad became convinced the alpine frame could also be adapted the same way and contracted carroll shelby to prototype such a fit with a ford engine

lines.value: the result was the sunbeam tiger released in 1964 which went on to be a huge success racking up 7000 units in its 3 years of production compared with 70000 over 9 years for the small engined car

lines.value: but at this point rootes was in financial trouble

lines.value: talks with leyland motors went nowhere so in 1964 30 percent of the company along with 50 percent of the non voting shares was purchased by chrysler who was attempting to enter the european market

lines.value: models were abandoned over the next few years while they tried to build a single brand from the best models of each of the company's components but for management best typically meant cheapest to produce which was at odds with the former higher quality rootes philosophy

lines.value: brand loyalty started to erode and was greatly damaged when they decided to drop former marques and start calling everything a chrysler
